story:
Rutendo CD Fund!!

Hello! Our band members (Reed Bentley, Lindsay Campbell, Jeffri Carrington, Jan Christensen, Casey Frieder, Joshua Graner, Ron Hart, John Johns, Koeby Johnson, and Justin Wagner) are asking for your assistance with our very first CD. 

We are so stoked on this album! Half of the tracks are live recordings, and the other half were recorded in the studio. It includes songs such as "Gandanga", "Bangidza", "Jabberwocky", and "Kanimambo" (an original by Chris Berry!).

If you are able to help us bring this album to fruition, we would be so grateful! You can do this simply by pre-ordering your CD now! Just click on the $20 perk on the right side of this screen. If you can contribute more, please check out the other neat perks we are offering such as a private concert!!

We will be having a CD release party on April 15th at Hidden Springs in Ashland, OR. You are all cordially invited to celebrate with us and can pick up your pre-ordered CD's there! If you are unable to attend we will send them via mail, or have a special pick-up location.

Financial Breakdown

We need to raise $2400 to cover the all the costs that are involved. This includes:

  • Album cover design - $300
  • CD printing - $1200
  • Recording engineering/mixing - $900

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our campaign with your friends and family! We are so excited to share this grateful album with you.

story:
I Love Music.

As most all of you know, I have a passion for creating and playing music, and would love to continue doing so for the rest of my life. This opportunity is about my music. It is a once in a lifetime chance to get one of my songs professionally produced, and by my favorite artist. 

The name of this Artist/producer is Aaron Gillespie. Aaron started out as the drummer of a highly popular and Grammy-nominated hard-rock/hardcore band named Underoath. After doing many years recording, writing, and touring with them, he went his own way and started writing simple rock songs in a band that he started called The Almost, as well as compiling original worship albums. At this point, he is performing back on a reunion tour with Underoath, and leading worship at many churches across the United States. He recently got into producing, and as a result of that, I have been e-mailing back and forth with him to figure out how I could make this work. 

Due to several generous contributions inside and outside of this campaign, I have been able to reserve a spot and book a date at Aaron's studio in Salt Lake City, Utah. The recording will happen August 10-11 if I am financially able to work it out.

 The demo I have done with the help of my musician and engineer friends (see YouTube video at the beginning of this) is  great to go off of for starters, but the production that would be done with this potential project would make this song the quality of a major song on the radio.

This is extremely exciting, but, as a college student, I cannot do it without financial help. 

So... About the Money...

Up until now all of my funding for music production has come out of my own pocket. While I have been working extra hours at my two jobs, and even selling things on Craigslist to raise money for this project, school bills are starting to come down on me and I just simply don't have what I need to fund this amazing opportunity on my own.

I am asking for $1,650. That is a lot, but I can break it down very simply so you know exactly where your money would go.

Where your funding would go: 

  • All the Recording, Mixing, Editing, and Polishing will add up to around $1500.
  • The Mastering itself will be around $150. Mastering is basically creating the "final product." It is polishing up the track, and making the volumes sync and all the EQ's of the track ready for iTunes, Spotify, Radio, etc.
If you donate any amount at all, and the project goes through, I will personally send you a free download link for the finished track.
If you donate $100 or more, I will get you the download link, put your name into the credits when the single is released, and send you a merch box that will have things like t-shirts, hats, and the like.
Any amount helps.
Because I have already been able to reserve a spot at the studio, the donations accrued from this point forward will be in aid of making this happen in reality, and solidifying the opportunity.
Just as I said, literally any amount that you give would help get my song and my music in general, out there to gain exposure. 
If I raise more than enough funds, the money will go directly into the extended post-production of the other songs on Onward EP. 

More Than Just A Song.

This song, "Separation," means a lot to me. I wrote it when I was struggling through a long-distance relationship that was very hard. The process of writing, being angry, being hurt, and ultimately turning to God was a process that I still look back on as a cherished, and at times not so cherished memory.

However, this song is more than that. Ever since I wrote it, I have expanded the message and purpose of the song in my head to encapsulate a lot more than just relationships. To me, it represents the struggle of faith, and the struggle of facing adversity with resolute peace that is found in Christ. We all struggle, but it is the struggles that prove to us what really matters, and help define our values. 

Here is the chorus of the song, so that you can gain a better picture: 

"I think I see the point in all of this, but it's getting foggy now. 

Oh Separation creates this hole in us, it's so unclear!

Soon well see it's not as endless as it seems now

Father give me strength to see, in truth and love."

This philosophy is also found in the music that Aaron plays and writes. I think working with him would be a great experience and give me the opportunity to get my music out there, and to make connections in ways that I did not even think possible. 

Risks & Challenges

As in any campaign, there is risk. Just because it is an incredibly well mixed and mastered single does not mean that it will make any waves in the highly competitive world of modern music. I am not in any way promising this. But there is a hope. And that hope is what drives me to keep trying.

Don't Have Money? No Problem.

If you just don't have money to donate, I completely understand. However, money is not the only way that you can help make this campaign successful. Sharing, whether that be through word of mouth, or through social media platforms like Facebook or Instagram, can be just as effective and sometimes even more, to gain support for this project. Through my campaign link, Indiegogo has many sharing tools that make it very easy to do so.

story:
(version française en bas de la page)

INTRODUCTION

Montreal basement producer and street racing mechanic, SIMm will bring you along a sweet ride through his native ‘’cheese city’’.

Get into his ‘’future nostalgia’’, filled with chicken-greased guitar ,G funk whistling synth and futurebass chopped vocals. Times and style has no more boundary. Get a burger at 4 in the morning in a parking lot while the car stereo is playing some old Dazz Band and Midnight Star.

WHERE DOES THE MONEY GO? 

We are currently finishing our musical portfolio. This 4 + 1 songs mixtape has almost been fully recorded. What we need now is: 

1)Recording the vocals with some wicked gear, a microphone and a preamp that we will finally buy and own. 

2)We  need to master the 5 songs. 

Your contribution towards our goal of $5000 will help to make that happen. 

 microphone Gefell UM92.1S  (used) 2700$ + taxes

pre amp BAE 1073MP 1302$ + taxes 

mastering 300$

In return for asking for help to achieve our goal we will be offering you a number of packages to suit every budget. Every single penny counts and is appreciated, even a small $1 donation.  Take a look at each perk for more details on our offerings.  We appreciate your consideration in joining us on this project. 

OTHER WAY YOU CAN HELP.

Spread the word! Share our campaign on Facebook, Twitter or whatever you guys are using and tell all your friends and family about it!

Thank you,

en français svp :)

INTRODUCTION

Laissez vous emporter par la ‘’nostalgie futuriste’’ de  SIMm, une ‘’ride’’ cinematic sans limite temporelle et stylistique, le ''funk'' rencontre le ''future bass''; aussi agréable qu’un hamburger dans le parking d’une ‘’belle province’’, à 4 heure du matin, en été, une bleue caché sous le banc de l’auto.

POURQUOI?

SIMm finit actuellement la réalisation de son portfolio sonore qui sera composer de 11 chansons dont 4 d’entre elles sortiront sous la forme d’un EP (MIXTAPE).

OU VAS L'ARGENT?

Le portfolio est deja presque terminé et il ne manque plus qu’à enregistrer les ''vocals''.Pour ce, Nous avons besoin d’un nouveau micro et d’un nouveau préamp, (que nous posséderons enfin). Nous avons également besoin de faire masterniser les 5 chansons qui paraitront sur le EP (MIXTAPE). votre contributions nous aidera à parvenir à réaliser ce projet.

 microphone Gefell UM92.1S  (used) 2700$ + taxes

pre amp BAE 1073MP 1302$ + taxes 

mastering 300$

En échange de votre aide, nous vous offrons une série de ‘’package’’ qui conviendront à tous les budgets. chaque dollars compte et sera apprécié . Une simple contribution de 1$ fera la difference.

LES ''PERKS'' (CE QUE VOUS RECEVREZ EN ECHANGE DE VOTRE DON)

  1$ vous recevrez de l’amour digital :)

  5$ vous recevrez un code pour telecharger le EP (4 CHANSONS)

  15$vous recevrez un code pour telecharger le EP (4 CHANSONS) + un jolie carte postale full formage :)

  25$vous recevrez un code pour telecharger le EP + un jolie carte postale full fromage :) + une chanson Xtra

  65$vous recevrez un code pour telecharger le EP + un jolie carte postale choisie avec amour + le reste du portfolio (top secret) + un t shirt SIMm.

 100$je vous produis votre propre ‘’beat’’ à votre image.

 500$je vous produis votre propre chanson instrumental sur le theme que vous choisirez.

1000$ je vous produis une chanson au complet, sans compromis, juste pour vous :)

COMMENT AIDER PLUS?

Faites circuler le mot sur Facebook, twitter, instaurais .. parlez en à vos amis, votre famille, votre épicier, votre voisin.

full amour au fromage :)

story:
We need your help and cooperation for KIRILOLA's Spiral Tour in Europe.

"Spiral" means "Eternal Life" or "Connection between every life" for Native Americans.

It shows us uprising to the bright future!

Let's send KIRILOLA's voice of sympathy and spirit of compassion to Europe, such as Finland, Estonia and Italy!!!

We wish KIRILOLA's voice could give some courage to Europeans and make their eyes shining.

   KIRILOLA:

Leader of "eX-Girl", Japanese Rock Band consisted of three women.


キリロラ☆欧州スパイラルツアーにご協力をお願いいたします。

スパイラルは、ネイティブアメリカンでは、「永遠の命」「すべての命の繋がり」を表現し、未来への明るい上昇志向を象徴します。

欧州に、キリロラ☆さんの共鳴の唄声を届けましょう。

森と湖の国フィンランドとバルトの雄エストニア。

そして、地中海の中心、美と歴史が生きる国イタリアに、キリロラ☆さんの唄声を響かせましょう！

欧州の人々に勇気を与え、彼らの感性を輝かせる事でしょう。

story:
Short Summary

Hi. My name is Freddy Villano and I am the bassist, co-songwriter, co-producer and founding member of American Mafia. I am launching this campaign to help offset costs associated with mixing and mastering American Mafia's new, forthcoming 5-song EP, tentatively titled Made in New York. This new EP will feature the line-up of Don Chaffin (vocals), Tom Jude (guitar), Freddy Villano (bass) and Bobby Marks (drums). Mixing and mastering a CD is quite possibly the most crucial step in the record-making process and requires a pretty substantial investment for a quality result. We believe we’ve come up with a modest budget that will help us reach our goal (with your help of course!).

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is $7500. We believe that amount will cover the costs associated with mixing and mastering the EP (mixing is already underway!). We’ve already done everything else that needs to happen, from tracking vocals, guitar, bass and drums, to some preliminary editing and rough mixing. The EP is already a year in the making and your contribution will help expedite the completion of the EP so that we can get it into a 2017 release schedule. 

We will once again be using the team of Michael Harmon (Studio Crash) to mix and Chris Muth (Taloowa Corporation) to master. Both of these cats are well-renowned in their respective fields and did a stellar job on our debut CD, Rock N' Roll Hit Machine, so we already know they do extremely high quality work on air tight budgets. We are confident we will get the best results from these two esteemed professionals. You can learn more about them both here if you are interested:

Michael Harmon & Studio Crash: http://www.studiocrash.com

Chris Muth & Taloowa Corporation: http://taloowa.com

We are offering many unique perks in exchange for your contribution. We will have autographed copies of American Mafia’s debut CD, Rock N' Roll Hit Machine (Grooveyard Records) available as well as autographed CDs of The Collected Sessions (Perris Records) by Holy Water. The autographed Collected Sessions CDs are exclusive to this Indiegogo campaign and can’t be found anywhere else. They are also limited to 70 copies. Holy Water was the band that directly preceded American Mafia and features some of the same musicians, many of whom performed and/or recorded with Foreigner, Quiet Riot, Dokken, Saraya, Widowmaker, Doro Pesch and more. This is a really unique perk that you won’t find anywhere else. And they are all autographed by these amazing players!

We are also making available a limited number of American Mafia t-shirts. Again this will be a limited supply item exclusive to this Indiegogo campaign. These are all essentially one-of-a-kind, airbrushed designs. If someone sees you with one of these particular t-shirts, they will know you are a contributor. It's a badge of honor!

Everyone who contributes will get listed in the liner notes of the new EP under a “special thanks” category. Tom is also making available personalized guitar picks from his personal collection for a very modest contribution.  Don is offering some Voices of Extreme  (his other band) swag and we will have American  Mafia posters available, signed by Don, Tom, Freddy and Bobby.

We are also offering a private showcase. We thought this would be a nice, once-in-a-lifetime chance to go behind the scenes and watch the band run through their set on a professional soundstage BEFORE they perform their first-ever live show. You’ll have a chance to get autographs, hang with the band, take video and participate in your own private concert!  How cool is that? We may also want to film this event for a future documentary, so there's that too!

Lastly, I'm making available some merch from my touring days with Quiet Riot and Widowmaker (featuring Dee Snider from Twisted Sister). There are a few "Down to the Bone" posters form the "Bury the Bone" tour I did with Quiet Riot as well as a commemorative t-shirt from our gig at the Limelight in NYC on August 23rd, 1995. There are also some Widowmaker shirts, a Finger Lakes Metal Fest shirt from the time I played there with Awaken and a cool Limelight shirt from the early 90s. None of the t-shirts have ever been worn and I think I can safely say, you won't find them anywhere else. There are many other perks as well, so please take some time to peruse the site.

Even if we do not reach our $7500 goal, all contributions will still go towards mixing and mastering the new EP. We are running what Indiegogo calls a "flexible" campaign so that we can allocate whatever we raise to help offset that expense. We truly feel that every contribution will help us meet our ultimate goal, which is releasing a new EP in 2017.

The Impact

We’re not curing cancer and we don’t have any plans to release the next, most amazingly efficient clean energy product, but music is inherently important to people. American Mafia has a modest audience at this point, and even if only a fraction of you contribute, we are sure to reach our goal.  The consensus among our supporters thus far is that they love what we do, so we hope to broaden our appeal with this new release and bring our particular brand of rock and roll to as many people as possible in 2017. The EP will help us accomplish that goal. And your contribution will help us complete the EP.

Our debut CD, Rock N’ Roll Hit Machine was released in August 2014 on Grooveyard Records to critical acclaim. Ross Welford at uberrock.co.uk called it “…the best classic rock album you've never heard." We feel that Hit Machine laid a solid foundation for us and has already paved the way for Made in New York to be an even greater success. Here’s what others have said about American Mafia and Rock N' Roll Hit Machine:

“This is a really awesome album, reminding me of the great late ’70s melodic rock…” Janne Stark / starkmusicreviews.blogspot.com

“Resurrecting the power, dynamic and earthy vibe of ’70s rock, American Mafia knocks it out of the ballpark with Rock N’ Roll Hit Machine.” Todd K. Smith / theelectricbeard.com

“Hard rock along the lines of Zeppelin or Bad Company at their best.” Steve Rosen / Journalist

“American Mafia have the songs and then some, from start to finish, this is a sure fire Rock N’ Roll Hit Machine.” Steve Reid / seaoftranquility.org

“A stellar slice of classic rock that feels both familiar and refreshingly new.” Derric Miller / hardrockhaven.net

“A hearty dose of classic, blues-soaked hard rock that brings back memories of Montrose, Led Zep, Robin Trower, etc.” Tony / thededicatedrockersociety.blogspot.com

Hopefully, the fact that we’ve already successfully released one record (two if you want to count The Collected Sessions) demonstrates that we have the wherewithal to follow through on our promise and this process.  We will not squander your contribution. We have already been blessed with immeasurable support from  from friends and colleagues, with regard to artwork (Mark), promotion (Donna), videos (Don), website (Don & Gina), studio time (Randy & Don) and more. Without them, Rock N' Roll Hit Machine wouldn't have been such a success. And without them, we wouldn't be here today, mixing a new EP. Success does not happen in a vacuum. It is the result of collaboration and teamwork and we feel that this is the ultimate collaborative invitation: to have fans, friends, family, colleagues, etc. participate in this final, yet most important part, of making a record. 

Risks & Challenges

I don't predict many obstacles to arise while accomplishing our objective. As I said previously, we have a flexible campaign, so we'll be able to keep whatever contributions you make, even if we don't meet our goal. This will allow us to offset some costs. Ideally, we reach our goal and expedite the completion of the EP. We'll be sure to honor all of the perks we're advertising. In the event that we don't meet the goal and it pushes the timing of a private showcase into question, we'll put together a package of goodies for those contributors that reflects the value of their contribution. Being an optimist, I truly believe we'll meet our goal. We look forward to sharing this incredible experience with you!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, that's ok too. Your support is still important and you can always help us "spread the word."  It would be of immeasurable help to us if you could share this fund raiser with people who might like our particular brand of rock and roll. One never knows where help might come from or who might want to participate in such an engaging endeavor. You can even use the Indiegogo's super smart sharing tool to help share it, but sharing it on Facebook, Twitter, Snapchat and/or whatever other social media network you prefer would be of immeasurable help too us when it comes to spreading the word about this campaign. This is a first for us, so we welcome you to come along for the ride!
story_txt:
Short Summary
Hi. My name is Freddy Villano and I am the bassist, co-songwriter, co-producer and founding member of American Mafia. I am launching this campaign to help offset costs associated with mixing and mastering American Mafia's new, forthcoming 5-song EP, tentatively titled Made in New York. This new EP will feature the line-up of Don Chaffin (vocals), Tom Jude (guitar), Freddy Villano (bass) and Bobby Marks (drums). Mixing and mastering a CD is quite possibly the most crucial step in the record-making process and requires a pretty substantial investment for a quality result. We believe we’ve come up with a modest budget that will help us reach our goal (with your help of course!).

What We Need & What You Get
Our goal is $7500. We believe that amount will cover the costs associated with mixing and mastering the EP (mixing is already underway!). We’ve already done everything else that needs to happen, from tracking vocals, guitar, bass and drums, to some preliminary editing and rough mixing. The EP is already a year in the making and your contribution will help expedite the completion of the EP so that we can get it into a 2017 release schedule. 
We will once again be using the team of Michael Harmon (Studio Crash) to mix and Chris Muth (Taloowa Corporation) to master. Both of these cats are well-renowned in their respective fields and did a stellar job on our debut CD, Rock N' Roll Hit Machine, so we already know they do extremely high quality work on air tight budgets. We are confident we will get the best results from these two esteemed professionals. You can learn more about them both here if you are interested:
Michael Harmon & Studio Crash: http://www.studiocrash.com
Chris Muth & Taloowa Corporation: http://taloowa.com
We are offering many unique perks in exchange for your contribution. We will have autographed copies of American Mafia’s debut CD, Rock N' Roll Hit Machine (Grooveyard Records) available as well as autographed CDs of The Collected Sessions (Perris Records) by Holy Water. The autographed Collected Sessions CDs are exclusive to this Indiegogo campaign and can’t be found anywhere else. They are also limited to 70 copies. Holy Water was the band that directly preceded American Mafia and features some of the same musicians, many of whom performed and/or recorded with Foreigner, Quiet Riot, Dokken, Saraya, Widowmaker, Doro Pesch and more. This is a really unique perk that you won’t find anywhere else. And they are all autographed by these amazing players!
We are also making available a limited number of American Mafia t-shirts. Again this will be a limited supply item exclusive to this Indiegogo campaign. These are all essentially one-of-a-kind, airbrushed designs. If someone sees you with one of these particular t-shirts, they will know you are a contributor. It's a badge of honor!
Everyone who contributes will get listed in the liner notes of the new EP under a “special thanks” category. Tom is also making available personalized guitar picks from his personal collection for a very modest contribution.  Don is offering some Voices of Extreme  (his other band) swag and we will have American  Mafia posters available, signed by Don, Tom, Freddy and Bobby.
We are also offering a private showcase. We thought this would be a nice, once-in-a-lifetime chance to go behind the scenes and watch the band run through their set on a professional soundstage BEFORE they perform their first-ever live show. You’ll have a chance to get autographs, hang with the band, take video and participate in your own private concert!  How cool is that? We may also want to film this event for a future documentary, so there's that too!
Lastly, I'm making available some merch from my touring days with Quiet Riot and Widowmaker (featuring Dee Snider from Twisted Sister). There are a few "Down to the Bone" posters form the "Bury the Bone" tour I did with Quiet Riot as well as a commemorative t-shirt from our gig at the Limelight in NYC on August 23rd, 1995. There are also some Widowmaker shirts, a Finger Lakes Metal Fest shirt from the time I played there with Awaken and a cool Limelight shirt from the early 90s. None of the t-shirts have ever been worn and I think I can safely say, you won't find them anywhere else. There are many other perks as well, so please take some time to peruse the site.
Even if we do not reach our $7500 goal, all contributions will still go towards mixing and mastering the new EP. We are running what Indiegogo calls a "flexible" campaign so that we can allocate whatever we raise to help offset that expense. We truly feel that every contribution will help us meet our ultimate goal, which is releasing a new EP in 2017.

The Impact
We’re not curing cancer and we don’t have any plans to release the next, most amazingly efficient clean energy product, but music is inherently important to people. American Mafia has a modest audience at this point, and even if only a fraction of you contribute, we are sure to reach our goal.  The consensus among our supporters thus far is that they love what we do, so we hope to broaden our appeal with this new release and bring our particular brand of rock and roll to as many people as possible in 2017. The EP will help us accomplish that goal. And your contribution will help us complete the EP.
Our debut CD, Rock N’ Roll Hit Machine was released in August 2014 on Grooveyard Records to critical acclaim. Ross Welford at uberrock.co.uk called it “…the best classic rock album you've never heard." We feel that Hit Machine laid a solid foundation for us and has already paved the way for Made in New York to be an even greater success. Here’s what others have said about American Mafia and Rock N' Roll Hit Machine:
“This is a really awesome album, reminding me of the great late ’70s melodic rock…” Janne Stark / starkmusicreviews.blogspot.com
“Resurrecting the power, dynamic and earthy vibe of ’70s rock, American Mafia knocks it out of the ballpark with Rock N’ Roll Hit Machine.” Todd K. Smith / theelectricbeard.com
“Hard rock along the lines of Zeppelin or Bad Company at their best.” Steve Rosen / Journalist
“American Mafia have the songs and then some, from start to finish, this is a sure fire Rock N’ Roll Hit Machine.” Steve Reid / seaoftranquility.org
“A stellar slice of classic rock that feels both familiar and refreshingly new.” Derric Miller / hardrockhaven.net
“A hearty dose of classic, blues-soaked hard rock that brings back memories of Montrose, Led Zep, Robin Trower, etc.” Tony / thededicatedrockersociety.blogspot.com
Hopefully, the fact that we’ve already successfully released one record (two if you want to count The Collected Sessions) demonstrates that we have the wherewithal to follow through on our promise and this process.  We will not squander your contribution. We have already been blessed with immeasurable support from  from friends and colleagues, with regard to artwork (Mark), promotion (Donna), videos (Don), website (Don & Gina), studio time (Randy & Don) and more. Without them, Rock N' Roll Hit Machine wouldn't have been such a success. And without them, we wouldn't be here today, mixing a new EP. Success does not happen in a vacuum. It is the result of collaboration and teamwork and we feel that this is the ultimate collaborative invitation: to have fans, friends, family, colleagues, etc. participate in this final, yet most important part, of making a record. 

Risks & Challenges
I don't predict many obstacles to arise while accomplishing our objective. As I said previously, we have a flexible campaign, so we'll be able to keep whatever contributions you make, even if we don't meet our goal. This will allow us to offset some costs. Ideally, we reach our goal and expedite the completion of the EP. We'll be sure to honor all of the perks we're advertising. In the event that we don't meet the goal and it pushes the timing of a private showcase into question, we'll put together a package of goodies for those contributors that reflects the value of their contribution. Being an optimist, I truly believe we'll meet our goal. We look forward to sharing this incredible experience with you!

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute financially, that's ok too. Your support is still important and you can always help us "spread the word."  It would be of immeasurable help to us if you could share this fund raiser with people who might like our particular brand of rock and roll. One never knows where help might come from or who might want to participate in such an engaging endeavor. You can even use the Indiegogo's super smart sharing tool to help share it, but sharing it on Facebook, Twitter, Snapchat and/or whatever other social media network you prefer would be of immeasurable help too us when it comes to spreading the word about this campaign. This is a first for us, so we welcome you to come along for the ride!

story:
Bless. My name is Bilal Abdulsamad. I'm a musical artist, singer, producer, and spiritual aspirant. As one-fourth of the multiplatinum-selling Motown Recording group 'The Boys', I've been a student of music since a very young age. Having gone through a few transformations throughout the years, from 'The Boys' to 'The Suns' to working on my solo albums as Baby B, I've gained a lot of experience, wisdom, and growth that has brought me to who I am today...Bilal Samadhi. I've also been studying various spiritual cultures over the years, learning different techniques and methods to empower one's self spiritually, mentally, and physically.  

This project is all about self-improvement. The vision is to create a 'care package' of key tools to help in one's spiritual development. The F.E.F. package will include three books, one cd of guided meditations, a cd of meditation music, two audio books, a full musical album, and a one-of-a-kind F.E.F. t-shirt. The album will contain songs with all positive, upful messages and family friendly music, yet still current and bump'n enough to groove to. This vision is a big part of my life's purpose; I see it expanding and growing to become something very strong and positive in the world. I ultimately intend to be your ambassador of positive mystic music. 

In these times it's important to stay balanced, at peace, and grounded in the sanctity of moment, and this project is aimed at assisting in that process . 

I am appreciative for your contribution and pre-order of F.E.F. Together, dreams do come true as we support each other in the manifestation of these dreams. If I am fortunate enough to execute this effort as it is envisioned, the album and production could make a huge impact on the music world, by the Grace.

I need to get some live instruments on this 'jone.' Some violin/strings, upright bass, harp, etc. - really make it epic! Your contribution will also go towards supporting the costs of printing, packaging, production, paying every one involved, mastering, promotions, distribution, and everything, overall, that will make the project as high quality as possible.

The fun perks I have for my supporters include:

Base Chakra 

At the Base Chakra you will receive a personal digital note and I’ll shout you out on the album.

Sacral Chakra

At the Sacral Chakra you will receive everything in the base chakra plus three of my solo albums (in digital format) 

Solar Plexus Chakra

At the Solar Plexus Chakra you will receive everything in the Base Chakra and the Sacral Chakra, plus an album credit, 'The Suns' albums, and a classic signed ‘The Boys’ photo (digital). You will also get a digital preliminary F.E.F. preview pack to get started on the journey, immediately.

Heart Chakra

At the Heart Chakra you will receive everything in the Base Chakra, Sacral Chakra, Solar Plexus Chakra and also a F.E.F. prep-pack that includes a crystal, incense, prayer beads, and a personally drawn Yantra (a geometric diagram used as an aid to meditation).

Throat Chakra

At the Throat Chakra you will receive everything in the Base Chakra, Sacral Chakra, Solar Plexus Chakra, and Heart Chakra, as well a USB drive with all sorts of goodies on it.

First Eye Chakra

At the First Eye Chakra you will receive everything in the Base Chakra, Sacral Chakra, Solar Plexus Chakra, Heart Chakra, and Throat Chakra, in addition to a personal chat session with me, VIP  access to any live shows, and a personal song directed by you.

Crown Chakra

At the Crown Chakra you will receive everything in the preceding six Chakras, plus a pair of Baba G’s one-of-a -kind sterling silver 'earwings', - AND - I will travel to you and add your voice and expression to the album.

Soul Star

At the Soul Star you will receive everything from the Base Chakra through the Crown Chakra (seven levels) plus a series of one-on-one yoga sessions with me, as well as a motivational video program to help guide you through the F.E.F. process.

If I do not reach my entire goal in the time allotted, I will still put whatever support I am blessed to receive into this project and will keep taking steps until the vision is fully manifested/complete.

The impact of this project will be immense. The launch of this portion of the project is just a blueprint to build upon, growing and transforming this into a powerful yet peaceful movement. Sharing positive vibes through text, meditations, and music is the vision. After hearing secular music all day you will want to come home and bathe yourself in these positive vibrations. Moving you away from the stresses of the day and toward the infinite abundance and supreme grace light within. This is music that will help us to be in tune and alignment with the vibratory shift that's happening on the planet at this time.

Please share this First Eye Focus Movement with the key ones and ones that you know will apprecialove it.

Let's embark upon this journey together. 

Together we will empower and uplift one another, By the Grace

LOVE

story:
What It's About

Like I said, I've been recording some crappy demos, by myself, for over four years now as Atheists - and much longer as various other pseudonyms. But over the past couple months, while writing and recording songs that will likely make up the bulk up my next record, I was struck with the idea that it was time to move into new territory - and that territory is actual, good-quality recording!

I reached out to some of my music-student friends from college (Hi Cam! Hi Ruby!) and asked their advice. Could I record at our alma mater? Should I not do that? I asked if they knew anyone with a home-based studio, or access to a real one. This is what led me to one of their classmates, Bobbi Giel, who has graciously agreed to help me with this project at the end of January. We are both going to be pushing and challenging ourselves with this project, especially given that we will only have less than 48 hours to record everything. So, things started to look up. Serendipity!

But now come the costs of such a venture, and that's where you kind folks come in.

What I Need & What You Get

The goal above says $500, but that's only because IndieGogo makes you put that as a minimum. Truthfully, I am only seeking what you are all willing to give. I would have probably set it $100 if I could have, but it isn't really about a minimum or maximum - it's about asking for your generosity and accepting its myriad forms, if you feel so inclined to send some my way. That means you can donate however much money you want if you are able, but you can also simply share my campaign. Word of mouth IS help! So, ignore the goal above, and just help out if you can and if you want to. Every tiny bit helps.

The money will go toward a few things:

  • For one, Bobbi lives in New York, and I don't, so I will need to get down there and get around. Being the broke graduate student I am, this alone poses a challenge, so any assistance will go a long way in even getting me down to her. 
  • The money will also go toward food while I'm down there. 
  • I would like to be able to pay the people who help me in crafting this product. This includes anyone who helps me produce it, who may play on it (if that lovely opportunity arises), if I get help mastering it, etc. It is very nice to be able to pay the people who use their honed craft to help you make your project a reality. (I'm sure these people would agree.)
  • Finally, the money will also go toward creating physical versions of the album on CD. I would love to make vinyls, but I don't really know how to go about creating one's own vinyl LPs - and if anyone has any tips on that, let me know! - but mostly I would make CDs, with artwork and everything. You'll see these down in the perks. Ultimately, this may be the most expensive part of this project, if enough people get them - printing the artwork, buying the CDs and cases, and then shipping them out. It gets very expensive. But I am offering them as a perk because I know people like having a physical copy of what they helped support. 

What It Means

I know some of you might not give a crap if I get to make a real album or not, especially if you don't know me. But I am asking for help because this is a passion project for me, and after recording so many songs and albums over the years that sound like garbage, I am ready to take the next step and make a good, quality recording for everyone to hear. Music is extremely important to me, and this feels like an organic step in my artistic process. In a way, this feels a lot like my first album, and I would love if you guys would be a part of it, coming along for the ride with me.

Click the link to my Bandcamp to hear what I have already made under the Atheists name! :-)

story:
I'm an Australian-Croatian operatic soprano having completed my music studies in Australia at the Australian National University. Currently I'm based in Croatia where I work and study. As a passionate performer and promoter of Croatian classical music, I am thrilled to be invited to sing at this cultural manifestation of high importance, as it promotes Croatian culture and also celebrates 50 th anniversary from Decleration of Croatian language.  In this spectacular evening I will be honoured to perform recital of Croatian classical composers. Since many of us are aware that travelling expences from Europe to Australia are very high (cca 2000 $) it is financially difficult to sort out funding , especially when cultural community is in it's relative beginnings.

This is so important for me and my artistic development and also promotion of Croatian composers in Australia. Besides performing in Sydney, I have in plan also to perform in Canberra and few more places in Australia.

Amount of funding I kindly ask for is 1500$ it is 70% of airfare price. If it happens that any funds are left over, I will use them to cover my travel expences between cities where I will perform in Australia.

Dear all I really need your help to make this unique project alive and to continue promoting beauty of Croatian culture. I promise that I will do my best that most of musicians in Australia know more about operas Ero the Joker or Nikola Subic Zrinjski. It is in my heart and mind!

Thank you for any contribution, financial or sharing link to this fundraising platform, I really appreciate you help!

Hope to see you at one of my concerts!

Helena Mamich

story:
Bonjour,

Nous sommes TERRATO, un groupe de percussions Brésiliennes (batucada) établi à Montréal depuis plus de 8 ans.  Nous jouons principalement de la Samba-reggae, un style de musique originaire de Salvador da Bahia au Brésil depuis le début des années 80.  Nos influences principales sont les groupes Olodum et Timbalada, tous les deux provenant de la province de Bahia au Brésil. Mais nous jouons aussi d’autres styles musicaux Brésiliens tels que : Samba carioca, Axé, MPB et Frevo.   Depuis 2008 TERRATO à performé plus de 600 spectacles à travers le Québec et le Canada. Nous offrons des performances avec tambours seulement pour des petites fêtes, manifestations, parades et festivals extérieurs.  Mais nous offrons aussi un spectacle avec orchestre complet (3 chanteurs/chanteuses, 4 cuivres, cavaquinho, guitare et basse) pour des performances sur scène.  Durant nos spectacles nous déployons énormément d’énergie et avec le son et la puissance des tambours les spectateurs sont généralement incapables de demeurer assis! 

Le groupe a déjà produit un premier album complet « Oxigenio » en 2014.  Depuis ce premier opus nous avons créé et accumulé beaucoup de nouvelles compositions et nous sommes maintenant prêts à produire notre 2ième album ainsi que notre premier vidéoclip officiel.   Nous avons des compositions écrites en Brésilien, Anglais, Français et Créole.  Donc, TERRATO est véritablement un groupe de musique multiculturel avec des racines musicales profondément Brésiliennes. 

Pourquoi nous avons besoin de VOTRE contribution ?

Les coûts de productions d’un album sont considérables, même pour un projet d’autoproduction d’envergure modeste.  Il faut considérer les frais de studio pour l’enregistrement des chansons, le mixage final qui peut prendre en moyenne de 3 à 5 heures par chanson et finalement l’étape de matriçage (ou mastering) qui est la plus importante.  Tout ceci coûte environs $5000 au minimum.

De plus, nous voulons aussi ramasser des fonds pour la production d’un éventuel vidéoclip ce qui coûte autant à produire qu’un album complet!  Voilà pourquoi nous avons besoin de votre aide.  Nous avons vraiment hâte de vous faire entendre nos nouvelles tounes! Alors s’il-vous-plait aidez-nous à produire notre merveilleux projet musical en encourageant le meilleur groupe de Samba-reggae au Canada.  Obrigado!!

 

Hello,

We are TERRATO, a Brazilian percussion group (batucada) established in Montréal since over 8 years.  Our style of music is mainly Samba-reggae, a musical style originating from Salvador da Bahia, Brazil since the early 80’s.  Our main influences come from the well-known bands Olodum and Timbalada, both based in the province of Bahia, Brazil. But the band also plays other Brazilian musical styles and rhythms such as: Samba carioca, Axé, MPB and Frevo.   Since 2008 TERRATO has performed more than 600 shows across Québec and Canada. We offer performances with drums only for small parties, marches, parades and outdoor festivals.  But we also offer a full-band ensemble (3 singers, 4 horns, cavaquinho, guitar and bass) for onstage shows.  During our shows we produce enormous amounts of energy and when combined with the sound and power of the live drums the spectators simply cannot stay seated!

In 2014 the band produced their first full-length album « Oxigenio ».  Since that first release we have created and accumulated many new compositions and we are now ready to produce our second full-length album as well as our first official video clip.   Our songs are written in Brazilian, English, French and Creole.  Therefore, TERRATO is definitely a multicultural band with strong Brazilian musical roots.

Why are we asking for YOUR contribution ?

The production costs for a full-length album can be considerable, even for a modest auto-produced project.  One must consider the studio costs for the recording of the songs, the final mixing process which can take from 3 to 5 hours per song on average and the mastering which is the final and most important aspect of production.  All of this can easily cost a minimum of $5000 in total.

Furthermore, we are in need of funds for the production of an upcoming video clip which can easily cost as much as the album itself!  That is why we are asking for your help. We can’t wait to make you hear our new songs! So please help us produce our marvelous new musical project by encouraging the best Samba-reggae band in Canada.  Obrigado!!

story:
Hi! My name is Fred King, and I'm an independent artist living in New York City.

 

About the Album

15 Years

I've been working hard over the last 15 years on this material and I'm excited for the opportunity to bring this project to life. I am feeling really free - free to express myself and bring you a new sound experience that I'm proud of and something that I know you'll love.

7 Genres

Hip-hop + Funk + Jazz + Rock + Pop + World + Folk

4 Moods

The moods in my songs flow like the four tastes: Sweetness, Saltiness, Sourness, Bitterness.

3 Countries

USA, Belarus, Russia.

1 Album

This year I'm releasing my 1st studio album.

A rough break-down of the costs looks like this: 

Album artwork: $500

Pressing 1,000 Vinyl Records: $3,650

Indiegogo/CC fees: $1,350

Recording and Production: $8,000

Marketing: $1,500

***

Привет! Меня зовут Федор и я музыкант из Нью-Йорка.

 

Альбом:

15 Лет

В этот альбом я вложу весь свой музыкальный опыт, полученный на протяжении 15 лет. Я нахожусь в предвкушении момента, когда я смогу поделиться с вами материалом, который вам безусловно понравится.

7 Жанров

Hip-hop + Funk + Jazz + Rock + Pop + World + Folk

4 Настроения

Настроения текстов и музыки как вкусы - сладкий, горький, соленый, кислый.

3 Страны

США, Россия, Беларусь

1 Альбом

В этом году я выпущу свой первый студийный альбом.

На что будут потрачены собранные средства: 

Дизайн: $500

1000 Виниловых пластинок: $3,650

Indiegogo/CC fees: $1,350

Запись в студии, сведение, мастеринг: $8,000

Маркетинг: $1,500

story:
Short Summary

We're not restricted by genre, but obligated by quality.

The goal of Mental Block Records is to supply artists with a platform to succeed, and to supply listeners with quality new music. We offer our artists recording time, digital publishing, album pressing, and much more. The more money we have from contributors, the more artists we can work with, and the more successful the collective will be. Thank you!

What We Need & What You Get

What your money will supply:

The more money we get, the more stuff on this list we can get.

-Album pressing supplies

-Advertising

-Promotional items (free downloads, stickers, flyers, posters, etc..)

-Showcases of our artists

-"Street Team" Packages.

What we supply:

-Free music. All of our artists give at least a portion of their music away through us.

-New music form quality artists.

- A professional product from professional musicians.

- Items for your donations.

The Impact

We have been running Mental Block Records for a little under a year now, and made good local progress. We want to take Mental Block Records to your area. We want to make a larger footprint all over and bring our community to you. Get some free music, and when you love it, you can buy some more.

Other Ways You Can Help

We realize that not everyone can contribute with funds, so here are some things that you can do to help...

- Sign up for our Street Team

-Share this funding campaign!

-Show people our website

-Like our Facebook

story:
What is gigkat?

Gigkat is a sophisticated music app for iphone and android serving both artists and fans.

For Artists! Gigkat allows artists to have their own app with a marketing platform that provides actionable, easy-to-use marketing & promotion tools. Artists can follow fans by geo-location and have real time analytics on the growth and popularity of their music. All this provides each artist with the equivalent of a $150,000 mobile app!

For Fans! Gigkat provides fans with a simple tool to discover and interact with new artists & their music. Fans can watch video, listen to music, be updated on concerts and see ads and sponsored promotions.

gig :

Any aspect of performing, such as assisting with performance and attending musical performance.

kat :

A slang term used in the 50's by jazz musicians that literally means musician.
.

Gigkat was created for artists who were looking for an app that would provide them a platform to showcase their work, give them the promotion ability to connect with existing fans within specific geographies, and provide them with a marketing platform that would help accelerate their discovery by new fans.

After much consulting between artists, fans, managers, music executives and some of the best software developers in the country, Gigkat was created. The platform gives artists an app that meets all their needs plus many extra features to help promote and monetize themselves.

Despite the plethora of social media platforms and the ease at which people now communicate, no one else has developed a platform specific to the music industry that allows artists and fans the ability to relate directly with one another. Gigkat was developed to specifically meet that need.

The company is managed by a team of experts in their field along with successful artists and musicians.

About Gigkat

Provides Artists a Mobile Promotion Tool that Drives Results

  • Increases touch rates with real-time relevant messages
  • Increases view rates with timely notifications using full screen AdSplash
  • Increases discovery of bands & viewership with bubble-up fan display
  • Increase foot-traffic & sales with timely notifications & live streaming capability
  • Targeted and location based promotions that are geo-fenced for fans

Added Benefits:

  • Just-in-time notifications
  • Promote the event in a timely fashion
  • Notify & Alert fans of live appearances
  • Just-at-location
  • Location aware events
  • Low-cost Live Stream
      o Interviews
      o Shows
      o Track sampling

- Artists will have marketing & promotion tools not previously available.

- Help from management to mentor artists with social media, contracts, sponsorship, and concert promotions.

- App allows most popular artists to bubble to the top - a tool management can use to pick top artists for concerts and record contracts.


What gigkat offers:

Gigkat is a Portal for Bands, Artists and Managers

  • Login with email or Facebook
  • Integration with Facebook to promote themselves
  • Ability to add:
      o Profile
      o Audio Tracks
      o Events
      o Photos
      o Videos via YouTube or Vimeo
  • Ability to create promos for full-screen advert splash page

Gigkat Mobile App API

  • Backend API drives all traffic to mobile apps
  • Ability to maintain favorite bands list
  • Ability to view pictures – thumbnails and full-res
  • Ability to stream audio
  • Ability to start YouTube video view
  • Ability to alert on events
  • Band-relevance algorithm for each individual user based on their preferences:
      o Choice list of bands
      o Their location
      o Band’s information relevancy and time-currency.
  • Ability to decide when and how long to show advert splash page:
      o Based on advert relevance
      o Ad immediacy
      o Frequency of display
      o User preference

Android App & iPhone App

  • Ability to create an account and login with:
      o User email
      o Facebook
  • View band information
  • Create a list of preferred bands
  • Listen to tracks
  • View events
  • View pictures
  • View videos

The Impact of Your Contributions

The App is finished and just needs the latest IOS & Android updates to complete development. Funds will be used to complete the  technology interface. While we're working on raising $30,000 from a variety of sources, your contribution to our $10,000 campaign goal would go far in helping us get there - and be greatly appreciated!

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us spread the word!

  • Personally share our campaign with your family, friends and associates
  • Post to your social media platforms and ask others to share
  • Send an email, tweet or post to your favorite bands and musicians
  • And don't forget, you can easily share by using the Indiegogo share tools below
  • Also Visit us on Instagram >>

About the Founders:

Matt Collins - Matt has worked in the Music and Entertainment Industry the past 15 year. Starting his Music Industry career as VP of international marketing at Maranatha Music, he managed international sales and marketing teams for music publishing and distribution, also creating their Spanish label and serving as financial analyst for new growth.

For over six years as CEO at BND Music, he published and distributed music in five languages throughout six countries managing A&R teams around the globe. In the past ten years Matt has also been working with all the major Sport and Entertainment networks introducing and developing technology for logging video and music content used in the top social media platforms.

Bill Junkin - Bill founded and built one of the top 30 advertising agencies in the U.S. and became President of Saatchi & Saatchi Direct after they purchased his firm. He created first national fantasy sports contests and became Chairman of iTV Entertainment after Gemstar TV Guide purchased IP portfolio. He helped introduce FRS – one of first nutraceutical drinks on the market and Lip-Quencher – a lipstick from Chapstik, which turned into a significant brand.

Bill is a seasoned marketing professional and has spoken extensively on direct marketing and interactive media both here in the U. S. as well as internationally. His expertise and guidance will prove most valuable in helping bands and artists commercialize their talent.

story:
Hello, My Name is Gilly Spencer

I'm a musician, producer, composer, arranger, spiritual facilitator.

I have played the piano since I was five and music is one of my greatest loves. It is such a beautiful language that everyone understands, it is the language of the soul.

I make my living playing piano. I also love to create music for people and the projects they have to help bring their musical dreams to life.

I play at Glastonbury Healing Field most years and really enjoy the connection that comes from playing the piano there and everyone singing along. 

I am also planning to launch a spiritually based business in the new year which will also incorporate music.  

It's such a pleasure playing songs for people on the piano. Bringing joy and happy atmospheres wherever I play. I love creating music in my studio. You can lose hours getting lost meditatively in a track. There is such a wonder in hearing all the layers grow in a piece of music. However, my equipment is starting to creak a little with old age, I would like to be able to write and produce music at the level needed to help others with their music and songs to the highest standard.

If you can help me with my funding, you will give me and my studio a new lease of life, that will also help many people who come to me. I will be able to record vocals and produce tracks and encourage others with their musical visions to the very best of my ability. It will also help my new business idea grow in the new year. 


What I Need & What You Get

  • In order to get the highest quality recording in my studio, I need to upgrade my equipment. I am running an old Pro Tools 8 system which has the hiccups quite often, and no longer wants to record audio, So no vocals. I would be upgrading to the current version 12.3. Vocals are a vital part of what I love to record and mix so I would be looking to get a really good vocal mic for recordings as well. My computer is also almost 10 yrs old and is very very noisy, so I will be purchasing a new Mac.
  • My perks for your generosity include writing a song specially for you. 
  • Your own GillyBean singalong concert in your home or venue of your choice. 
  • A CD of my tracks, A track created for you that you would like making when I have my new studio.
  • An Intuitive card reading.
  • A Celebration Singalong invite to the pub I play in when I achieve my goal.
  • Any money that comes and falls short of the final goal will go to studio equipment.
The Impact

I am doing this because, I make a living as a musician, which I am very grateful for. I'm a walking miracle, I was born partially deaf and yet in the same body I have perfect pitch and a reservoir of a repertoire of songs I can play. Music flows through me like a radio station. I tune in and it literally flows through. It is amazing. I wish to share that gift with the world as much as I possibly can. I'm a single parent of two wonderful teenagers, so being able to splash out on studio equipment by myself would be too big a chunk of my earnings to achieve. They are both musicians too, My daughter sings beautifully and plays piano and soprano sax and my son is a very gifted guitar player. Music is a big part of our family. 

I wish to provide the best quality of service I possibly can. To bring happiness to others. To help their musical and spiritual aspirations take flight. I love what music does for people. 


  • If you are a musician or singer, I can help you alot once my studio is finished. Specially with the new ProTools 12 having the facility to connect and record with musicians all over the world so it won't matter where you live. I can still help you. 
  • Music is the language of the soul, it connects people, it heals people. To have music in my life is such a blessing. I would like to pass that blessing on to others. 
  • Your help would be so deeply appreciated and I am very grateful to you for reading my pitch. 
  • If you wish to connect with me on Periscope/gillybeanmusic I broadcast on there regularly. I would love to play a song for you on there. 


Risks & Challenges

 Holding out my hand and asking for help like this is massive. I have been one of those who felt I must manage to do it all by myself. I now recognise I am not an island and it is ok to reach out. There is a vulnerability in that but it is a good thing. If my funding goes a little slowly then I will continue to manage on what I have here which has served me very well, though ultimately the reason I have made this page it because I need to grow more as a musician and a producer.

  • I'm a very resiliant upbeat, contented grateful pianolady who adores her job and loves people so no matter what is happening here there are always wonders and miracles in your life to appreciate.
  • I believe that what is meant to be for you will be, So if this is a success then that is wonderful and if it is not then The Universe will guide me. I have faith that things will work out well.


Other Ways You Can Help

If helping me out here financially is beyond you right now, It would be fantastic if you could share this and get the word out to the world. Every donation will help and  Thank you so much for doing what you can. 

I would like to thank Sarah Kate Michel for all her help and support putting this campaign together.
story_txt:
Hello, My Name is Gilly Spencer I'm a musician, producer, composer, arranger, spiritual facilitator.
I have played the piano since I was five and music is one of my greatest loves. It is such a beautiful language that everyone understands, it is the language of the soul.
I make my living playing piano. I also love to create music for people and the projects they have to help bring their musical dreams to life.
I play at Glastonbury Healing Field most years and really enjoy the connection that comes from playing the piano there and everyone singing along. 
I am also planning to launch a spiritually based business in the new year which will also incorporate music.  
It's such a pleasure playing songs for people on the piano. Bringing joy and happy atmospheres wherever I play. I love creating music in my studio. You can lose hours getting lost meditatively in a track. There is such a wonder in hearing all the layers grow in a piece of music. However, my equipment is starting to creak a little with old age, I would like to be able to write and produce music at the level needed to help others with their music and songs to the highest standard.
If you can help me with my funding, you will give me and my studio a new lease of life, that will also help many people who come to me. I will be able to record vocals and produce tracks and encourage others with their musical visions to the very best of my ability. It will also help my new business idea grow in the new year.     What I Need & What You Get 
In order to get the highest quality recording in my studio, I need to upgrade my equipment. I am running an old Pro Tools 8 system which has the hiccups quite often, and no longer wants to record audio, So no vocals. I would be upgrading to the current version 12.3. Vocals are a vital part of what I love to record and mix so I would be looking to get a really good vocal mic for recordings as well. My computer is also almost 10 yrs old and is very very noisy, so I will be purchasing a new Mac. My perks for your generosity include writing a song specially for you. 
Your own GillyBean singalong concert in your home or venue of your choice. 
A CD of my tracks, A track created for you that you would like making when I have my new studio.
An Intuitive card reading.
A Celebration Singalong invite to the pub I play in when I achieve my goal. Any money that comes and falls short of the final goal will go to studio equipment.

The Impact
 I am doing this because, I make a living as a musician, which I am very grateful for. I'm a walking miracle, I was born partially deaf and yet in the same body I have perfect pitch and a reservoir of a repertoire of songs I can play. Music flows through me like a radio station. I tune in and it literally flows through. It is amazing. I wish to share that gift with the world as much as I possibly can. I'm a single parent of two wonderful teenagers, so being able to splash out on studio equipment by myself would be too big a chunk of my earnings to achieve. They are both musicians too, My daughter sings beautifully and plays piano and soprano sax and my son is a very gifted guitar player. Music is a big part of our family. 
I wish to provide the best quality of service I possibly can. To bring happiness to others. To help their musical and spiritual aspirations take flight. I love what music does for people.  
 If you are a musician or singer, I can help you alot once my studio is finished. Specially with the new ProTools 12 having the facility to connect and record with musicians all over the world so it won't matter where you live. I can still help you. 
Music is the language of the soul, it connects people, it heals people. To have music in my life is such a blessing. I would like to pass that blessing on to others.  Your help would be so deeply appreciated and I am very grateful to you for reading my pitch. 
If you wish to connect with me on Periscope/gillybeanmusic I broadcast on there regularly. I would love to play a song for you on there.     
Risks & Challenges  Holding out my hand and asking for help like this is massive. I have been one of those who felt I must manage to do it all by myself. I now recognise I am not an island and it is ok to reach out. There is a vulnerability in that but it is a good thing. If my funding goes a little slowly then I will continue to manage on what I have here which has served me very well, though ultimately the reason I have made this page it because I need to grow more as a musician and a producer.  I'm a very resiliant upbeat, contented grateful pianolady who adores her job and loves people so no matter what is happening here there are always wonders and miracles in your life to appreciate. I believe that what is meant to be for you will be, So if this is a success then that is wonderful and if it is not then The Universe will guide me. I have faith that things will work out well.    
Other Ways You Can Help If helping me out here financially is beyond you right now, It would be fantastic if you could share this and get the word out to the world. Every donation will help and  Thank you so much for doing what you can. 
I would like to thank Sarah Kate Michel for all her help and support putting this campaign together.

story:
Craftworks (CUI)! 

For 3D Modelers, Photographers, Illustrators, Musicians, DJ’s, Makers, Lighting and Stage Effect Engineers, Videographers and Video Editors, Recording and Audio Engineers and still within the realm of the digital creative arts - GAMERS and other art consumers like HOME THEATER and ENTERTAINMENT SYSTEM enthusiasts and there's probably a lot more out there that we don't know about - these are the ones that we have seen Craftworks change everything for!

We’ve spent the past nearly 3 years and every penny developing Craftworks: a user interface designer, control surface and simplified development platform for the creative electronic-digital arts and artists.

WIN SOME STUFF: VISIT our website 2io.io or Facebook to sign up to WIN a bunch of the hardware and software we used to build Craftworks..all gifts from Dell and Apple when we were starting out: Macbook Pro 15", The LARGE 24" TOUCHSCREEN you see in most of the images, Tablets and some USB Computer-on-a-stick's!

User interface / control surface for 3D Modeling:

"3D Pads" for controlling the plane and object..


For NON-TECHIES: Save a BUNCH of creativity and frustration by not having to think about controlling your software and hardware AND save a BUTTLOAD of cash by not having to buy a bunch of hardware devices that can only do one thing instead of one device that can do it all or one that compliments analog or physical controllers uniquely well - drawing pads for illustrators surrounded by digital and highly configurable buttons.. 

..like here with all Photoshop menu functions & tools made  handy:


For THE TECHIES: With the Craftworks Visual Editor, our built-in easy and designed for artists scripting language SonicScript, in addition to the beautiful language Lua and common HTML5/Javascript support, it's large list of supported protocols and capacity to convert between them, it’s physical computing interfaces for both Arduino & Raspberry Pi, it's ability to communicate with audio programming and audio processing languages like ChucK and SuperCollider, and it’s networked mouse & keyboard drivers for PC & Mac all ensure there are not many software applications or hardware devices Craftworks can’t control OR  emulate.


Some views of Craftworks Visual Editor / Designer



In general: Using it is just a sh!t ton of fun. I’ve spent half of the last 2+ years just playing with it like a little kid (waaay too much probably).. the tool pulls you in with all of its creative diversions and is so addictively fun..and to toot my own horn a bit: it’s some pretty incredible stuff! :D



We need..

..a COMMUNITY and a community of help! I’ve turned away inquiries and avoided outside funding and bootstrapped this as much as I could and so close to the finish line I can’t afford to keep it going and even when we get to the finish line - covering the costs involved in amping up for a product release can be dream smashing. Help, community! We have some really neat stuff here! I don't want to be sucked up by a fund :(

A control surface for video editing:

Some of the Craftworks Joystick Perks in action:


Completion 

We’re close. Craftworks is 75-80% complete. All of the components are there but so are the bugs. Most things work really well and other things don’t work really well but will with some attention and a little code love. The Craftworks Visual Editor, where you create the control surfaces and applications, gets the job done but feels clunky and is in need of an all over polishing and some components like the way protocols are handled in the GUI are disjointed, confusing and needing an overhaul to become consistent and easier to digest. A lot of other issues I feel are more esthetic and will be resolved with the addition of a 3rd party graphics engine such as Unity (please watch our pitch video for a better visual). Apologies in advance for getting a little windy and technical but l think it’s important to relay something neat: we have two methods of displaying graphics right now in Craftworks. One is through modified and semi-proprietary embedded browsers for Craftworks controls created with HTML5/Javascript. The other is essentially the standard Windows graphics engine, which if you’re a Windows user - that's the engine pumping out what you're staring at right now and in programming, it isn’t too great on its own without a lot of help. With a 3D engine like Unity, we would be able to take better advantage of hardware acceleration and some pretty fancy effects plus some out-of-this-world visual and spatial concepts like representing controls as animated 3D objects like you would see in a video game or model hyper accurate guitar strings - strum on a 7000 string guitar kinda stuff :). We could also take advantage of tens of thousands of already created 3D objects out there in the public domain and add physics and function to them. What we as a community could end up creating could be pretty darn special. The end goal!

Emulate just about any kind of physical device


When you want to play some games or do some flying:


The Goal..

..is $80,000..every dollar buys about a minute of development time for 1.5 developers and with every minute Craftworks gets better and closer to release. Our beta program starts quickly with our backers whether we hit this goal or not and you'd be missing out on not only getting your hands on something fun during the beta but also being part of the decision-making community and the good feels of being part of what I think could be something great..something that has already been used in some amazing places and with some amazing people.

If we flop and bomb: We're still a go but will be slower to release, no hiring and I'll just keep trudging along a little slower than before because I'll have to split time with full time consulting work..but she's my love and we'll make it after all :D. 

If we hit or even get close to our goal: We’ll be able to go turbo and immediately bring two more skilled local developers on board and switch over to putting the finishing touches on it, creating sample code, documentation, tools and help videos and also create a community portal and marketplace* for hosting user created content for controls, control surfaces, applications and tools within six months, +/- a month. 

* This marketplace would be for YOU to share & sell your controls & control surfaces. We will never sell add-ons, controls or control surfaces. When you buy Craftworks, you get it and all updates for life..free.

If we somehow miraculously exceed the goal: Richard Butt!! We can hire X amount more developers and could be done in a quarter that time!! Crazier has happened! That's why your help beyond putting money down is important - we need you to put the word out! 

Side note: If any developers from the Ann Arbor area following this and see us getting close to our goal and think they have the unique qualities to work on Craftworks: we have wonderful benefits and options, location and of course a super fun project to work on! or looking to move? Ann Arbor is a BEAUTIFUL technocentric cupertinomini.. just learn to say 'Go Blue!' instead of Hi or Hello. 
More of a Craftworks perk in action:


Delivery

Whether we hit our goal or not we will be packaging up and shipping out our backer rewards and some Craftworks components to the backers that have paid for them so they can start beta testing soon after campaigns close but for some components we need to address copy protection / piracy concerns with our new community which could extend some things out a little longer while having to possibly finalize a copy protection vendor (recommendations open!), ordering, receiving, testing and then the physical shipping of something out which more than likely will be a tiny USB dongle with added gold color so the folks that back us stick out and can show off a little. It’s a difficult subject for me and a struggle - I personally understand and feel the disdain for the DMCA and copy protection in general but also understand the plight of the small business trying to protect their products from abuse and if you decide to back us - I would like to take this issue up in one of our forums and get your input.. with some hand holding, patting on the head and being told everything will be alright - we could just as easy be convinced out of locking Craftworks down since piracy always seems to win unless we do something dumb and 'Cloud-y'. 

DMX Lighting Control Surfaces for Stage Lighting and Effects

Create dials to monitor just about anything!



Summary

I think we have something extra special going on here with this software. We've used it in some pretty incredible places already, like working with kids that haven't had a lot of exposure to music, many never having played an instrument before and our keyboard shines here and immediately brightens them up. Amazing stuff. We hope our community can bring Craftworks down into their own physical / real life communities and do similar things with it - and if you do - PLEASE contact us.. we know how hard it can be setting up a community program and can help you out with free software, other good schwag and tell you about some vendors that have been generous to us in the past!
I would like to keep the price of Craftworks low. Hardware that Craftworks can run on can be picked up as low as $80, so the software shouldn't be more than the hardware in my humble opinion. The cost of a video game seems reasonable (around $60) and depending on the cost of Unity and USB dongle copy protection it could hit as high as that $80 but I would like to avoid that as much as possible and if that is the price you can bet it will be on sale a bunch.
Craftworks Retail: $60-80 US
Thanks for taking a peak, join us - every dollar helps!
PAYPAL WILL BE UNAVAILABLE FOR THE FIRST 2-3 DAYS OF THE CAMPAIGN.. I guess I've never needed a PayPal Verified account before :(
If you live in the Ann Arbor area, please check out our website for location and drop in and play with Craftworks for awhile! The beer is on me! :D
CLICK HERE FOR OUR WEBSITE OR GOTO HTTP://2IO.IO
Here's our reddit.com/r/craftworks

Run it on all kinds of devices



About US: iO/iO, The Company Summarized
iO/iO or officially iOiO Creative Technologies is a small technology, art & music consulting company in Ann Arbor, Michigan founded four years ago by J.Henry Slentz, a long time IT professional and electronic musician / recording artist with >30 years of application development experience and a bit more than that with music.

story:
We Are CAMINO. 

Spencer Stewart  // 22

Jeffery Jordan // 20

Andrew Isbell // 18

Graham Rowell // 19 

CAMINO is a group of 4 doods from Memphis, TN who share an unsettling love for rocknroll.   And WE are currently in the early stages of making our first EP. We couldn't be more excited to begin the process! After months of writing, playing shows, and developing a sound that defines us as a band, we feel like we are finally ready to share our sound with the world. 

BUT...

We need $7,000 to make this happen. 

Why $7,000?  Because we want to please your ears with the best EP we can possibly make. We want to create something that we can be proud of, something that captures our sound, and something that will make a convincing statement to all of those around us about who we are. First impressions mean everything and we want CAMINO's to be the best we can make it.

CAMINO would be honored if you would be a part of this project. And also we are broke college kids who have $0.00 USD   :^)

We have taken a considerable amount of time in attempting to create perks that will appeal to anyone that joins us in this endeavor. Check out the list on the right side of this page and find one that best suits your interests! 

We realize $7,000 is a lot of money, but with expenses such as gear, tracking, engineering, mixing, mastering, and merchandise, we can guarantee that all of the money collected from this campaign will go directly towards funding this project and getting the music to YOU, the listener!

CONTRIBUTE TO OUR CAMPAIGN AND HELP US MAKE MUSIC. WE LOVE YOU.

story:
Hello Everyone!

My name is Skye DuMont, welcome to my pledge campaign for my Debut EP!

 I have been in love with music for as long as I can remember. The moment I knew I wanted to do music for the rest of my life was when I was 3 years old and I heard a Chopin nocturne - I was forever changed. I was privileged enough to attend The Manhattan School of Music for college, where I studied Opera, and I now work as a full time musician! I aspire to create music that is real, inspiring, and empowering. I want to bring sophisticated classical elements to the table while still creating a marketable and current pop/soul record. 

Recording an EP, though tremendously rewarding is also expensive. I don't have a specific financial backer or a record label funding this project, so I need your help! 

By becoming a patron you will be participating in turning dreams into a reality. Your  support will be contributing to: studio time, my producer, my engineer, the mixing, the mastering, and the session players - AND you'll be earning some pretty cool prizes along the way! 

Join with me, and we can make amazing things happen TOGETHER! :) 
If you are interested in supporting me, please check out my different reward tiers! If you do have a few dollars to spare to contribute, and would like to become a true patron of my music, thats amazing and I am so incredibly grateful. If you can't afford to pledge, it doesn't mean you can't help! Sharing my page with your friends and family is JUST as supportive. Either way, I feel blessed to have each and every one of you alongside me through this incredibly amazing and rewarding process of creating my very first EP! I am so confident in this music and the team I am working with. I know you'll love it, and I can't wait for you all to hear!
Again - I cannot thank every single one of you enough for taking the time to check out my indie-gogo campaign, share it, and generously give your pledges! I wouldn't be able to do what I'm passionate about without your love and support!
