By becoming a patron you will be participating in turning dreams into a reality. Your  support will be contributing to: studio time, my producer, my engineer, the mixing, the mastering, and the session players - AND you'll be earning some pretty cool prizes along the way! 
Join with me, and we can make amazing things happen TOGETHER! :) 
If you are interested in supporting me, please check out my different reward tiers! If you do have a few dollars to spare to contribute, and would like to become a true patron of my music, thats amazing and I am so incredibly grateful. If you can't afford to pledge, it doesn't mean you can't help! Sharing my page with your friends and family is JUST as supportive. Either way, I feel blessed to have each and every one of you alongside me through this incredibly amazing and rewarding process of creating my very first EP! I am so confident in this music and the team I am working with. I know you'll love it, and I can't wait for you all to hear!
Again - I cannot thank every single one of you enough for taking the time to check out my indie-gogo campaign, share it, and generously give your pledges! I wouldn't be able to do what I'm passionate about without your love and support!

story:
The genesis for this project occurred when David J. (Bauhaus / Love and Rockets etc. etc.) was in attendance at the 2014 Theatre Bizarre Gala event and performed a spontaneous rendition of his band, Bauhaus' classic, 'Bela Lugosi's Dead' with the award winning nine piece jazz ensemble, the Planet D. Nonet.  In this unique take on the song, Bela Lugosi meets up with Cab Calloway's Minnie the Moocher for a delirious sojourn down in China Town where they inevitably end up 'kicking the gong around'.  

https://vimeo.com/110326540


David J. and the TBO will be featured at this year's 2015 Theatre Bizarre preview gala on October 16, an intimate, exclusive, sold-out event. (There's still a chance for you, the backer, to attend.)  This will be a fully-fledged live preview-performance of the new album, which will take the audience on an immersive journey somewhere between Ray Bradbury's 'Something Wicked This Way Comes' and HBO's 'Carnivale' meets an opiated fever dream!


Detroit's Theatre Bizarre has been the singular, must-see annual event since it launched (illegally) in the early days of the 21st century. Year after year, its creators return with a spectacular event unlike anything else on earth.

Since finding its permanent home at Detroit’s Masonic Temple (the largest in the world), Theatre Bizarre has been offering progressively grander and more decadent events to those lucky enough to get a ticket. In late October each year, thousands of elaborately-clad and eager attendees fill the carved stone hallways of the labyrinthine tower as they move throughout the night from one indescribable performance to another. Detroit’s most adventurous souls slipping anonymously past each other as they celebrate their darkest selves into the early hours of the morning.  These costumed attendees will follow a trail of fire-eaters, burlesque performers and musical acts as they follow the evening’s path through the historic site.

http://theatrebizarre.com

David J. Haskins (aka David J) was born in Northampton, England, in 1957, and was a founder member of Bauhaus, the highly influential band that spearheaded the post-punk alternative-music scene of the early 80s with a string of innovative albums and a powerfully dramatic live presentation. Following the band’s split in 1983, he embarked on a long and varied solo career that has produced a series of critically acclaimed albums and various avant-garde collaborations. He has also written and directed a number of stage productions, including the spectacular multimedia event Silver For Gold (The Odyssey Of Edie Sedgwick), and The Chanteuse And The Devil’s Muse, a surrealistic investigation into the notorious Black Dahlia murder mystery, plus several screenplays (with writing partner Don C. Tyler), and his visual art has been exhibited internationally.  His memoir, 'Who Killed Mister Moonlight (Bauhaus, Black Magick and Benediction) was published by Jawbone Press in the winter on 2015 to critical acclaim.


Gala tickets!

Limited edition print, 'The Fool' (See perks)

Limited edition print, 'The Twins' (See perks)


Limited edition print, 'ExPat Edgar'' (See perks)


TBO secret seal pin (see perks)



Zombo patch (see perks)


Zombo brass pin (see perks)

David J sporting Daniel Ash mask!  (See perks)

Daniel Ash mask (see perks)

story:
Who Am I?

I am Matt Brandabur, founder of the BrowBeaters. 

I grew up in Central Illinois in a hotbed of musical diversity. On any given schoolnight, you could hear Pork and the Havana Ducks twanging out loud country on the West side, relax to Russian Folk Orchestra in a campus auditorium, and then dance to Talking Heads or Adrien Belew at Mabel's - all within 5 flat miles.

At 15, I helped found garage punk band The Vertebrats, whose song Left in the Dark has been covered by artists from Uncle Tupelo to Courtney Love. Since then, I have been learning how write songs that are engaging, meaningful, and which draw from the kaleidoscopic set of musical influences which has been the backdrop of my life.

I have produced several of the Vertebrats releases, including two CDs and an LP called Screaming Like a Mad Choir. I have also done lots of other musical projects in Illinois and Colorado, including live cabarets, songwriter circles, and straight up rock band shows.

When my son Tazwell began learning fiddle, the world of California Bluegrass opened up to me. Which brings us to this project.

What is Move My Car?

This campaign represents my opportunity to select my favorite recent tunes and showcase them in the best possible light and share them with the world.

It's also my chance to work with some absolutely world-class musicians:

  • Fiddle: Chad Manning: ( http://www.chadmanning.com/ )
  • Mandolin: Sharon Gilchrist ( https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sharon_Gilchrist )
  • Resonator: Mike Whitcher ( https://www.facebook.com/Mike-Witcher-227693020638573/ )
  • Bass: Max Schwartz ( http://www.maxschwartzmusic.com/ )
  • Guitar: Matt Brandabur ( World-class listener ) 
  • Fiddle: Tazwell Brandabur ( locally renowned M.C. )

Working with this tight group of players, I believe I can produce really high-quality renditions of these songs.

The Campaign

So where do you come in? Well, I could record these songs on my own, but instead I want to work with these fantastic musicians and the awesome StudioE where we'll be recording ( https://www.facebook.com/Studio-E-479771965406834/ ). Dave Grisman is in there now.

  • $5,650 will get us a day in the studio and the ability to hire these great players for at least 3 of these songs. If we raise more, we'll record more tunes.
  • It's easy to pre-purchase the digital download - just $10! From there, fun perks are added, including CDs and gorgeous BrowBeaters schwag.
  • For the higher levels, you can get sponsor or even producer credit on the recording, as well as other fancy gifts.
  • Branding on our perks was created by local visual artist Miriam Klein Stahl with an NYT bestselling book to her credit. ( http://www.radamericanwomen.com/ )
  • If we hit only part of our goal, we'll still go into the studio for a shorter time and record fewer songs.
So thanks for listening to this appeal, and I hope you decide to help us.

Your Impact

These songs were written to be stylistically expansive, personally inspiring, and musically enriching. Examples:

  • Danger: An ode to survivor's guilt from the point of view of a Syrian refugee.
  • The Dream People: An observational gospel tune about the hidden powers of eccentrics.
  •  Move My Car - about the deep emotion behind everyday interactions.

They are arranged specifically to showcase the vibrant strain of Northern California Bluegrass which surrounds us here in Berkeley.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, please help us get the word out:

Share this link on Facebook and Twitter:

Thank you all!

story:
Hello everyone and welcome to the music video project of the Jazz Version „Makedonsko devojce“.

It is one oft he most popular songs in the country and this is the very first time, that this song has been interpretated in a modern Jazz Version, which makes it very unique.

How this project started:

I've been travelling all my life to Macedonia and always enjoyed singing "Makedonsko devojce" in different countries. My goal was an international version of the song, so that people, who do not speak the language understand the lyrics.

3 years ago, I started to translate the song in english and spanish while I was on vacation in France. A year later I had the chance to work with the Folks Band "Drim Tim". They have been touring for years all over the globe, which even confirmed my opinion, that they are the band to make this song a success.

Seven musicians and me were recording the song. The result is an international Jazz/ Latino version of Makedonsko devojce. The most important goal for me is to produce the song with Macedonians. Starting with talented Directors, Screenwriters, Set assistance, Make Up Artists, Hairstylists, DOP, Fashion Designer, Location and many more!

This is an absolute heart- project and we would really want to make it representative for Macedonians living in and outside the country.

We would love you to participate and support the production of a classy music video.

In honor to the artists, who own the copyrights, we wanna make it right and buy the rights for the Jazz- Version.

To make this project work, we will be buying the costumes for the characters.

The postproduction is also an important part of the music video.

All producers will be listed (optionally anonym) in the end of the song.


Let´s make it a unique project!

story:
WHAT IS UP?!

My name is Jameson Tabor, and I’m a Dance-Pop singer and songwriter.  I’m originally from Portland, Oregon, but moved to Los Angeles 10 months ago to pursue my career in music.  I am so excited to release my debut album PURSUIT this fall, and an original music video of one of the songs on the album to promote it!  Now I need your help to finish them up professionally.

This album is a positive and empowering journey about pursuing your dreams and the emotional struggles one must face to do so.

I grew up playing piano, singing and dancing in shows, directing various bands and choirs, and even writing original music for five different musicals.  Yet, despite all of my obvious passion for music, the narrative I always told myself was that I was going to be an actor.  I think my fear of the unknown professional music world blinded me, and I felt like I didn’t know where to start.  So, I talked myself out of it.  Finally, after being forced by a dear friend to take an honest look at myself and my actions, I realized that music has always been the driving force of my life.

I believe that true happiness in life comes from doing what you love.  That is this journey for me—following my passion, understanding my dreams, and conquering the forces and fears surrounding that.  That is why I’ve decided to title the album PURSUIT.

I am writing pop music that is unique and thoughtful, that is always fun to dance and listen to, but that also carries insight and perspective.  I hope to be a light for others who need it, and to help them view the world around them as an awesome place, through images and stories they can relate to.  What good is music if nobody hears it?  Or worse, if people hear negative messages and generic lyrics?  There is too much hate, selfishness and blame out there in the world.  So many people go through times of depression, deep sorrow, injustice, and abuse.  It’s something I have been personally affected by, as have so many others.  That is reality.

And so, I hope to inspire confidence, optimism and light in the darkness, through honest, emotional moments that bring people together.  There is something about music that unites all of us, no matter where we are at, what country we are from or what language we speak.  

We must always come together and dance!


WHAT I NEED:

One thing I’ve learned this last year of getting real with myself is when to ask for help!

I feel I have done absolutely all that I can with the resources I have to make this thing happen.  There was actually a point this last year when my wife Jenna and I literally had $23 in our bank account, because we were both so committed to this music and what I am creating!  I’ve learned how to record and produce music at a professional level, read countless books and articles on the music industry, and taken online courses on how to build passive income and gain exposure through effective online marketing.  I didn’t know how, but I knew that we would eventually make it through.  Now I think I can see the light!

I need your help to make the finishing touches a reality.  

BUDGET: 

If you aren’t familiar with the music creation process, it's a complicated and expensive one.  I am seeking to raise $7500 to cover the following expenses:

• Hiring professional dance music Mixer/Producer (Shok)

• Professional mastering of the album

• Purchase of new speakers and cables to assist in editing process

• Online and physical distribution of the album to iTunes, Spotify, Apple Music, Amazon, etc. through CD Baby

• Photoshoot with professional photographer

• Hiring graphic designer to create the album cover art and logo

• Creation of press releases for album, and pre-launch single

• Advertising of album through Facebook and YouTube ads

• Updated website domain purchase and design

• Merchandise creation: CDs, t-shirts and photos

• Fashion design materials for music video

• Scenic design materials for music video

• Purchase of stock CGI green-screen footage

• Transportation and food for music video crew

• Submission of music video to nationwide festivals

WHAT YOU GET!

You guys, I am so excited for this.  There are so many things you can get in return for helping me fund this project!  Check out the perks on the side for a gift that suits you best.

There is an exclusive PURSUIT album t-shirt design, as well as an Exclusive Listening Party where you can share your reactions to the album live with me. Get an hour of one-on-one time with me in a voice lesson (I teach through The Tabor Studio), OR be featured in an upcoming music video!  You can even get 2 VIP tickets to an upcoming live show, OR have me compose you a completely original song!


YOUR IMPACT: THE TEAM & ME

With your help, at the end of this summer, these songs will be released professionally to the public.  Anyone will be able to find them and enjoy them!

The money this campaign raises is crucial to the success of the music I'm making.  Without this funding, the end product will be of lesser quality and likely to stay, for the most part, unheard.  I am confident that with enough of my supporters out there giving what they can, this will all come together and we will SURPASS our goal!  :)

Here are some of the folks who are already making this happen:

MY MUSIC CREW: 

Pop album production can take months of time, multiple producers and hundreds of thousands of dollars to pay for equipment and time.  Luckily, I have already done most of the production myself, so now it’s just a matter of being able to pay for the finishing touches.  I have found a killer Electronic Dance Music (EDM) Producer, Shok, who has been working in the industry for years, and has already been providing me with tons of free knowledge and mixing/mastering assistance.  I absolutely trust his musical sensibility and expertise. 

Co-writer, Alica Martwick and I have worked diligently, daily, to create the lyrical content of the songs.  She is a skilled poet, dedicated collaborator, and brilliant storyteller.  She has created some truly beautiful work for this album.

MUSIC VIDEO TEAM: 

I have assembled a Music Video team that is incredibly talented and capable.  These are working artists, almost all of whom I have collaborated with before.  Director Sara Alessandrini, Cinematographer Ona Isart, Fashion Designer Alec Remington, Scenic Designer Colin Lawrence, CGI Creator Nikhil Newse and Production Manager Jenna Tabor are already hard at work.  I can’t wait to launch our video (likely about one month prior to the album release)!  They really should be and usually are paid for their time and expertise, so they are all incredibly understanding of the needs of this project in offering to work unpaid.  All of these folks are honest, hardworking individuals, with great heart.


RISKS & CHALLENGES

Certainly in any art, the biggest risk is that all of this time, energy and money is spent on something that nobody ends up liking.  If I weren’t real with you up front about the fear on my end, I would be a huge liar!  It’s something that I think about every day, ALL THE TIME, while still trying to let go and let the creative juices flow.

These songs have all been around the block at this point.  They’ve been in and out of demo, editing, recording, rewriting, and finalizing phases too many times to count!  Songs have been written and scrapped, and some have been reincarnated with a twist.  Of all the music I've been working on, these 7 songs, are the ones I'm drawn to them time and time again.  They have gotten great feedback from a variety of test-group sources and trained musical ears that have indicated that each of these songs is a potential hit in one market or another.  I personally believe in all of these songs, and can’t wait for them all to take on a life of their own.

    OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:

    Hey look, I get it.  Not everyone can donate $100, or even buy a CD.  That’s okay.  You can still be a huge help in getting the word out about this campaign!

    Here are some other great ways you can help:

    1 • Use the Indiegogo share tools on the page, OR make a post yourself on Social Media and link it to here.  Everyone can appreciate your passion, so don’t be afraid to share it!

    2 • Tell your friends, at school, at work.  Tell your family members!  It’s huge to just get some BUZZ going.  Who knows who might be interested, or whose day you might brighten with the music!

    3 • Stream the songs on Spotify or another streaming platform when they come out!  Did you know that artists get paid and played more based on how often their music is heard?  Also, playlist creators and small radio stations are always looking for that next hit song, so help build up the plays!

    4 • Always stay up-to-date on my future releases and events by subscribing to my email list.  Email me at: jameson.tabor@gmail.com

    5 • Ask for the PURSUIT t-shirt for your birthday or Christmas!  Haha… you get me.  Be creative!  There is always something you can do.  :)


    Thank you for all of your love and support, and for helping me make my PURSUIT a reality!  ;)  I really appreciate it, and I cannot do it without you!!!  

    - Jameson

MY MUSIC CREW: Pop album production can take months of time, multiple producers and hundreds of thousands of dollars to pay for equipment and time.  Luckily, I have already done most of the production myself, so now it’s just a matter of being able to pay for the finishing touches.  I have found a killer Electronic Dance Music (EDM) Producer, Shok, who has been working in the industry for years, and has already been providing me with tons of free knowledge and mixing/mastering assistance.  I absolutely trust his musical sensibility and expertise. 
Co-writer, Alica Martwick and I have worked diligently, daily, to create the lyrical content of the songs.  She is a skilled poet, dedicated collaborator, and brilliant storyteller.  She has created some truly beautiful work for this album.
MUSIC VIDEO TEAM: I have assembled a Music Video team that is incredibly talented and capable.  These are working artists, almost all of whom I have collaborated with before.  Director Sara Alessandrini, Cinematographer Ona Isart, Fashion Designer Alec Remington, Scenic Designer Colin Lawrence, CGI Creator Nikhil Newse and Production Manager Jenna Tabor are already hard at work.  I can’t wait to launch our video (likely about one month prior to the album release)!  They really should be and usually are paid for their time and expertise, so they are all incredibly understanding of the needs of this project in offering to work unpaid.  All of these folks are honest, hardworking individuals, with great heart.

RISKS & CHALLENGES
Certainly in any art, the biggest risk is that all of this time, energy and money is spent on something that nobody ends up liking.  If I weren’t real with you up front about the fear on my end, I would be a huge liar!  It’s something that I think about every day, ALL THE TIME, while still trying to let go and let the creative juices flow.
These songs have all been around the block at this point.  They’ve been in and out of demo, editing, recording, rewriting, and finalizing phases too many times to count!  Songs have been written and scrapped, and some have been reincarnated with a twist.  Of all the music I've been working on, these 7 songs, are the ones I'm drawn to them time and time again.  They have gotten great feedback from a variety of test-group sources and trained musical ears that have indicated that each of these songs is a potential hit in one market or another.  I personally believe in all of these songs, and can’t wait for them all to take on a life of their own.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:
Hey look, I get it.  Not everyone can donate $100, or even buy a CD.  That’s okay.  You can still be a huge help in getting the word out about this campaign!
Here are some other great ways you can help:
1 • Use the Indiegogo share tools on the page, OR make a post yourself on Social Media and link it to here.  Everyone can appreciate your passion, so don’t be afraid to share it!
2 • Tell your friends, at school, at work.  Tell your family members!  It’s huge to just get some BUZZ going.  Who knows who might be interested, or whose day you might brighten with the music!
3 • Stream the songs on Spotify or another streaming platform when they come out!  Did you know that artists get paid and played more based on how often their music is heard?  Also, playlist creators and small radio stations are always looking for that next hit song, so help build up the plays!
4 • Always stay up-to-date on my future releases and events by subscribing to my email list.  Email me at: jameson.tabor@gmail.com
5 • Ask for the PURSUIT t-shirt for your birthday or Christmas!  Haha… you get me.  Be creative!  There is always something you can do.  :)



Thank you for all of your love and support, and for helping me make my PURSUIT a reality!  ;)  I really appreciate it, and I cannot do it without you!!!  


- Jameson

story:
Short Summary

I am Amy Goloby, a singer songwriter in Houston, TX. I started writing when I was a kid, and songwriting became a hobby when I got my first guitar in high school. Since then, it became a great creative outlet for me to express my emotions through breakups, obstacles, and troubles in life. 

I am raising funds to record my 2nd album, which is more faith-based. My songs are maturing as I grow up, and they are geared towards spreading hope and faith in God. 

My contributors will help me spread this message of hope to as many people as possible with even the smallest of donations. Recording an album takes a big investment upfront, so when people pre-purchase an album, it takes the weight off the artist and allows songwriters to keep using their gift to help others! 

What We Need & What You Get

I am raising $6000 to pay for the costs of:

  • Recording ($6000) - This pays the producer for the time he is spending on recording, creating music tracks, and sound engineering. 
  • Session Musicians ($50-75 per song for each musician)
  • Studio Time ($1200 for a week)
  • Travel costs ($300 a week for hotel stay, gas, food, etc.)

The perks to contributing to my project are free albums, T-shirts, merchandise, album credits, house concerts, and being named as Producer for the album! House concerts are very popular in the folk genre, and you get to invite your friends and family for a potluck dinner, while I entertain your guests in your very home! 

The Impact

Your contribution will help us to keep creating music that will spread encouragement and hope to others! The more you support the arts, the more we can use our talents to serve the world at its greatest needs. For emotional support. For clarity and direction. For hope and faith.  For a positive message. We can keep telling our stories in a way that resonates with other people. We can keep making music for the world! 

Risks & Challenges

As an artist, there are many obstacles to succeeding in the music industry. People don't buy music because they can stream it for free. Major record labels don't sign new artists anymore. Top 40 radio stations only play commercial music. It has become more popular to be a DIY indie artist and treat it as a small business. 

My plan to overcome these obstacles is not only hard work, but to have the right team behind me. My producers have already gone down the road of being independent artists, and they have paved the way so I can succeed. They live in Nashville, where they meet industry professionals every day and are making the right connections. 

In this way, I have a team who can help me plan a music tour and can hire the right radio promotor who can get my music onto stations that are geared towards my genre. I have a manager who has connections with music festivals and radio stations and can guide my career in the direction it needs to go. Having a great team is the key to making it in today's music climate. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to make a monetary contribution, there are other ways you can help: 

  • Share this campaign with as many as your friends as possible! 
  • Facebook, Twitter, Instagram... whatever you use! There are share links at the top of this page next to the video. 
  • Prayer. I am a strong believer in the power of prayer, and I need all the prayer I can get for this project. Ask for His wisdom, guidance, and provision for this album. 

Thanks so much, and I appreciate any contribution you are able to make! 

God bless! 

Amy

story:
Who is Inal Bilsel ?

Hi there, my name is Inal and I’m from Cyprus. I have always been passionate about creating different things and spent most of my childhood developing characters and stories to populate my own comic books. I was also into video games, not just playing them but imagining my own games, drawing the characters and even creating my very own video game magazines! In retrospect, I believe these have a lot to do with what I am doing with my work right now. Although the drawing eventually evolved into music composition, my ideas and the way I work is still very visual.

 I was originally trained in classical composition and created chamber and orchestral works. One of my orchestral compositions was even awarded the first prize at a composition contest (Notion International Composition Competition). Eventually, I found my own voice within the electronic music world. 

Within this newfound expression, I successfully released my debut album in 2009 titled 'A New Beginning'. However, with neither the funding or a wide advertising campaign or a label to back it, the album silently disappeared. Yet I was never defeated. I continued to persevere and to keep on  improving myself. For the past couple of years, I have composed and produced many tracks and prepared audio-visual concerts named 'Tales From The Future' using those tracks. The concerts have increasingly garnered a noticeable amount of interest especially in Nicosia (Cyprus). I believe that I have accumulated enough technical knowledge, artistic vision, purpose, and a definite goal to produce my second album of which I have high expectations. 

 

What is Paradise Lost ?

Paradise Lost will be a conceptual visual album. At its core, it is a music album inspired by various genres of electronic music including ambient and downtempo electronica. It is also a concept album, meaning that it has a larger purpose and a meaning. Paradise Lost will be the first album of SimEX trilogy, based on a fictional world where people use SimTapes as a new form of simulated experience, a form of entertainment, an escape. The complete story will be experienced throughout the album tracks, visual images in the booklets and just about in every corner of the album. 

Although I am most fluent with the musical expression, I would like to believe that I am an artist that is equally concerned with the visual aspects of a musical work. As well as attempting to produce an ambitious album, I would like to make this a visual album, where as well as experiencing the music the way we normally do, you will also be able to experience it with visual imagery. I am currently in the process of gathering a team of artists to shoot an album-length movie. Each artist will shoot and direct a different portion/track of the album. The movie will be shot using VHS tapes! The look, the feel and the atmosphere of the film will be completely surreal and atmospheric. The visual album will also be experienced in surround sound! So after having made a contribution, imagine one day holding this album in your hand, popping it in your DVD player and experiencing this atmospheric journey through sound and vision... I know how I would feel, and I'm sure we can't be too different. At least with some of you. 

 

 

Why support the project?

You are probably well aware that self-producing an album, especially those based on electronic music, and to distribute it using online services has become easier than ever. But what if I want to go that extra mile and hire a real string quartet instead of using a software that can replicate the real thing? What if I am in love with analog tape sound and want to master the album with a real tape machine instead of a software reproduction? What if I want to hire real musicians to perform, for example, drum and double bass parts instead of using a software reproductions? What if I want to record my own childhood upright piano for its unique character instead of using samples from someone else’s piano? What if I want to produce a visual accompaniment for the album using the unique look of real VHS tapes?  

It’s no secret that all of the above have cheaper or free alternatives.

So, the next natural question would be: why support the project when obviously I have other alternatives? I believe that this a matter of vision. Every artist aspires to produce nothing short of their imagination. Their work is a gateway for us to explore and to try and comprehend their imagination. Unfortunately, for some projects, financial difficulties must be solved to be able see the full extent of this imagination.

I invite you to take part in this campaign, contribute in any way that you can. Don't forget that even sharing this page is a great help. Be a part of this ambitious project and help me make my dream become reality.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The list below shows the minimum amount of money needed to complete the album and create a small promotion campaign. Of course, there are tons of hidden spendings when you are dealing with a project of this magnitude; catering the crew, printing scores, travel fees etc. I tried to be as clear as I can with the table below. For the time being, some of the numbers are only an estimate but they will be updated throughout the campaign to reflect the actual spendings. 

+ Studio Time:                                 £890 
+ Musician Fees:                            £1,100
+ Mixing:                                           £890
+ Special Tape Mastering:          £1,300
+ Album artwork:                             £560
+ Video Production:                      £1,200
+ Publicity:                                        £350
+ Indiegogo Percentage:                £534
    (Indiegogo collects approximately 9% of raised campaign funds)

PERK CHOOSER (NEW!)

​

 

What happens if the desired amount is surpassed?

If the goal is surpassed expect to see new and even more exciting perks! This will be an invaluable opportunity for me to improve just about every aspect of the project. 

What happens if the desired amount will not be reached?

The album will be completed and released regardless of the campaign. It will take much more time and effort to gather the necessary funds and the project will be seriously delayed.

 

Other ways you can help

If not financially, there are other ways that you to help. Sharing this campaign using social media is an immense help itself. You can also mention this to your friends and lead them here to explore this page. Spread the word!

story:
HELLO ALL!!!  

I’m JESSICA PENROSE, founder and front-person for the eclectic, progressive techno-folk, space-rock group, “BOSS MONSTER” (aka, "LADY BOSS MONSTER"). As a dedicated musician, composer and performer I've been developing my unique style and musical repertoire over my lifetime and am now at the part of the journey where we need to take things to the next level.

This is a good opportunity to HELP SUPPORT WOMEN IN MUSIC and THE VISUAL ARTS, as well as INDEPENDENT BANDS, and charities that do the same, such as, ROCK n ROLL CAMP for GIRLS in Salt Lake City, 

We've already gone far, and I've passed up labels and lucrative opportunities so I can do my music my way and maintain the integrity of what I do, so now it's up to me and my supporters to take it to the next level. Now it’s time to promote my vision further and literally take it on the road in a big way!!! 

OUR DREAM is to share our music with an ever-growing popular fan base across the country and throughout the world. To move forward with this I need to take every opportunity to promote myself and my music, to continue to compose, write, publish, play and TOUR!

I'M LOOKING FOR SUPPORT from my friends & fans, new and old, and fellow musicians & artists, for some much needed support for MY TOUR!

The “MAGIC-BOX TOUR” will consist of 7 shows over 8 days across the Northwest, including shows in Seattle, Portland and San Francisco.

While there I’ve also arranged to meet some movers and shakers in the area, including established industry PRODUCERS, ENGINEERS, MANAGERS and LABELS who have already agreed to meet with me and possibly help launch my music even further.​

But to make this happen I will NEED YOUR HELP!! I WANT YOU to be involved in this process at the ground level!!! I am looking for people who want to INVEST IN A DREAM, my dream! 

WHAT WE NEED is any help with things like transportation, equipment, food, accommodations, expenses and more.

But more to the point... I am asking for YOUR SUPPORT!

This is how you can INVEST IN THIS DREAM:

  1. SUPPORT US-- Help me with whatever kind of support you can offer, whether as a musician, or support with logistics, transportation, accommodations, etc.
  2. GET INVOLVED-- Come to my events and shows and bring your friends!
  3. MAKE SOME NOISE-- Spread the word on social media and in person!
  4. PRE-ORDER MY STUFF-- By pre-ordering my music and merchandise through the exclusive, limited OFFERS AND OPPORTUNITIES described below you will be making this tour possible.

SO… Have you ever thought about investing in an artistic project of this type? Are you interested in investing in a dream by becoming one of my creative partners? And specifically, are you willing to invest in my dream with a small amount of financial support?  

All of this will help expand and promote what I do farther than ever. Your collaboration is very much needed. THANK YOU! THANK YOU! THANK YOU! You are amazing!!! 

Sincerely, Jessica Penrose & LADY BOSS MONSTER :D

story:
Our Campaign

Well, it’s been 15 studio CDs, more than 1000 shows around the world and we’re planning some awesome things for our fans. Despite the sad state of the music business, Annihilator have never given up and hope we’ve given you some good music and good times along the way!

Now, we urgently need your help to raise money for touring, shows, the live acoustic DVD, the mini documentary DVD and the live concert DVD we are planning. Although we have a very supportive label and touring agency, these ambitious plans cost a lot more money than any of us have. See the expense list below and we're sure you'll understand.

In return for your contributions, we’ve come up with some amazing things to offer you: From Jeff’s custom Chevy Camaro muscle car, to watching an Annihilator live-streamed rehearsal, hanging out at Jeff’s home and studio, getting some of his guitars, free concert tix for life, AND MORE… See the gallery section for pics of the perks. We hope you love these killer packages as much as we loved making them!

Obviously, not everyone will be able to afford or will want the car package but hopefully it has pointed you to the Live Rehearsal Stream Package and the others.

Thanks for your time and hopefully your contributions!

Exclusive Packages

Remember, everything available here is exclusive to this campaign!

We think this is going to be one of the coolest packages:
We want you to join us for a 1 hour live streamed rehearsal in September.

Live from Watersound Studios, ANNIHILATOR will be getting ready for the 2nd European tour for the “SUICIDE SOCIETY” record. Let’s get an army of metal fans watching us working on songs we will play on the next tour!
There will be 4 rehearsals days in early September; we'll give you a few choices (dates and times) to choose from.

Here we have a high resolution print of the original lyric sheet / songwriters' agreement for the Annihilator classic Alison Hell!

The lyric sheet was signed by Jeff Waters and John Bates, the writers of the song (witnessed by first bassist Dave Scott) in 1986. Jeff will also sign the top right of the document for you, so you know it's an original. It will be mailed to you unfolded.


We wanted to think of a “Grand Prize” type of perk that would do 2 things:

1) Attract a lot of attention  to this campaign, so everyone would see all the awesome things we are offering.

2) Give one VERY lucky Annihilator, metal and Camaro fan the ultimate package!  

First off, the contributor that gets this package will get Jeff’s very own custom “ANNIHILATOR EDITION” Chevrolet Camaro SS (2012) packed with goodies:

      • Killer custom-installed audio system from Cerwin-Vega, including a Kenwood Excelon (DDX891HD Navigation/Receiver              
      • Airaid 251-243 Cold Air Intake
      • Magnaflow Performance 15092 exhaust
      • Jet Performance 90160 Pulley set/underdrive pulley set
      • Diablosport Trinity-tuned and have used only 94 Octane fuel
      • Massive & Maximum Performance Pirelli P Zero 305/35ZR20 (104Y) rear tires
      • American Racing Rims / Sensors
 

The car is 3.5 years old, has never been in an accident and is in fantastic condition. There are 2 scratches and 2 small dents; pics on request.

Next, when you come to get your car, you can stay with Jeff at his house for 2 days/1 night. If you want to jam in his studio, get some lessons, go for a bike ride with him… or simply just hang out: this will be a blast!

When you leave Jeff’s house, you will also get:

      • Jeff’s personal Epiphone “Annihilation” V guitar: Out of production for a few years and is not available anywhere!
      • The new Epiphone “Annihilation II” V guitar from Jeff’s studio stock.
      • A rare Laboga "Jeff WatersSignature" guitar amplifier. Only 2 left in Jeff’s collection and you get one!

Now if that’s not enough, Jeff and the boys will give you 2 guest-list tickets/passes to any Annihilator non-festival show FOR LIFE.

MAIN TERMS:
Jeff’s home, studio, car and other items in the package are located in Dunrobin, Ontario, Canada (not far from Ottawa). You will be responsible for getting yourself there at a mutually agreed upon date & time and taking it all with you.
If, for some reason, you don't wish to come to Jeff’s, you can arrange, at your own expense, to have it all shipped to you.
As different countries, states and provinces have different paperwork to be sorted out, in order to transfer car ownership, the contributor and Jeff will sort it out together.
Additional details to be discussed.

Simple, yet we hope you can help us with this one!
We have a nice autographed postcard from Jeff & 2 of his Jim Dunlop custom guitar picks!

• Get one of Jeff’s new Epiphone “Annihilation II” V guitar’s from his studio stock, signed if you like.
• 1 hour Skype guitar lesson from Jeff.
• 1 hour Skype lesson from Aaron.

We will pay for shipping (FedEx) but you'll be responsible to pay customs/duties/tax that your country may charge you. When you choose this package, we will send you the shipping cost. Date and time of lessons to be worked out by Jeff, Aaron and yourself.

• Jeff and the boys will give you 2 guest-list tickets to any Annihilator non-festival show FOR LIFE.
• Get one of Jeff’s new Epiphone “Annihilation II” V guitar’s from his studio stock, signed if you like.
• 1 hour Skype guitar lesson from Jeff.
• 1 hour Skype lesson from Aaron.

We will pay for shipping (FedEx) but you'll be responsible to pay customs/duties/tax that your country may charge you. When you choose this package, we will send you the shipping cost. Date and time of lessons to be worked out by Jeff, Aaron and yourself.

Come on out to Dunrobin, Ontario, to Jeff’s home and studio! Spend 2 days/1 night with him & jam in his studio, get some lessons, go for a bike ride with him… or simply just hang out!

When you leave Jeff’s house, you will also get one of his new Epiphone “Annihilation II” V guitar’s from his studio stock
AND
Jeff and the boys will give you 2 guest-list tickets to any Annihilator non-festival show FOR LIFE.

Jeff’s home & are located in Dunrobin, Ontario, Canada (not far from Ottawa). You will be responsible for getting yourself there at a mutually agreed upon date & time and taking the guitar with you.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word and share this campaign with your friends: WE NEED YOUR HELP, FRIENDS!

Our Plans & Expenses

Here are the major expenses for our upcoming year, before our next studio CD. Although we get income from our live shows and a loan from our record company for our upcoming DVD release, these don’t even come close to covering most of the costs below.

• Flights: For example, international flights for 8 band/crew, on just a summer festival tour, can cost around $35,000. Add to this the flight costs for rehearsals in Canada, touring, one-off shows, acoustic & live DVD shoots and this adds at least $30,000 more.
• Equipment shipping.
• Tour bus, vans, trucking, gas, and related expenses for our upcoming European tour will cost roughly $35,000.
• Hotels, food, taxis, rentals.
• Lawyer, accountant, bookkeeper & work visas.
• Live concert DVD recording & mini documentary: audio engineers, camera crew, and lights, sound, guitar & drum techs.
• Acoustic DVD: audio engineer, camera crew, techs.
• DVD package artwork, video editing, audio mixing & mastering.
story_txt:
Our Campaign
Well, it’s been 15 studio
CDs, more than 1000 shows around the world and we’re planning some awesome
things for our fans. Despite the sad state of the music
business, Annihilator have never given up and hope we’ve given you some good
music and good times along the way!
Now, we urgently need your help to raise money for touring,
shows, the live acoustic DVD, the mini documentary DVD and the live concert DVD we are planning.
Although we have a very supportive label and touring agency, these ambitious
plans cost a lot more money than any of us have. See the expense
list below and we're sure you'll understand.
In return for your contributions, we’ve come up with some
amazing things to offer you: From Jeff’s custom Chevy Camaro muscle car, to
watching an Annihilator live-streamed rehearsal, hanging out at Jeff’s home and studio, getting some of his guitars, free concert tix for life, AND MORE… See the gallery section for pics of the perks. We
hope you love these killer packages as much as we loved making them!
Obviously, not everyone will be able to afford or will want the car package but hopefully it has pointed you to the Live Rehearsal Stream Package and the others.
Thanks for your time and hopefully your contributions!

Exclusive Packages

Remember, everything available here is exclusive to this
campaign!

We think this is going to be one of the coolest packages:

We want  you to join us for a 1 hour live streamed rehearsal in September.

Live from Watersound Studios, ANNIHILATOR will be getting ready for the 2nd European tour for the “SUICIDE SOCIETY” record. Let’s get an army of metal fans watching us working on songs we will play on the next tour!
 There will be 4 rehearsals days in early September; we'll give you a few choices (dates and times) to choose from.
Here we have a high resolution print of the original lyric sheet / songwriters' agreement for the Annihilator classic Alison Hell!
The lyric sheet was signed by Jeff Waters and John Bates, the writers of the song (witnessed by first bassist Dave Scott) in 1986. Jeff will also sign the top right of the document for you, so you know it's an original. It will be mailed to you unfolded.

We wanted to think of a “Grand Prize” type of perk that would do 2 things:
1) Attract a lot of attention  to this campaign, so
everyone would see all the awesome things we are offering.
2) Give one VERY lucky Annihilator, metal and Camaro fan the ultimate package!  
First off, the contributor that gets this package will get Jeff’s very own custom “ANNIHILATOR EDITION”
Chevrolet Camaro SS (2012) packed with
goodies:      • Killer custom-installed audio system from
Cerwin-Vega, including a Kenwood Excelon (DDX891HD Navigation/Receiver              
      • Airaid 251-243 Cold Air Intake      • Magnaflow Performance 15092 exhaust
      • Jet Performance
90160 Pulley set/underdrive pulley set

      • Massive & Maximum Performance Pirelli
P Zero 305/35ZR20 (104Y) rear tires
      • American Racing Rims / Sensors The car is 3.5 years old, has never been in an accident and is in fantastic condition. There are 2 scratches and 2 small dents;
pics on request.

out: this will be a blast!

story:
After months of work and creativity, we list the pre-production of an album that I want to share with everyone so as has already been the first single "Awake" ... but for that to happen we must be able to mix, master, and publish, and that is why we need your support at this stage.

I'm Silvana Romero, a singer who after years of flirting with the music today is committed 100% to follow this dream because I think we all deserve what we dream, and that's why I played it and leave aside all performing before into music because it is what excites me and was perhaps the fear that held me, but no more.

I need your support to record, mastering, mixing and also to promote and publish this album, which in its creation stage already completed.
Today having a disc is work that is achieved with the help of family, friends, acquaintances and also the fans, and that's something that makes changing the music industry is seen as a team, achieving music is the achievement of all.

What we need and what you get:

Need to finance the recording studio, mixing, mastering, publishing and promotion.
 
You'll have to help your disk rewards as physical, digital and autagrafo disk.

Thank you very much and blessings

Sil Romero

story:
What Is Project Prayer Song?

Hello music lovers!

We are a team of like minded individuals who are extraordinarily passionate about music, multimedia, and making the world a better place. On January 22nd, 2016, we launched Project Prayer Song, and asked people online to contribute their voices to the choruses of our song. Since then we've received hundreds of submissions from across the globe, from countries like the U.S., Canada, Italy, France, Spain and Serbia. We've also been taking our portable studio rig out locally & regionally, recording all sorts of people at public and private recording events, out on the streets... and pretty much anywhere else!

To date, we've recorded over 400 voices! 

 

 

Click Here To Hear A Clip Of The Song!!!

 

After nearly a year of investing our own time & money (and also, a LOT of blood, sweat and tears) into this project, we're more than confident that we're on the golden path to success. Not only have we seen, firsthand, the joy that this project has brought to the people who have been involved with it thus far, but we've also seen it change them from the inside out. In short, we've seen this project working.

We've also landed gear sponsorships with several high end audio companies like Universal Audio, Slate Digital, Antares Tech., and Eventide, who also strongly believe in what we're doing, and who've already provided us with some of the equipment that we needed to get the job done.

 

 

And so now, we're ready to take this project to the next level. But we can't do that without your support!

 

So What Is "The Next Level?"

We've planned an 80 city US tour which kicks off at 'South By Southwest' in Austin next March. The tour will run for about 15 months, and during this time, we'll be recording as many different people, from as many different demographics as we can find. It's super important to us to show diversity, and by traveling around the United States, we're certain we'll find what we're looking for. We're also shooting a full length feature documentary of the entire process.

 

 

We're also in the beginning stages of developing a smartphone app for iOS and Android, which will be available for free once the tour starts. Basically, this app will allow anyone with a smartphone, earbuds and an internet connection to submit their vocals to the project from anywhere in the world. Woot!

 

 

What Is The Impact Of A Project Like This?

We live in the internet age, and clearly, the internet has connected us in ways we could have never imagined. But at the same time, it seems as if we are more disconnected than ever... on a personal level. We believe that a project like this not only demonstrates the power of what we can accomplish when we put our differences aside and come together for a common cause, but also helps to create exciting opportunities for different people to hang out with one another, united by a common interest. People who may normally have never done something like that before. The possibilities are endless...

 

 

But let's be honest, everyone says that their project is "going to change the world." We aren't going to assume that Project Prayer Song will disrupt the very fabric of space and time. Or it might, who knows. What we can promise, though, is an outcome that will plant seeds in the minds of human beings across the globe. Seeds that we believe will flower into something greater than this project's original purpose.

Another major impact of this project, is the fact that half of the proceeds of the sale of the single will be donated to local charities we visit on the tour. Yep, you heard that right. Our plan is to stop in various cities along the way, and lend a helping hand to charitable organizations. 

Personally. 

Soup kitchens, homeless shelters, you name it. And, hopefully, in the process, we'll be able to record some of these folk's voices for the project too... along with hearing their personal stories. This has always been an important component to us, and we're very excited to make a real difference in people's lives, if we can.

* As soon as the tour schedule develops a little more over the fall/winter of 2016, we will provide a list of charities that we are planning to visit/donate to on our website. Please be sure to check back with us for updates.

 

What We Need.

In order to accomplish these goals, we need to raise $250,000. Please believe us when we tell you that this amount was the absolute lowest that we could whittle the budget down to. And we still had to cut a lot of corners to arrive at *that* number.

Now, we know that's a lot of money for most people (it is for us too!), but when you look at it in terms of what we're spending it on, it's actually pretty low...

For instance, for a 4 person team to be on the road for 15 months, it takes more than just an RV and some spare time. We have to eat. At five dollars a meal (@ 3 meals a day), per person, for 4 people, that's $60 a day. Over 15 months, that adds up to $25,200. Then there's fuel, RV parks, phone, internet, equipment costs, app development costs, etc. All these things add up! 

 

* A four person team is crucial to the success of this tour. Not only are two people not enough in terms of manpower (recording audio, shooting video, editing, social outreach, etc.) but a four person team is also imperative for security and safety reasons while traveling to unknown areas of the country.

 

What We Want To Give You In Return:

We took a LOT of time and effort to think about the perks for this campaign, because we knew that only giving away T-Shirts and mugs was a bit of a cop out. We wanted to go way beyond that, and give you something special and memorable..

We reached out to cutting edge visual artists from all over the world, and asked them if they’d be interested in contributing their artwork to our project. We had an OVERWHELMINGLY positive response, and since then, we’ve received material from artists like Android Jones, Amanda Sage, Cameron Gray, and a bunch of other amazing individuals who were excited to get involved.

"Galactavangel" by Android Jones.

 

Along with all of this artwork, we’ve also included some of the usual perks like T-shirts, one of a kind posters, laser etched dog tags, and of course digital downloads and physical copies of the song on vinyl, when it’s finished. We even came up with a few fun interactive perks as well, like personal phone calls & videos from the team, and our personal favorite, Jesse cooks you a lasagna when we’re in your town!

* The reason there are SO MANY perks in this campaign, is because we are offering many of the art pieces on different mediums (print, canvas, metal, etc..) and at various dimensions. We wanted to make sure we gave everyone an opportunity to be able to purchase some of this incredible work!

 

Behind The Scenes:

Prayer Song is written by Jesse Scott (aka: Summer Channel) and Oriel Poole. 

Jesse Scott (aka: Summer Channel) is a twenty-one year veteran music producer who has released countless original albums and singles, and has written original music with Adam Lambert, Jes, Chrysta Bell, and many others. He’s also remixed artists such as Madonna, Seal, David Bowie, Shiny Toy Guns, Paul Oakenfold, The Crystal Method, Markus Schulz, Delirium, Celldweller, Curve, Johnny Cash, and Frank Sinatra (just to name a few). He’s written music that has appeared in major motion pictures such as Bad Boys II, Tomb Raider, and The Art Of War; television shows like CSI, Arrow and Buffy the Vampire

* See interview with Jesse Scott below:

 

 

Oriel Poole is a newly established vocalist based in Los Angeles, California. Oriel's ethereal vibes are matched by a voice blending compassion, soul, and light. Check her out online at orielpoole.com

 

So What Could Go Wrong?

We've put a lot of time into thinking about this very question, and here are a few hurdles that we've been addressing.

  1. What happens if you only raise half the money? Do you still go on the tour? - The short answer to this question would be, yes. Obviously, we'd have to cut the tour down to almost a quarter of the cities we originally wanted to visit, but we still feel like something is better than nothing. That being said, it would make us tremendously sad to not visit all 80 cities, because we know there are A LOT of people across the country who would LOVE to be involved. We also feel like the crux of this project, technically speaking, will be the smart phone app. We truly believe that this is a crucial part of the mix, so we're definitely going to invest in that first.
  2. How are you going to manage all of those voices if you end up getting hundreds of thousands of submissions? - Another good question. At this juncture, our plan is to hire the help of an editing team to help us sort through them. It's a big endeavor, we know that. But we think that as this tour progresses, and our visibility among the world increases, finding willing editors may very well be the easiest part of this whole equation. Now, in terms of how we make all those voices fit together... that is an entirely new conundrum. We've already made 400 voices blend seamlessly together. We think that if we continue on the same path, in terms of our method, we'll be fine. Plus, there's some pretty amazing technology out there that can handle the workload.
  3. How are you going to respond to the people who get offended at the name "Prayer Song," because your project isn't centered around religion? - This one comes up a lot. In fact, we've already gotten some hate mail from folks whose feathers were ruffled by our project. We'll just say this... "Prayer" means a lot of different things to a lot of different people. To us, prayer means "an earnest hope or wish," as well as "a petition." No, seriously, look it up. It's in the dictionary. That being said, this project's intent is to be all inclusive, and to assume that one's definition is better than another... well, that would be just plain silly. 
  4. How are you going to manage living in an RV for 15 months? Won't that drive you guys crazy? - Not really. We've whittled all of our earthly possessions down to nothing but the things that fit into a small room. In fact, we've been living in a friend's small room for the last 6 months, in preparation for RV life. When we get the RV, it will be like living in a castle. We can't wait.

 

Can't Help Financially? That's OK! But Read On...

Trust us, we soooooo get it. We're not made of money either, and neither are 99% of most people on earth. (See what we did there?). But, look, this campaign's success isn't entirely dependent on every single person we know contributing in a financial aspect. To be honest, what we really need is for people to spread the word. And we're not talking about Facebook posts. Nope. Statistics show, that Facebook posts about random crowdfunding campaigns have about 1% real world engagement. Yep. Sad isn't it? Why is that?

Because there's simply too much white noise on the internet these days for anyone to care. Because the only thing that Facebook likes are good for, is nothing. That's why. So here's what you can do...

If you LOVE music, if you see the potential in this project like we do, if you want to help us create something that will be nothing short of magical, then please share this project with the people in your network who are in alignment.

And what we mean by "share" is, call them. Email them. PERSONALLY. Tell them what Project Prayer Song is about and why you're excited about it. That's how we can all make this work... by making that personal connection. 

Sound familiar? Yeah, exactly. That's what this whole project is about to begin with. And when human beings realize how powerful REAL HUMAN CONNECTIONS are, we'll see the world around us transform in a way that we can't possibly imagine.

Seriously. 

Now go be awesome. We believe in you.

 

For More Information:

Check out our website at projectprayersong.org

Follow Us On Facebook

Follow Us on Twitter

Follow Us on YouTube

Follow Us on Instagram

 

Press:

"Portland Today" Morning TV Talk Show on KGW8 (October 11, 2016).

Interview on NPR (October 3, 2016)

The Odyssey Online (October 1, 2016)

The Ventura Breeze (April, 2016)

"The Journey Begins" by Cameron Grey

 

"Silence Seekers" by Cameron Grey

 

"Gratitude For The Earth & Sky" by Cameron Grey

 

"Hummingbird Love" by Cameron Grey

"Rainbow Geisha" by Android Jones.

 

"Aftertaste" by Android Jones.

 

"Dharma Dragon" by Android Jones.

 

"Fertility" by Android Jones.

 

"Wildlife" by Android Jones.

 

"The Destiny Of Knowledge" by David Salgado.

 

"Limbic Resonance" by Amanda Sage.

 

"Regeneration" by Amanda Sage.

 

"Wisdom Keeper" by Amanda Sage.

 

"Healing" by Autumn Skye Morrison.

 

"Lightwork" by Autumn Skye Morrison

 

"Divinity Rising" by Autumn Skye Morrison.

 

"Compassion" by Autumn Skye Morrison.

 

"The One Eye Love" by Jah Ishka Lah.

 

"Room With A View" by Jah Ishka Lah.

 

"Communion Forsite" by Ka

 

"One Heart's Journey" by Ka

 

"Yin & Yang" woven blanket by Ka.

Or it might, who knows. What we can promise, though, is an outcome that will plant seeds in the minds of human beings across the globe. Seeds that we believe will flower into something greater than this project's original purpose.
Another major impact of this project, is the fact that half of the proceeds of the sale of the single will be donated to local charities we visit on the tour. Yep, you heard that right. Our plan is to stop in various cities along the way, and lend a helping hand to charitable organizations. 
Personally. 
Soup kitchens, homeless shelters, you name it. And, hopefully, in the process, we'll be able to record some of these folk's voices for the project too... along with hearing their personal stories. This has always been an important component to us, and we're very excited to make a real difference in people's lives, if we can.
* As soon as the tour schedule develops a little more over the fall/winter of 2016, we will provide a list of charities that we are planning to visit/donate to on our website. Please be sure to check back with us for updates.
 

What We Need.
In order to accomplish these goals, we need to raise $250,000. Please believe us when we tell you that this amount was the absolute lowest that we could whittle the budget down to. And we still had to cut a lot of corners to arrive at *that* number.
Now, we know that's a lot of money for most people (it is for us too!), but when you look at it in terms of what we're spending it on, it's actually pretty low...
For instance, for a 4 person team to be on the road for 15 months, it takes more than just an RV and some spare time. We have to eat. At five dollars a meal (@ 3 meals a day), per person, for 4 people, that's $60 a day. Over 15 months, that adds up to $25,200. Then there's fuel, RV parks, phone, internet, equipment costs, app development costs, etc. All these things add up! 
 


* A four person team is crucial to the success of this tour. Not only are two people not enough in terms of manpower (recording audio, shooting video, editing, social outreach, etc.) but a four person team is also imperative for security and safety reasons while traveling to unknown areas of the country.
 
What We Want To Give You In Return:
We took a LOT of time and effort to think about the perks for this campaign, because we knew that only giving away T-Shirts and mugs was a bit of a cop out. We wanted to go way beyond that, and give you something special and memorable..
We reached out to cutting edge visual artists from all over the world, and asked them if they’d be interested in contributing their artwork to our project. We had an OVERWHELMINGLY positive response, and since then, we’ve received material from artists like Android Jones, Amanda Sage, Cameron Gray, and a bunch of other amazing individuals who were excited to get involved.

"Galactavangel" by Android Jones.
 
Along with all of this artwork, we’ve also included some of the usual perks like T-shirts, one of a kind posters, laser etched dog tags, and of course digital downloads and physical copies of the song on vinyl, when it’s finished. We even came up with a few fun interactive perks as well, like personal phone calls & videos from the team, and our personal favorite, Jesse cooks you a lasagna when we’re in your town!
* The reason there are SO MANY perks in this campaign, is because we are offering many of the art pieces on different mediums (print, canvas, metal, etc..) and at various dimensions. We wanted to make sure we gave everyone an opportunity to be able to purchase some of this incredible work!
 
Behind The Scenes:
Prayer Song is written by Jesse Scott (aka: Summer Channel) and Oriel Poole. 
Jesse Scott (aka: Summer Channel) is a twenty-one year veteran music producer who has released countless original albums and singles, and has written original music with Adam Lambert, Jes, Chrysta Bell, and many others. He’s also remixed artists such as Madonna, Seal, David Bowie, Shiny Toy Guns, Paul Oakenfold, The Crystal Method, Markus Schulz, Delirium, Celldweller, Curve, Johnny Cash, and Frank Sinatra (just to name a few). He’s written music that has appeared in major motion pictures such as Bad Boys II, Tomb Raider, and The Art Of War; television shows like CSI, Arrow and Buffy the Vampire
* See interview with Jesse Scott below:


 

 
Oriel Poole is a newly established vocalist based in Los Angeles, California. Oriel's ethereal vibes are matched by a voice blending compassion, soul, and light. Check her out online at orielpoole.com
 

So What Could Go Wrong?
We've put a lot of time into thinking about this very question, and here are a few hurdles that we've been addressing.


What happens if you only raise half the money? Do you still go on the tour? - The short answer to this question would be, yes. Obviously, we'd have to cut the tour down to almost a quarter of the cities we originally wanted to visit, but we still feel like something is better than nothing. That being said, it would make us tremendously sad to not visit all 80 cities, because we know there are A LOT of people across the country who would LOVE to be involved. We also feel like the crux of this project, technically speaking, will be the smart phone app. We truly believe that this is a crucial part of the mix, so we're definitely going to invest in that first.

How are you going to manage all of those voices if you end up getting hundreds of thousands of submissions? - Another good question. At this juncture, our plan is to hire the help of an editing team to help us sort through them. It's a big endeavor, we know that. But we think that as this tour progresses, and our visibility among the world increases, finding willing editors may very well be the easiest part of this whole equation. Now, in terms of how we make all those voices fit together... that is an entirely new conundrum. We've already made 400 voices blend seamlessly together. We think that if we continue on the same path, in terms of our method, we'll be fine. Plus, there's some pretty amazing technology out there that can handle the workload.

How are you going to respond to the people who get offended at the name "Prayer Song," because your project isn't centered around religion? - This one comes up a lot. In fact, we've already gotten some hate mail from folks whose feathers were ruffled by our project. We'll just say this... "Prayer" means a lot of different things to a lot of different people. To us, prayer means "an earnest hope or wish," as well as "a petition." No, seriously, look it up. It's in the dictionary. That being said, this project's intent is to be all inclusive, and to assume that one's definition is better than another... well, that would be just plain silly. 

How are you going to manage living in an RV for 15 months? Won't that drive you guys crazy? - Not really. We've whittled all of our earthly possessions down to nothing but the things that fit into a small room. In fact, we've been living in a friend's small room for the last 6 months, in preparation for RV life. When we get the RV, it will be like living in a castle. We can't wait.

 

Can't Help Financially? That's OK! But Read On...
Trust us, we soooooo get it. We're not made of money either, and neither are 99% of most people on earth. (See what we did there?). But, look, this campaign's success isn't entirely dependent on every single person we know contributing in a financial aspect. To be honest, what we really need is for people to spread the word. And we're not talking about Facebook posts. Nope. Statistics show, that Facebook posts about random crowdfunding campaigns have about 1% real world engagement. Yep. Sad isn't it? Why is that?
Because there's simply too much white noise on the internet these days for anyone to care. Because the only thing that Facebook likes are good for, is nothing. That's why. So here's what you can do...
If you LOVE music, if you see the potential in this project like we do, if you want to help us create something that will be nothing short of magical, then please share this project with the people in your network who are in alignment.
And what we mean by "share" is, call them. Email them. PERSONALLY. Tell them what Project Prayer Song is about and why you're excited about it. That's how we can all make this work... by making that personal connection. 
Sound familiar? Yeah, exactly. That's what this whole project is about to begin with. And when human beings realize how powerful REAL HUMAN CONNECTIONS are, we'll see the world around us transform in a way that we can't possibly imagine.
Seriously. 
Now go be awesome. We believe in you.
 
For More Information:
Check out our website at projectprayersong.org
Follow Us On Facebook
Follow Us on Twitter
Follow Us on YouTube
Follow Us on Instagram

Interview on NPR (October 3, 2016)
The Odyssey Online (October 1, 2016)
The Ventura Breeze (April, 2016)

"Wildlife" by Android Jones.

"Regeneration" by Amanda Sage.
