story:
Story & Team


Vinyl For A Cause (VFAC) is a start-up record label based around the idea that music can be a driver for charitable good. We work with bands who cover and record each other's music on sides A and B of a 7-inch, limited edition vinyl record. Together, we then select a charity whose use most resonates with each set of bands and donate a percentage of the proceeds to the selected organization.

We are Adam Victorn and Charlie Greengoss, Co-Founders/Co-Owners of VFAC. We have worked for radio stations, concert venues, sports stadiums, ad agencies, and now the beloved wax circle. We’ve rooted Vinyl For A Cause in charity, passion, music, and the community. These collective professional experiences, combined with our enthusiasm towards music, lead us to considering ways that we can connect music with giving back to the community.

The spark that ignited Vinyl For A Cause took place on an routine night of spinning records and watching concert videos together. 

“We were....watching [concert] videos on Youtube…[including] Brand New covering Modest Mouse’s Trailer Trash. Jesse Lacey started off the video by talking about how it’s an honor to play this song and how much he loves and respects the music that they make. This really resonated with us...how cool the idea of musicians covering each other’s music really is…to get 2 bands together, that really respect and cherish each other’s music, and let them choose 1 or 2 songs to record straight to vinyl.” We each, independently thought, “we can do something with this together. We have something special.”

We're proud to have called Chicago home for the past 27 years, and are big proponents of the music scene here. That alone made it really easy to start off in the right direction, as there are a tremendous number of artists here who continue to inspire us year after year. We created VFAC with these local artists in mind, while also contemplating how to open up the conversation of music and charity on a national level, engaging bands from all over the country.

For our official launch campaign we've partnered with VH1 Save The Music Foundation, and will be donating half of the proceeds towards supporting music education programs across the US.

In the future we plan to continue recording with artists that want to shed light on important social, political, and other causes of their choice.

Impact

Vinyl For A Cause’s model allows for everyone to win. Not only are we helping to provide fans with really awesome limited vinyl, but we’re also giving artists a platform to gain national exposure and the opportunity to promote good and raise awareness for different causes.

We’ve enjoyed an exciting and productive year of pushing the VFAC brand out into the world. We have connected and formed lasting relationships with talented musicians and artists, as well as many other partners along the way. With your support, we will be able to launch a wide-reaching campaign. Fostering these influential relationships and further equating music with giving back to the community, all the while planning future releases with interested, like-minded artists. It is our hope that this campaign expands far beyond Chicago and that the VFAC mission statement resonates with artists of all styles and genres.

Press

Check us out on the cover of Audiation Magazine and read the interview on pages 23-26: http://www.calameo.com/read/00416370813412c295a2f

Read about us in Listen Live and Local: https://listenliveandlocal.com/2016/04/20/profile-vinyl-for-a-cause/

Read about us in the Wilmette Beacon: http://www.wilmettebeacon.com/vinyl-cause-pairs-local-artists-gives-back

Funding

Our next challenge is reaching the fundraising goal of $20,000. To date, we have paid out of pocket for all studio time, recordings, mixing/mastering, and merch. Your support will help cover the remaining campaign costs - pressing, merchandise logistics, and support for the musicians, production team, and graphic artists - for our first three releases while also increasing the percentage of proceeds donated to charity. Our collective voice will grow louder, providing us with the extra push we need to get up and off the ground. Every contribution, large or small, helps. With your support, together we can transform this concept into a much more expansive and effective reality. 

Bands For Our First 3 Releases

VFAC 001 - Railway Gamblers / The Leadfoot Band

Railway Gamblers originated on the southside of Chicago in March 2014. Individually, the four members had been very active in the local music scene and came together with primary songwriter, Brendan Folliard, who sought out a band to contribute to his extensive catalog of original songs.

Lead guitarist, Matt Fricks, and drummer/vocalist, Sean Wilmsen, had played music for over six years together prior to the formation of Railway Gamblers and the two were enlisted to contribute their respective roles. With the need for a bassist, Joe Sexton was recruited to serve as the backbone for the group's material.  http://www.railwaygamblers.com/

“We need to say ‘thank you’ and show that music truly can institute societal progress in the right direction.Giving back is important. Every single thing really does make a difference, and we do plan to continue finding ways to make a difference for these charities even after this record comes out. Vinyl For A Cause and music for charity – it can’t stop. Society needs it.” - Matt Fricks, Railway Gamblers

The Leadfoot Band founded themselves on bluegrass roots over a decade ago in the concrete jungle and bluegrass mecca of the southside of Chicago, The Leadfoot Band have branched out in all directions from there. Incorporating their love of bluegrass with their early urban influences of rock , funk and everything in between, the evolution of the band is hard to place. Fans have said Leadfoot is just hard driving bluegrass, some say they are rock infused jamgrass, or even a bastard child of Bill Monroe meets Metallica. The online music site JamGrass.net even says The Leadfoot Band is "A mix between Edward Sharpe and The Magnetic Zeros and Greensky Bluegrass." http://www.theleadfootband.com/

VFAC 002 - Jesse W. Johnson / Coed Pageant 

Jesse W. Johnson plays hooky-yet-dark rock & roll with the tiniest little twinge of country twang. Johnson is a veteran of the Chicago scene, having reached local acclaim fronting the rock trio Jet W. Lee, and his experience is immediately apparent upon first listen. As a solo artist, Johnson presents tight, muscular songcraft with beautiful melodies and surprisingly dark lyrics. Most of all, Johnson does something not so common today, tell a story, and it’s thoughtful word choice in his music that helps the listener personalize each song. Jesse recently released a 7” vinyl & EP called Primal Scream and is touring this summer in support of it. http://www.jessewjohnson.com/
“I’ve talked about doing a split release with some bands before, but Vinyl For A Cause made it way more meaningful and fun to do.The idea of incorporating charities into the mix, promoting independent music and working with other amazing musicians made it impossible to pass up.” - Jesse W. Johnson

Coed Pageant is the musical makings of Bradley (and usually Gretchen) Bergstrand. What started as a side project of their other band, The Palace Flophouse, soon became a full-time endeavor. After their initial Seasons EPs set and 100s of shows across the nation, Coed returned to their living room studio to record their newest release, Drag. They are currently touring again and would love to play near you. https://coedpageant.bandcamp.com/

VFAC 003 - IndigoSun / The Heard 

IndigoSun’s continuing mission is to manifest healing music that speaks of transcendence, self-evolution, and the limitless power of Love. Through the medium of dance-inciting grooves, soulful vocals, and raw analog energy, we take you out of the ordinary and into a world where dreams and reality merge into one.

We are a Chicago-based group with a deep admiration for past masters, a tenacious passion for the sounds of the future, and an avid dedication to spreading a message of positivity. Since forming in late 2009, the band has traversed a considerable amount of ground, releasing 2 studio albums and numerous live compilations, with another double-disc studio album currently in production; playing in more than 15 states throughout the US; and appearing at many of the Midwest’s premier music festivals, including North Coast, Summer Camp, Rootwire, The Werk Out, and many more. http://indigosunjams.com/

“[IndigoSun] always hoped to do something positive with our music,” says Liss. “In the nature of [touring], you don’t really make a lot in order to give too much. To actually be able to contribute to a good cause through a music project was really inspiring.” - Kyle Liss, IndigoSun

The Heard is a funk machine venerated for its deep pocket, authentic grooves, and reverence for legendary funk.

In The Heard's hometown of Chicago, the group cut its teeth delivering hard hitting performances at some of the city's top venues - the beloved alive One, Metro Chicago, Lincoln Hall, Concord Music Hall, and Congress Theater. The band has backed hip hop artist Lyrics Born, former Galactic vocalist Theryl "Houseman" DeClouet, and has shared stages across the U.S. with The New Mastersounds, Lettuce, The Nth Power, Dumpstaphunk, Orgone, The Motet, Karl Denson's Tiny Universe, Slightly Stoopid, The Funky Meters, and George Clinton and Parliament Funkadelic, to name a few. 

The Heard’s music features powerful horn melodies delivered with precision and swagger by Parris Fleming (trumpet), Bryant Smith (trombone) and Lucas Ellman (saxophone), the driving rhythm guitar playing of Taras Horalewskyj, tasteful keyboard work and soulful vocals by Cole DeGenova, and a slamming foundation provided by drummer PJ Howard and bassist Mike Starr. http://theheardfunk.com/

Album/Campaign Artwork

VFAC 001 - By Matt Gizyn


VFAC 002 - By Matt McGuire


VFAC 003 - By Tyler Gasek


VFAC Limited Edition Poster Design 1 - By Lauren Swearingen 


Risks and Challenges 

With any startup there will be risks and challenges. But risks and challenges are not necessarily a bad thing. They are actually motivators for us to become more creative and make the Vinyl For A Cause experience as extraordinary and as meaningful as possible. This is the very reason that we are committed to having each album numbered (0/500) and personally signed by the bands. While we understand that this may create a longer time-table for when the records join your collection, we feel that this added personal touch is invaluable. We will have a 3-6 month time-frame from when the campaign ends until the records get pressed and are ready to shipped. We will be sure to constantly post updates to all backers as we receive them.

Other Ways You Can Help

Want to become involved in the VFAC movement? You’re in luck! There are tons of ways you can do so - from signing up for our newsletter, to helping us spread the word via any of your social networks. The more people that know about us, the better.

And as our community continues to grow, we’re always open to speaking to those who'd like to volunteer their time and help us in any way they can. Just reach out and we will be sure to get back to you as soon as we can. We’d love to hear from you!

For more information, please visit www.vinylforacause.com, or visit us on any of our social networks.

Like us on Facebook: www.facebook.com/vinylforacause 

Follow us on Twitter: www.twitter.com/vinylforacause 

Follow us on Instagram: www.instagram.com/vinylforacause 


Acknowledgements 

From the bottom of our hearts, our deepest gratitude to anyone that helped shape VFAC into what it is today. Special thanks to Saper Law, Treehouse Records, Railway Gamblers, The Leadfoot Band, IndigoSun, The Heard, Jesse W. Johnson, Coed Pageant,  Fix8 Media, Fire Engine Red Films, Honey Mint Papery, Yoo Soo Kim, Mike Hagler, Tyler Gasek, Matt Mcguire, Matt Gizyn, Audiation Magazine, Listen Live and Local, The Wilmette Beacon, DNA Info Chicago, and all of our friends and family.

Want to become involved in the VFAC movement? You’re in luck! There are tons of ways you can do so - from signing up for our newsletter, to helping us spread the word via any of your social networks. The more people that know about us, the better.And as our community continues to grow, we’re always open to speaking to those who'd like to volunteer their time and help us in any way they can. Just reach out and we will be sure to get back to you as soon as we can. We’d love to hear from you!For more information, please visit www.vinylforacause.com, or visit us on any of our social networks.Like us on Facebook: www.facebook.com/vinylforacause Follow us on Twitter: www.twitter.com/vinylforacause Follow us on Instagram: www.instagram.com/vinylforacause 





Acknowledgements 
From the bottom of our hearts, our deepest gratitude to anyone that helped shape VFAC into what it is today. Special thanks to Saper Law, Treehouse Records, Railway Gamblers, The Leadfoot Band, IndigoSun, The Heard, Jesse W. Johnson, Coed Pageant,  Fix8 Media, Fire Engine Red Films, Honey Mint Papery, Yoo Soo Kim, Mike Hagler, Tyler Gasek, Matt Mcguire, Matt Gizyn, Audiation Magazine, Listen Live and Local, The Wilmette Beacon, DNA Info Chicago, and all of our friends and family.

story:
If you have reached this page after May 7th, The campaign is ended here on IndieGoGo, but We are having another CD presale campaign on Kickstarter - you can find it here: (link coming soon)

If you want a sneak peek - You can NOW LISTEN FREE OR DOWNLOAD one of the brand new songs on the Through The Fire Album - "Love Will FInd You", as well as 2 songs off the 1991 album, Restoration - "Who Do I Believe" and the title track, "Bride of Restoration".  GO HERE NOW TO LISTEN OR PURCHASE THESE TRACKS! Enjoy!

You can also keep up with Mark's journey by liking his artist page 

on Facebook:

http://www.facebook.com/markpoguemusic

AND signing up for email updates at: 

http://www.MarkPogue.com 

If you sign up to receive emails on Mark's website, you will be entered into a drawing for some cool freebies - we'll contact the winners via email!

Thanks! 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

In 1991, Mark put out his first Christian Rock album, Mark Pogue & Fortress - Restoration. The album was written after his conversion to Christ during his divorce, and the title track, Bride of Restoration, was written not only about the restoration of his marriage to his ex-wife, Mita (that would be me), but also told the beautiful and eternal story of the Bride of Christ. Several of the songs on the album reached the the top 10 on the CCM charts. 

After touring with artists such as Morgan Cryar, Rick Cua, and DeGarmo & Key, among others, Mark played briefly for various Christian bands, doing concerts with Neal Morse, appearing on TV with Paul Q-Pek as well as doing vocal  arrangements, and fabulous guitar work with various other bands on many album projects. Mark also faithfully served for many years playing in and directing the worship band at church, all while working a regular day job to support his wife and 3 children.

Here is Mark playing live, on TV specials, and on official music video with some of the bands he's played with as a regular touring musician or guest musician.


Now, 25 years after the release of Restoration comes a brand new album project - Through The Fire.

Through The Fire has been in the making for over two years (probably more like 20 years!), and includes a few vintage songs that Mark wrote or co-wrote that didn't make it on the first album, Restoration. A lot of late nights and discussions have passed and we're pretty happy with the results, and we think you'll enjoy it, too!

You can be a part of getting this album released. Most of the music is finished - just a few tweaks and adjustments left. Much of the expense, such as additional musician pay, outside mixing, additional background vocal work, etc. has come straight out of our pockets with no outside funding at all. However, being a one income family with a dependent, disabled adult child, realistically we cannot truly complete the album without your help. We'll just have a lot of really awesome, rocking new music stored on our computer that only our friends and family will get to hear. 

So we're asking for your help to get this album finished. Our goal is at least $7,500 to get it finished completely as well as a short music video completed and we are trusting that God will bring the people we need to do it. 

Where's the money going?

  • CD Mastering 
  • CD replication
  • Artwork - What album would be complete without fabulous and memorable artwork? That answer to that is none. So we'll be hiring a graphic artist to complete the album artwork as well as for creating the T-Shirts and posters.
  • Perks - with each contribution, you will receive a perk, or two... possibly three, depending on the size of your contribution and the perk choices you make.
  • To pay for any additional musicians, vocalists, or techs needed to complete the project.
  • Promotional materials and advertising expenses. 
  • Miscellaneous expenses related to this project. This is our first time doing this so I will bet you there are things that will come up that I have not thought of yet or that I have not specifically mentioned here...
What kind of music is it? 

This album has an eclectic mix of influences like Rock, Pop, Folk, Blues, and as always the essential Ballad. All the songs on this album have some meaningful connection to our own lives as we've gone through some good times and some pretty bad times... sometimes we really felt like we were being drug through the mud and shoved through a wringer. Occasionally it got uncomfortably hot. It felt like going through a fire sometimes... hence the song Through The Fire, which is the title cut. Through it all, God was always faithful to us, and when it seemed like we just couldn't take anymore from the world, he would show up in amazing and miraculous ways.

Mark has a unique way of translating the joys and pain in our lives into song. I've always really loved that about him, and each song is the result of something God has shown us or brought us through. So it's basically a rock album with a Christian message. 

What about any future projects?

Mark has quite a few other songs we are thinking about putting on another project or two. Perhaps even a worship album. We're going to see what God leads us to do after this. And we'll definitely let you know!

****************************************************************************

Please feel free to leave a comment below, and we would appreciate it so much if you would share this campaign on Facebook, on Twitter, or via email. 

AUTOGRAPHS - 

Any of the perks that originate from our office can be autographed upon request. Just put your request into the notes at checkout after picking your perk. Please note that CDs will be opened to autograph them and they will be autographed on the front of the album insert.

Your prayers are also greatly appreciated as we step out in faith into this new season of our lives. Thank you so much for taking a look at our campaign and we pray that God will richly bless you! 

In Christ, Mark and Mita Pogue

Audio Deo Productions


"When you pass through the waters,
I will be with you;
and when you pass through the rivers,
they will not sweep over you.
When you walk through the fire,
you will not be burned;
the flames will not set you ablaze."

Isaiah 43:2

story:
Hey Folks...

If you've known me any days between 1976 and Today, there's a verrrrry good chance that I've played a guitar and sang some of my songs for you. Around a Campfire, in a Club, on your Couch, in your Kitchen or maybe on your Porch, on the Big Stage at a Major Summer Music Fest or countless other spots where we shared some music and created those memories together... 

While many of you shared during very visible performances along my creative path, what you may not know is that for all of these years, even during chapters when I've taken a break from playing LIVE shows, I have n e v e r stopped writing the songs that flow out of me consistently over all the years...Of ANY of the creative aspects of my life, Singer/Songwriter is the core of my passion and how I most identify myself, to myself.

As of now, my catalog of Original Songs I've written totals over 100...with more coming as they do...non-stop, always. The style falls under an Americana label, and yet even that label consists of a varied range of styles...SO many Artists have influenced me over the years, too many to ever list...Yet, I could offer up influences ranging way back from James Taylor, Cat Stevens, Jim Croce,The Eagles, America, Early Elton,CSN & Neil Young, Springsteen, Willie, Lyle Lovett, Michelle Shocked, Ray LaMontagne, Jason Isbel, Patty Griffin, Sheryl Crow, Radney Foster, Hal Ketchum, Jimmy Buffet, Miranda Lambert, Kacey Musgraves, Bruce Robison, Teddy Thompson, Robert Earl Keen, Steve Earl, Lucinda Williams, Dwight Yoakum...get it? 

All of these folks and so many more, yet none of them quite exactly....

Because of course, it's me....the songs sound, like, me. 
If you're a fan of any of the above Artists, there's a chance we'd connect on my songs too. 

And so, with my days of playing shows on the Big Stages to the Big Crowds being long behind me, I just assumed I was done. That train had left along with my dark hair long ago. Done with recording, done with ALL of it. Just. Done...Let the Young Guns, or, The Old Guns like Willie, carry on with the torch....riiiight?

Wrong.

Because....I finally realized....my torch isn't goin' out! 
You know how a Campfire can be just about out, just glowing embers, and you just fan the coals a a little bit and it erupts back into a full-on blaze? yeah, t h a t.

I have a life-time body of work in my song catalog, and I need to start making records and sharing my music with the world...If I recorded every song in my catalog starting today, I'd have 10-12 complete Records/CD of my original songs ready to go, not to mention the new songs that keep coming... 

I recently met with producer Robert Mokry, who I had recorded what I recalled as a few "demo" songs way back in 2001...I told him I thought I wanted to start recording a CD...Something simple... BigDougUnplugged kinda thing...He suggested I come to Austin to see his new studio and listen to some songs he had been working on...1st song: the band kicks in, I really dug the whole sound and I say to him..."Wow, sounds cool, who is this?"....and then, in a moment that literally changed my life from now until forever, he looks at me incredulously as says, "Who IS this? It's YOU!"

He then continued to showcase these songs, MY songs, a few of which I had completely forgotten I had ever even wrote! (...let alone recorded!)  How can I possibly convey the feeling, of hearing a song that sounds vaguely familiar, like, you've already heard it on the radio maybe, only to realize when the vocals kick in, that it's YOU singing? A song YOU WROTE and completely forgot about? And there were more to follow...It was mind blowing...and for me, life changing.

So as it turns out, I'm not done..I'm not done at all...I'm just getting started in fact...

And I will continue to write and record better and better songs the older I get and the more Life I've lived with more stories to tell...That's the Plan. I hope you'll take a listen to what I have to share for now, with open ears to how it will all sound when it is finished and fully produced with the full Studio Band...

The landscape of music making has changed over the years, "signing big record deals" and spending $100,000+ on recording a record are no longer the norm...Self-produced, low-budget-crowd-funded sources such as this Indiegogo site are the way that many Artists world-wide are getting their projects finished and to an audience around the world...This is where this website comes in and why I am asking for your support and I am hoping you will SHARE with your circle.

We will be making this record for under $10,000...for 13 songs-pressed and delivered by Nov.-Dec...That budget includes a highly skilled Producer/Studio Hourly Rental/Top TX Studio Musicians/Fully pressed & packaged CD for your listening pleasure. 

A top-level record, at a basement bargain budget. But I need your help to meet our production goal, by ordering YOUR copy of my new CD in advance, or in any other way you may like to support our efforts.

And listen Folks, I fully understand that I may never play the BIG Gigs again, no Record Labels are searching for a "New Artist" at my age...My singing style will never make The Voice, I'm not gonna be filling any Arenas alongside today's Hottest Acts...That's all completely fine, I've had some of that ride. However, I WILL continue to share my songs with whoever cares to listen, whoever wants to take me along on a roadtrip in your CD player... and I will hang on with the Dream of one day pitching my song catalog to other Recording Artists, (those already plugged into major careers, already getting radio play and already open to recording hits from other songwriters) catching wind of my songwriting talents...Either way, I have waaaay too much music inside to keep it there, I would like to share it all, with you all, and with the world, for many more years to come...

That's what this is really about...getting the music inside of me, outside of me to share with all.

Thanks for listening...

BigHug, 

BigDoug

story:
Greetings Friends!

We are Isistren, and we are asking you to help us bring our musical mission out into the world! We are grateful and excited to share our 1st EP with you, featuring 7 songs that are guaranteed to make your body groove, lift your vibes and expand your mind as we take you on a multi-cultural journey.

Isistren is a reggae band from Austin, TX who has been playing music since 2003.  That's  over 13+ years of growing as musicians, songwriters as well as friends and family.  It has been a long road getting to the studio, refining our sound, experiencing changes in our band and staying focused on our goal.

Every woman in the band is a mother, spouse, comforter, nurturer and glue for her family.  Coming together weekly to practice and play live shows, in addition to working full time has been a juggling act for all of us.  We call it our Livity, our way of life. What ties us all together is the music we play.

Isistren wants to show that you can hold a collective dream together and accomplish something concrete and meaningful. We believe in the power of music to heal, change the world and lift up the vibrations.  We are so grateful for this opportunity to share this with you now!

Isistren has been in the studio weekly since October 2015 recording this 7-song EP.  Our total costs up to date have been over $3000.00.  We have been self-funding this project through our own financial means, live gigs and merchandise sales.  Did we mention sweatshop labor and hard-work in our kitchens?

Isistren's goal is simple: to finalize the 4 songs that we currently have and to pay for the final recordings, mixing  and mastering. This process will take another 2 months which will cost $1500.00.  Our Indigogo goal is to reach this amount by November 1, 2016 so that we can release our EP on November 19, 2016 at Flamingo Cantina, Austin's premiere reggae club.

We currently have 3 of these 7 songs released and available to the public.  By completing these 4 songs, we will be able to get all 7 songs into an EP that can truly showcase Isistren's talents and work. 

Thank you so very much for donating to our cause! Isistren is so grateful and blessed to receive your gift.  Because we know that your time and money are valuable, we would like to give you further incentives to donate. 

Please see our reward structure below so that you will know what kind of Isistren gifts and merchandise you will receive for kindly donating to our cause.  Thank you, once again, and have a blessed day!

Give Thanks and One Love,
Isistren
(Maria, Anne, Rhapsody, Drummie Sue)

story:
I have been fortunate enough to have made a living from music for four decades now and that has only been possible because of the support of you the public.  It is something that I have never taken for granted and now in these times when community crowd sourcing is so vital for independent artists such as my self it is appreciated all the more.  I feel that this latest album has the potential to be my little masterpiece.  The songs are all written and are now crying out to be committed to tape.  The experience of recording in Prague while on tour there was so very inspiring to me and I long to return in order to carry on and see the project through to completion.  A couple of tracks have already been recorded elsewhere, namely LA and also one track in Berlin.  The latter being a collaboration with the ridiculously talented Anton Newcomb from The Brian Jones Town Massacre and Asia Argento who is possessed of probably the sexiest voice on the planet!  Still we have a ways to go and the beautiful city of Prague is calling!  The funds recieved via this campaign will go towards the studio costs, musicians fees, hotel, flights and possible a few bottles of the excellent local beer!

The perks on offer here include some rare and unique items such as the pinstriped suit that I wore on stage in the days when I was a very skinny lad indeed!  There is also a chance to actually fly to Prague and be a fly on the wall during one of the sessions!  Also up for grabs here is the actual X-Ray photograph (signed) that was taken of my injured hand.  This was incurred in the Prague studio.  Fortunately I had recorded all of my parts and was being interviewed by a local radio station when the incident happened.  I was simply gesticulating in a rather theatrical manner as I told a story and SNAP! Something drastic happened to the middle finger of my right hand.  It was excruciating and I very reluctantly had to cancel the second of my shows in Prague that evening.  My next port of call was Bucharest and I spent my initial three hours in that fair city in the urgent care ward of the local hospital.  There were no broken bones but it was a pretty severe case of ‘trigger finger’ (damaged tendon)  Apparently it is a common condition amongst musicians and results from ‘repetitive action’.  I am on the mend now thankfully.  I know that I have many loyal supporters out there who come back time and time again to help with these creative endeavors so please believe me when I say that your ‘repetitive action’ of making a pledge will not go unappreciated!  Please feel free to help spread the word regarding this campaign and post liberally on the web.  You are all part of this dream!

Thank you!

David

story:
Hello everyone and thank you so much for visiting and potentially contributing to my indiegogo campaign! I can't tell you how much your support means to me and how excited I am to share my music with you. This album is inspired by and dedicated to what I am most passionate about: the real, raw, and imperfect love I've observed and felt for myself and others. 

As far as the monetary aspect of my campaign goes, here's a breakdown of the $7,500 I'm asking for. Over half of the money is going towards the 9 musicians who are my amazing band. They have put so much of themselves and their individuality into my music and given it a life that has surpassed what I hoped for. I want be as generous with them as they have been with me. The second largest portion goes towards my fantastic producer and sound engineer as well as 4 days of studio rental time. The rest will go towards hard-copy CD production, album cover art, photography, and promotional material.

Thank you once again for visiting and/or contributing to my campaign and I hope to share my music with you very soon! If you have any questions or anything you'd like to talk about concerning this project or my music in general please feel free to contact me via email, alexpkeller@gmail.com. Much love! <3

story:
What is The Carriage?

Hello and thank you for visiting my campaign! My name is Tal Katsir and I’m a singer, pianist and composer who decided she is going to make her dream a reality and build "The Carriage" - A Traveling Musical Stage! 

How is it going to happen?

Equipped with amplification and lights, and decorated in a medieval style, "The Carriage" is a transformed pickup truck with its open cargo functioning as a stage. The flexibility and light setup of The Carriage will enable spontaneity, authenticity, and rare musical moments. I hope to bring my music to places "outside of the box", I hope to make friendships and to make music live, fun, and real with all I have, my heart and soul.

First Journey?

The first journey of The Carriage will be a tour across the US, visiting 15 states in 3 months showcasing “Self Help” - my newly released solo album. I will travel from the busiest city centers to small quiet towns, I hope to perform on a mountain, in the forest, maybe at a desert, I will sing 2 shows every day and camp during the nights.

What does it take?

A second-hand pickup truck (The open cargo area is the stage)

An amp with 2 portable power banks

A keyboard and a mic (Which I already have yey!)

Light stand

Car paint and a bubble machine

Where are you?

The 3 months journey of The Carriage and me will be filmed and documented throughout so you can follow all our adventures, struggles and triumphs. The Carriage's supporters will also receive some truly wonderful perks! So - If you feel like me, that The Carriage is something that can greatly benefit the world and our music in it, please take part in this crazy beautiful project and I promise - The Carriage Will Come To You Too!

story:
Hello!

My name is Sylvia Rose Novak. I'm an Americana artist. And I am trying to release my third full-length record in the best possible way.

There are a lot of things that nobody tells you when you decide to become a musician. Especially things about the recording and release process. After my first two projects, I discovered that album releases need to be carefully planned. I also discovered that this careful planning costs much more than throwing the record out to the world and hoping that it is well-liked.

Someone Else's War is the album I have been trying to make since I wrote my first song five years ago. It is finally, truly, my voice. 

What We Need

Here's the thing, I want to bring you amazing gear and an amazing album, but that costs money. That's where you come in!

This album is releasing on a very very limited run of CDs, on vinyl, and digitally. Vinyl is expensive to purchase because it is expensive to produce.

Also, I still need to finish paying for the mixing and mastering of the album before it can be released. I have the most patient and brilliant engineer who has already donated his time and talent to make this my best project to-date. 

What You Get

Depending on the amount of your donation, you'll receive various 100% exclusive perks. Special edition vinyl, limited run CDs, badass t-shirts, house concerts, and more!

And, if you donate over $300, you'll be automatically entered for a chance to receive a signed electric violin!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, please spread the word! My first two albums are available all over the internet. Like my facebook page. Keep up with me on social media. Come see us live. Every little bit of attention helps.

story:
Give.Get.Dance.Repeat 

 

Music/Art & Everyday Life - forever intertwined for so many of us. 

Finding ways to strike a balance between being a full time musician/artist/songwriter  & wanting to give more of my time to others is quite the journey. I have a natural born tendency to write songs about empowering our spirits. (Blame my Pops, Jimmy Holiday for that one.) 

Jeff Fedak & I originally wrote "Waiting for a Lifetime" for a same sex couple that had been waiting for years to get married in their own state. I now realize that the lyrics are for anyone & everyone who fights for their rights on a sometimes imbalanced or silenced playing field.  It's been 3 years since my last video with Tony Moran for our hit "I Like You".  So I want this next one to be extra special.

I had, of course, intended to complete a dance video with my last crowd funding effort, but as many of you know - all of the funding did not make it's way though that "other" crowd funding site. (Not this one, LOL)  In fact by the time they went back to collect - only half of our original campaign funding amount made it to us. 

My Goal:  Once all the mixes are completed, 2 videos will be produced.

1. Video One: Will include collected clips (from as many people as possible) who will participate on screen as a part of a video ~ singing & chanting along with me. (Lyrics included below) 

2. The Second Video will be a longer format including add'l footage of shared stories from those who have felt marginalized  ... and yet they peacefully stand up & live in ways that inspire us all. 

A free mix of "Waiting For A Lifetime" will be provided via digital download for people (maybe YOU) to film as you sing along! 

Where the money will go: 

Mixing & Mastering the single & all the various versions. (There will be at least 10 different mixes available.) 

Promotion of the single. (This one's a doozy) - So many aspects these days to reaching listeners on a DIY basis ! 

Artwork for the single. 

Video editing for 2 versions of the dance single. 

Lastly ... As much as I want to fund my single - I also feel inclined to pay forward a bit more than just the music & video. To that end - 10% of all funds received for this campaign will be evenly split between two organizations close to my heart, Family Equality Council & St. Jude Chidren's Research Hospital. 

 

What You'll Get: 

10 or more mixes of "Waiting For A Lifetime" and Two Music Videos (one for the song & one longer documentary style - which might include YOU - if you film your story & send it to us!) 

The remix/producers on board so far include: Tony Moran, Dirty Disco, Wayne G, DJ MissDirection & Larry Peace. And ... yes ... there are a few surprise mixers involved, as well ! Everyone who backs this project will receive all of the mixes delivered via email download. 

Now -- jump to the next section to check out the perks Baby! 

 

 WAITING FOR A LIFETIME

(Holiday/Fedak/Wilson)

I have been consumed – by the love I feel for you

& Nobody can tell me, nobody can tell me I’m wrong

When you know it’s meant to be – a perfect harmony

& You know the words, yeah you know the words to my song 

So get out of our way cuz we stand here today in love 

 

I been waiting for a Lifetime, Lifetime, Lifetime 

Waiting for the right time to say it loud

And no more hearing sometime, sometime, Soon Baby 

You’ll be free to stand here proud 

My Life – My love 

My heart – Never gave up 

And I know I’m right 

I, I, I, I … Been … Waiting for a lifetime   

 

Instantly we knew – yeah that this would be our truth 

And so hand in hand, yeah hand in hand we have marched 

And, so now the day has come – when we’re diving into one 

One life we will live, one fight that we fought from the start 

So get out of our way cuz we stand here today in love 

 

Repeat Chorus: 

 

If you believe in love, let me hear you say it – Say it 

If you believe in love, if you believe – Do you believe? 

If you believe in love, let me hear you say it – Say it 

If you believe in love, if you believe – Do you believe? 

Cuz I believe – Do you believe? 

 

Repeat Chorus:

story:
“Ruth’s songs are a true wonder. Her voice bathes over me
as if I have soaked myself in a healing sound-shower.”
Steve Lee, Glastonbury FM


Beloved Ones,

The time has finally come around to ask you to come on board with this project: my new album 'Creation'. Thank you for being here. The jist of this crowdfunder is - I'm making an album, I'm on the final leg of the journey and I need your help to make it happen. I have some beautiful gifts to offer in exchange. I hope you will dive in and find some treasures that will excite and inspire you, and most of all I hope that together we can make this happen and bring this new wave of healing into the world. Outlined below is what I'm doing, what I'm asking, what I'm offering, and the story of it all.

 

The Background

It seems like a lifetime ago that I asked you to join me on my maiden voyage - my debut album, 'Lullabies for Grown-Ups' - an album of songs straight from my heart that I still turn to when I need to receive the medicine they bring. I remember how much fear and self-doubt I had about running a crowdfunder back the and the support I received blew my socks off! All those that supported me then, I thank you again now! And all those who are newly joining me - hello! I'm so thrilled and delighted and all manner of lovely words to be connecting to an ever greater web of beautiful hearts. I welcome you into my life, and I thank you for considering to join me on this journey.

The new album is a totally different flavour to my 'Lullabies...', and its journey into being has been bigger, longer and more adventurous. I promised myself from the beginning that I would give it time and space to breathe and not limit myself with fears of lack, and as a result I feel my creativity has been allowed to blossom.

The album naturally became a creative collaboration of artists, all of whom I wish to honour for their incredible work, which is why I have included a fee for them in my funding goal. Francesca Booth and Chloe Purcell have given months and months of their time, commitment and inspiration  to create unique offerings of artwork and animation that form part of the wider vision for enriching, celebrating and promoting the album.

 

What I'm asking for

Recording, releasing and promoting an album is a big undertaking, and expensive for an unsigned artist without the support of a record label. This epic nature of this collaborative project is reflected in the amount I am now looking to raise - £12,000. It is not easy to estimate some of the costs in advance but the rough breakdown is:

Recording & Mixing - £4000
Mastering - £600
CD Duplication - £1500
Artwork & Sleeve Design - £1000
Print & Framing costs - £900
Web Support (Ongoing) - £400
Launch Party - £1000
Music Video - £1000
Miscellaneous Expenses - £500
Indie Gogo Fees - £600 - £1100 (5-9% depending if goal is met)

*Any extra money raised will go towards promotion such as a radio campaign.

If finances are difficult for you but you still want to offer your support, the best way is to share, share, share! Share the campaign, my brand new Patreon site, Soundcloud, You Tube, Spotify and website links. Let people know about your relationship with my music and invite them to join in, listen and share it themselves... If you have skills that you feel may help me in marketing or promotion, or if you are able to write blogs, reviews or articles to promote me and the new album, then please please get in touch. This can be invaluable support and I am happy to offer tailor-made exchanges for your time.

 

What I'm Offering

Please enjoy looking through the 'perks' I have lovingly put together to show my gratitude for your offerings towards this album:

  • Be the first to receive a CD with a stunning sleeve designed using Francesca's beautiful artwork, signed with all my love, or a digital download if you prefer;
  • Choose from five exquisite framed prints - illustrated reflections of the songs - by Francesca Booth;
  • Lyrics and chords to any of my songs for you to learn, with some extra teaching if wanted;
  • Opportunities to work with me 1-1 or as part of a gathering out in nature to receive personalised healing mantras and sound healing, learn sacred songs, and explore and develop your relationship with your own voice and creativity;
  • Join me and my new band for a wonderful launch party to celebrate the big day, with a live rendition of the whole album including no less than FOUR part harmonies (anyone who knows me well will know that harmonies are my thing so this is very exciting for me!).

So please see what inspires you! Contributions are a minimum guideline so please give whatever you want. Please get in touch if you want to discuss your own tailor made option.

 

If you want more juice... read on!

The Creation Story

Creation features one of my earliest songs, ‘Baba Yaga’, which came to me in the midst of writing my lullabies and was an important sign of things to come. Baba Yaga is a fierce archetype of death and transformation and although in the song I am calling to her, in many ways it has always been her calling to me.

"Send your plough o'er the bones of the dead
And let the ground renew the skin that you shed..."
Baba Yaga, Creation

Baba Yaga called in the death of the 'me' that identified as a sweet gentle soul that didn't want to get things wrong or ruffle anybody up the wrong way. Out of the ashes of Baba Yaga's fire is emerging a woman so committed to speaking her own truth that ruffling feathers becomes inevitable; a woman that no longer wants to apologise for who she is and what she feels; a woman beginning to feel secure enough in her self-worth to follow the call of her heart even if it means being judged; a woman who is beginning to love and accept herself in all her perfect imperfection.

I could feel Baba Yaga brewing within me for months, and once finally born into song, I found it utterly terrifying to play for at least two years! It expresses something of my spirit that I hadn't consciously shown to anyone before. However as she began to live through me again, she breathed a new power into my life and my song-writing. In retrospect I see that she needed her own soul family of songs to live amongst.

The Songs:

  • 'Baba Yaga' - The album's big mama!
     
  • 'Excalibur' - My call for courage... Calling on the divine masculine sword of light to cut through and illuminate anything in my perception that is not truth, and pry away the grasping, clawing fear that I needed to hide my heart's expression to retain the approval of others;
     
  • 'Call to Love' arrived when I received my spiritual name from Great Spirit: 'Mbilou', the Eagle. This name is my inner compass that guides me towards my true nature as a leader and visionary;
     
  • 'Forge & Flow' celebrates our connection with Gaia and the elements;
     
  • 'Open Your Heart' reminds us that EVERYTHING is born out of love, even our most terrible and violent shadows... because love is all there is;
     
  • 'I Will Break' was born one sunny day in my garden in a spirit of playful and childlike resilience, reminding us that every time we break we simply dissolve into the sea of love where we reclaim our divine power;
     
  • 'Her Calling' reminds us of the spark of life that moves in all things, reclaiming a joyous devotion for the ancient creator Goddess archetype;
     
  • 'These Loving Arms', 'I Am', 'Dissolving' and 'Red White & Black' are deep prayers for our collective remembering;
     
  • and 'New Dawn' is my hope filled vision of a future lived in community.

This album has grown out of a journey of deep personal transformation and awakening, through a profoundly life-changing relationship and into the first stage of its excruciating break up. As opposed to the more subtle and maternal reflections of my lullabies, they are songs that answer Baba Yaga's call for the wilder Shakti energies and powerful masculine forces to take their places in my life, and to embrace my path as a role model for living in the heart.
 

The Invitation

These songs are calling us all to wake up, stand together in our power, let go of our shame, and see the hidden shadows at work in our lives, accepting them for their gifts. They invite our gentle compassion and soft intimacy to dance with our fierce independence in the uncompromising light of truth. They remind us that we are perfect, whole and inextricably linked to the great web of life.

This album is a fierce cry from the depths of my heart to yours - join me! Let us sing and dance wildly together and surrender ourselves to the eternally renewing energy of Creation.


A force with Nature, Ruth deserves a global platform so that
the rest of the planet can heal through her unique offerings.”
(Steve Lee, Glastonbury FM )

 

With love, hope and lots and lots of gratitude,

Ruth x

--
FYI If I don't reach the full amount, I do still get the money and I will use what I have to get as much done as I can. I trust the album will reach the world when it wants to and not before. X

We are a post-hardcore band from Phoenix, AZ! We're currently unsigned and independently function to produce high quality music for ourselves and our fans. Josh, our drummer, records, mixes and edits our music in his home studio and is our go to member for all graphic design needs (including the 'Mistakes We Make' EP artwork).  Every band member is an integral part of this band and we strive to write the best material we can; this being said, there is only so much we can do ourselves until having to reach towards outside sources that involve a chunk of cash, but not without YOU being rewarded first!

We have put together this IndieGoGo page because we know everything comes down to finances and in order to ensure the quality of our music is polished and packaged to the highest of standards; we use third party services to master and distribute our content. --- This money will allow us to MASTER, MARKET and DISTRIBUTE high quality music to our world audience and give YOU some 'special goodies' in the process. For those who would like to get their feet wet before diving in, be sure to check out our brand new lyric video for the first single off of the EP, 'Pants On Fire!'

When you decide to back our campaign, we want to make sure YOU ARE REWARDED for your highly appreciated generosity! We are providing you some amazing perks that are made possible through the tireless effort of the entire band. Some of these perks are highly limited and we will not be selling them in the future. So, if you listen to our music, like what you hear and want to help us continue as a band, please donate what you can (every little bit helps) and become a part of helping us reach our goal! Even if you're unable to donate today, you can help out by sharing this campaign with your friends or even just one person that you think would make a good Discovery of an Afterlife fan. Thank you so much, we are incredibly grateful for all of the continued support that we receive and we cannot wait to finally share this new music with all of you!

VVV BELOW ARE IMAGES OF THE PERKS THAT WILL BE OFFERED :) VVV

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Tell your friends about our new EP record!
  • Share on Twitter, Facebook and Instagram!
  • Save a kitten!

 

FAQs

  • What sizes are available for the shirt & where do I pick?

Standard sizes of SM-XXL will be available. Prior to shipment we'll send you an email and you'll be able to choose your size.
 

  • When will the album come out?

We have not announced a release date as of yet but we will post updates as we fulfill each step in the mastering and distribution processing stages.
 

  • When will my stuff ship?

Just prior to release of the album (see above). Digital copies of the album will be emailed to everyone at least 24 hours prior to official release.
 

  • How do I pay for the international shipping?

After clicking "Contribute Now" and selecting your package you can increase the contribution amount in the field above by $10.
 

  • I forgot to pay $10 for the international shipping!

No problem, just click "Contribute Now" again and make a contribution that is not for any specific package. Please make sure you make this contribution under the same email address as the original. Thanks!

  • I placed an order and have a question.

If you've placed an order you can file a support ticket. If you have not placed an order please send an email to discoveryofanafterlife@gmail.com and we'll do our best to respond. 

Thank you so much and we love you!!!

- Leon, Dan, Jon, Josh, Jayne and Conner

story:
Short Summary

My name is Mary Katherine Murphy! I am a hard working, God loving mom with a story to tell. I have been working in the entertainment industry as an actress, model, musician, and writer. I need help to complete my second musical project in attempts to bring more creative gifts to the table. I have a heart for the goodness of creation and to help the world heal through my tunes.

What We Need & What You Get

We need five thousand dollars to bring Clearwater Creek to fruition. We plan to take this effort to further levels of creativity and have many other projects in mind. Any contributors will be along for this exciting project in attempts to bring it further into film and television and musical pleasure. I am a fun entertainer and love pleIsng my listeners with my hard earned life work in bringing many hardships into creative healing through beauty and love and forgiveness. Many bad things can be turned around into good, with our loving Creator’s help, and I have attempted to do this successfully through my art. We will publicly acknowledge any investors and provide ones who’s give us, at least, 5k residual points in our revenue.

The Impact

I have had local success and response to my music in performances and radio play. 

In overcoming many obstacles through life, I have turned my personal experiences into heavenly opportunities to heal the planet through beautiful art. 

I also love to use humor and light in all pains and tribulations, in order to help others cope with adult life problems. I intend to use all of my art for a snowball effort to heal the planet. 

Risks & Challenges

As in all creative endeavors in this wild industry, there comes along risks. I have a machine of individuals working to help find solutions for all involved to complete, and find success, in this particular project, along with any further ones to come. 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can still help us by sharing this campaign with others and coming to my shows!

And, always speaking positively about people who are trying to bring true light and integrity and authenticity to the world, as you honor those who truly do so themselves.

story:
Pride Rock Iowa City's goal is to establish the first LGBTQIA rock camp off of the west coast! 

Iowa City is already host to a yearly Girls Rock camp that has been wildly successful. Iowa City Girls Rock offers young women, trans, and gender nonconforming youth the opportunity to learn an instrument, form a band, record a song, and play a show, all within one week. Girls Rock offers a unique opportunity for youth  to find a sense of community and express themselves together.

We wanted to expand upon the success of the girls rock model in order to  create a music camp specifically tailored for LGBTQIA youth. Although Iowa has made positive steps towards supporting its LGBTQIA youth, these youth continue to be at a disproportionate  risk for bullying and violence than their cisgender and heterosexual counterparts. Despite this there remain few resources that are geared towards their needs and allow for them to come together creatively. Providing spaces for them to express themselves and their experiences not only helps foster their own self empowerment but provides opportunities to form communities with each other and connections with trusted adults.

In one week, campers between the ages of 12 and 18 will learn an instrument, form a band, write a song, and play a show. In addition to daily music lessons and band practices, camp will have workshops focusing on social justice, identity, and music theory, as well as performances from local musicians!

We need your help to make camp happen! Pride Rock is a non profit that is volunteer run and will rely entirely on donations. Your donations will help us purchase instruments, secure facilities, and provide financial assistance for youth coming to camp.

We are so excited to have the chance to provide creative outlets to LGBTQIA youth in our community and with your help we can make this a reality!

story:
Welcome to Fran & Flora's Indiegogo campaign! Here you can find out more about us, our project and how you can help us make it happen.

 

Our Story

We are a violin and cello duo playing repertoire learnt on our many studies and adventures across Eastern Europe. We have been performing this music around the UK to captive audiences and great acclaim, but have yet to release any recorded material.

This is about to change!

It's been 3 years in the making and soon you'll be able to take us home with you in the form of a CD or download. 

With your help we can raise enough funds to finish this long-awaited recording project.

How you can help us

By signing up to a 'perk' (look right) you will enable us to pre-fund some of our production, printing, promotional costs and session fees. We're offering downloads, signed CDs, instrumental lessons, private concerts and an invitation to a soiree in a secret location.

Any contribution, however big or small, will be hugely appreciated, and if you can't donate any money right now but still wish to be help you can forward our campaign to anyone who you think would be interested in helping fund the project. 

What's on the album?

This project is a collaboration between us (Fran & Flora) and producer Sam Beste (check out his amazing band, Hejira). We are recording some of our favourite tunes and songs from the Klezmer, Romanian, Transylvanian, Roma and Armenian traditions - including Morris Rosenfeld's 'Mayn Rue Platz' and Josef Solinski's 'Romanian Fantasies' - as well as some original compositions inspired by our collaboration with Sam and the eclectic sound worlds we have immersed ourselves in. We have also invited our super-talented friends, Simon Roth (percussion) and Linde Timmermans (violin) to join us on a couple of tracks. It's quite an adventure creating an innovative studio album with traditional material. We want to do more than just record our live set, so we are incorporating electronics and improvisation into the tunes, developing our sound and creating a unique product.

Thank you!

Thank you so much for supporting us with the costs of recording, producing, printing and launching the album. We look forward to sending you our finished record, seeing you at our upcoming shows, and delivering to you the perks you’ve chosen.

 

 

More about us....

Described as "fiercely passionate" by BBC Radio 3’s Late Junction DJ Max Reinhardt Fran & Flora captivate their audiences with soulful laments, exquisite songs, irresistible dance tunes, and tales of their musical adventures.

This new collaboration between violinist Flora Curzon and folk/experimental cellist Francesca Ter-Berg combines aspects of traditional string music and song from Eastern Europe with original compositions and improvisation. Having travelled across Europe to study with many great masters of Eastern European Roma and Klezmer music Fran & Flora perform this repertoire incorporating their own unique arrangements creating a sound that is both timeless and contemporary.

Fran & Flora embark on this new musical journey together after many years collaborating with groundbreaking artists including ‪Talvin Singh (Mercury Prize Winner), Sam Lee & Friends (BBC Folk Award winner), Hejira, Dunajska Kapelye, the London Klezmer Quartet, Cosmo Sheldrake and Frank London (Klezmatics, US).

"A string duo bound for glory..." DJ Max Reinhardt, BBC 3 Late Junction

"Outstanding" - Talvin Singh OBE

"Truly Unique" - Fire in The Mountain Festival

"Fran & Flora are fiercely passionate about their music and its a passion that they effortlessly communicate to their audience. They are a winning and magical admixture of instrumental excellence, captivating playing and singing ability, delectable stage presence, supremely well chosen eastern european repertoire and matchless original tunes... This a string duo bound for glory." - Max Reinhardt, BBC Radio 3's Late Junction

"Fran & Flora both share a vivacious and infectious enthusiasm for the world of music, an enthusiasm which is not wedded to any particular tradition but instead stems from a fundamental interest in human expression. Together they make music which is nothing short of magical, borne of true friendship, shared experience, mutual trust, and a willingness to surrender in performance through listening ." - Sam Beste, Hejira & Lima Limo Records
 

www.franandflora.com

www.facebook.com/franandflora

info@franandflora.com

story:
Short Summary

Hi! My name is Hargo Khalsa. I'm a singer/songwriter, musician and record producer. I started in music playing guitar and singing with my dad in the Sikh temple in Eugene, OR where I grew up. I wrote my first song at 8 y/o, my life long love for music beginning with the first two chords of Buffalo Springfield's 60s anthem For What It's Worth. Music has taken me all over the world, making records in England, New York, and producing over 16 albums.

Making music is my heart and soul. It's the place where I find connection to source, to myself, to power, to healing, to love, to raw emotion. In the last 6 years I've gone through more change than any other time in my life. My family fell apart, my band unraveled, I left home, lost my passion, moved to LA, went to Burning Man, left a tribe, found a new one, fell in love, moved to Joshua Tree, went through the fire, and came out the other side.

These songs are a testimony to that beautiful & challenging journey.., and I want to make this record as a sonic companion to anyone who who has gone - or is going - through huge shifts in their life. I'm so excited to mix some new musical elements into this album as well: Tribal Percussion, Gospel Singers, Electronic Beats, Organic Ambience, and whatever other "beautiful accidents" happen in the moment! Making music is a huge challenge and it truly takes PATRONS to do it in the Aquarian Age. That's why I want to include YOU in this process and I hope that YOU will join me! Thank you for your consideration :)

The Impact

I know people out there are going through major changes and searching for their path. I truly believe that the answers are within us. Our creative potential is unlimited and our destinies are in our own hands. But it takes a tribe to help us climb the mountain and realize our wildest dreams. This music is meant to be a constant friend and companion to anyone on that path. My vision is to see EVERYONE's dreams and visions come to fruition and be at the forefront of their lives. This album is intended to help us all to take bold and significant steps in that direction. Let's go on this journey together!

What We Need & What You Get

Here's the breakdown. This is what it takes and where your funds will go:

PHASE ONE

  • TRACKING
    - Live Musician Fees: $3000.00
    - Gospel Choir: $2000.00
    - Studio Time (Recording Live Drums & Vocals): $1500
  • TRAVEL (To & From Los Angeles for sessions): $500.00
  • PRODUCER FEE (First Half)
    - Pre/Production (Rhythm section rehearsals): $1000.00
    - Tracking/Engineering: $3000.00

PHASE TWO

  • Travel (To & From Los Angeles for sessions): $500.00
  • Producer's Fee (Second Half):
    - Editing: $2000.00
    - Mixing (incl. Studio Time): $2000.00
  • Mastering Engineer Fee: $1100.00

PHASE THREE

  • Album Artwork - $700.00
  • Album Digital Marketing Campaign (Facebook, Instagram, iTunes, SoundCloud, Spirit Voyage): $2500.00
  • Digital Distribution Campaign (iTunes, Amazon, Google Play, Spotify, Tidal, etc.): $200.00

SATURN RETURN Total Investment: $20,000.00
 

Risks & Challenges

This is a big undertaking. There are many pitfalls. Usually artists discover them through trial and error, as I did, early on in my songwriting and music production career.  Fortunately, I know how to identify these entanglements, and how to avoid them.  My 16+ yrs of experience will definitely be called on to steer this process in a fruitful and efficient way. Having the right team of people involved is one of the most critical elements. It’s also important to know where the funds need to go in order to get the best results. I'm going to make sure we get the BEST BANG FOR OUR BUCK, without a doubt!

Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways you can help, and I appreciate your support in whatever way is best for you. Please share my campaign on social media! Let your friends/family know about it. Beyond that, if you're up to the challenge, I would love for you to share your own heroic vision of your life, and then take it one step further by tagging this campaign as an important factor in your unique personal inspiration!

Mastering Engineer Fee: $1100.00

PHASE THREE

Album Artwork - $700.00
Album Digital Marketing Campaign (Facebook, Instagram, iTunes, SoundCloud, Spirit Voyage): $2500.00
Digital Distribution Campaign (iTunes, Amazon, Google Play, Spotify, Tidal, etc.): $200.00

SATURN RETURN Total Investment: $20,000.00 


Risks & Challenges
This is a big undertaking. There are many pitfalls. Usually artists discover them through trial and error, as I did, early on in my songwriting and music production career.  Fortunately, I know how to identify these entanglements, and how to avoid them.  My 16+ yrs of experience will definitely be called on to steer this process in a fruitful and efficient way. Having the right team of people involved is one of the most critical elements. It’s also important to know where the funds need to go in order to get the best results. I'm going to make sure we get the BEST BANG FOR OUR BUCK, without a doubt!


Other Ways You Can Help
There are many ways you can help, and I appreciate your support in whatever way is best for you. Please share my campaign on social media! Let your friends/family know about it. Beyond that, if you're up to the challenge, I would love for you to share your own heroic vision of your life, and then take it one step further by tagging this campaign as an important factor in your unique personal inspiration!

story:
Short Summary

Clint Jun is a talented and dedicated singer who brings his heart and soul to his music. He was in the top 12 of American idol season 10, and has been featured in movie soundtracks, including ‘The Room’. His new song, “Her Body,” is a sexy and sultry 80s throwback in the vein of Prince and Michael Jackson - a sure fire hit that will take him to the next level. It deserves a music video to help get it there, so we’re partnering with Never Not Chillin Productions to make this video come to life. By contributing to this campaign, you will help us produce a high production value music video that matches the vibe of the song and will help give people a new platform to experience Clint’s voice. 

What We Need & What You Get

Calling in as many favors as possible, we still need money for film equipment, such as cameras and lights, production design, locations and wardrobe so we can create a stylistic 80s feel that brings a new dimension to the song. We also have to pay everyone who works on set for their time, commitment, and talent. Our budget will go directly to the dancers and actors who will bring the song to life and the film crew who will make sure they look amazing on camera.

We have some awesome perks. You can get a download of the song, the amazing and illustrious Clint will serenade you for your birthday, or you can even a get an invite to the wrap party to celebrate the completion of the video!

The Impact

Even if we don't reach our goal, we believe in this video and will put all we have into its production. So many people are donating their time, and our budget will ensure that the folks who stay long hours and work hard are compensated for their time. 

The song evokes some of the best eras of music, and reminds us of what music can truly be. Clint is a genuine artist whose been working diligently on his craft and been present in this industry for some time. Fans are currently enjoying his latest digital release, “Sayonara,” which was selected for a radio promotion campaign taking place in the United Kingdom. We want the video for his new song “Her Body” to take him to the next level so even more people locally and globally can experience Clint for the amazing artist he is!

Risks & Challenges

To handle the risks that come with all low budget productions, we have allocated ourselves ample time in all stages of production to ensure a smooth and easy experience and a high quality finished product. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please tell your friends, families, and coworkers about this campaign, and share it to your social media. Follow Clint on Instagram, Spotify, and Facebook to keep updated!

story:
Our Mission

In short, we are preserving history and you can help! Here's what we've done already.

  • We have raised $10,000 through grants to cover the recording costs
  • We have edited some of the most entertaining music from the 1880s and stand ready to record it for you!
  • We have assembled the very finest period wind instrument players and now we just need supporters like you, who understand the importance of preserving this music, to make this happen.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We still need about $15,000 to get everyone to the recording site and house them for 4 days. Our players come from all over the country, so this costs some money!
  • Check out our perks! You can get our previous CDs and be the first to get the new one. There's more, too.
  • Here is a sample

     

  • Whatever we raise goes to this project. Anything above our goal goes to Vintage Wind Bands, Inc. to fund further projects.

The Impact

  • Recording historic music is a challenge. The big labels only want the next big pop star.
  • Thankfully, smaller labels like MSR Classics still understand that people won't know if they like something if they never hear it.
  • You can make a real difference and truly be a patron of historical music research and performance.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us get the word out! Like us on Facebook and pass our Indiegogo announcement to your friends with a comment.

We have assembled the very finest period wind instrument players and now we just need supporters like you, who understand the importance of preserving this music, to make this happen.

Check out our perks! You can get our previous CDs and be the first to get the new one. There's more, too.

story:
About Me,

 My name is Matt Mardini

I am a singer - based in Montreal, I am originally from Aleppo - Syria.

(So Matt is my nickname, and my full name is Hekmat Mardini حكمت مارديني)

nd I am the Syrian Crooner.

I sing Jazz, Standards and Classical pieces from the 40s up to the latest hits, in English and French.In addition, I can also sing and perform the classics in Spanish, Italian, Armenian, Russian and for sure … Arabic.

Back then (in Syria) I had a successful career, singing in English, in French and other languages.That’s what made me quite unique. I was performing at many venues in Syria as well as all over the Middle East.

I also had a very good presence on TVs and Radios and the media in general.

 

When I moved to Canada, Montreal, I had to start from zero, where my biggest challenge was… "how was I going to make it, where French or English is the mother tong language of the people living here?” I was the new, the immigrant who was going to sing their language and prove himself.

I decided that I will do it.

I started working hard to build my career in my new home, and I have succeeded in some points.

For list just a few examples;

  • Last year, I performed at the Bell Center (the biggest local arena, where all the international megastars perform when they come to Montreal)

I am the first singer of Syrian origin to sing there. I am so proud!

 
  • Also, I was hosted by the local media (like Global News, CTV, Breakfast TV, Gazette news paper, Journal de Montreal, Rouge FM, Radio Canada and many others) ... to talk about me and my journey

I invite you to visit my website to see some of my work at www.matt-mardini.com

What now ...

Now, I am performing at Hotels, Restaurants, corporates get-togethers to weddings, private parties, Fund raisings and everything in between.

 

And you know what, at every event, the audience keep telling me that they see me at an international scale.  

The thing is, I am sure that I can do it.

In order to do that, and to go to the next level in my music career, I have put in action my plan.

The first step of my plan is to make my first EP (mini-album).

The Project ...

My current project is related to Canada, my new home, which opens the door to me and to thousands of immigrants and refugees from Syria and all over the world.

With your help, I will produce my first EP, an open tribute album “The Syrian Crooner Sings the Canadian Icons”. It’s designed to help me reach audiences across Canada and overseas.

I will start with 5 cover songs, with totally new musical arrangements, each one featuring a Canadian Artist: Celine Dion, Paul Anka (who is originally from Syria as well), Brian Adams, Raymond Lévesque, Leonard Cohen.

Then I will add more songs featuring other Canadian Icons.

Risks & Challenges

The production process is long and expensive.

It has many elements, from music arrangements to recording, mixing, mastering, design, manufacturing, and promoting.

Usually, the record labels and the big publishers finance these projects, but in my case, I am independent, and I always finance my own projects.

With your help, I will collaborate with the best artists in town, musicians, sound engineers, photographers, and marketing experts, so the EP will make its impact and leaves a mark.

How I am going to profit from your generosity

The Impact ...

When I succeed in achieving my goals, the impact will be not only for me.

This will inspire thousands of Syrians and other immigrants, refugees in Canada and in the world.

No one has to give up, everyone must keep working to achieve their goals and make their dreams come true.

Help me prove, that with hard work and determination, nothing is impossible.

Please share this campaign with your friends and through your networks, and please don’t forget to like my Facebook page, and to follow me on Instagram, You can also find me on Tweeter and YouTube.

A big THANK YOU

story:
ESPAÑOL

SOPLO DE RÍO

“Las músicas del agua"

Presentamos SOPLO DE RÍO, un trabajo discográfico alrededor del sonido de la marimba de chonta que  enlaza al pacífico  con el resto de las músicas de Colombia.  Antonio Arnedo, Saxofonista y Compositor que ha dedicado su vida a profundizar en las músicas colombianas, invita a Hugo Candelario González, uno de los más importantes representares de la música del Pacífico Sur, a unir esfuerzos alrededor de la riqueza, la diversidad y la vitalidad de nuestro patrimonio sonoro.

http://www.antonioarnedo.com

http://grupo-bahia.blogspot.com/p/hugo-candelario.html

 

¿QUIENES HACEN PARTE DE SOPLO DE RÍO?

Este es el primer registro sonoro del  Colectivo Colombia que lleva 15 años convocando músicos que son referente en la construcción del  panorama de la música colombiana de hoy. Participan en esta reunión:  Urian Sarmiento, percusionista, investigador y gestor. Juan Miguel Sossa, interprete de instrumentos de cuerda de Colombia, Anamaría Oramas, flautista y compositora, Santiago Sandoval, virtuoso guitarrista y creador y José Juvinao, uno de los  más versátiles  contrabajistas y productores del país.

 

¿POR QUÉ NECESITAMOS TU APORTE?

Grabamos en la Sala de Música de la Luis Angel Arango en Bogotá con Mauricio Ardila (http://www.mardila.com/), uno de los mejores ingenieros de sonido de Latinoamerica, después de esto necesitamos concluir los procesos de post producción e impresión que para concluir requieren de los recursos para: 

  • Mezcla y masterización 
  • Honorarios de los músicos
  • Diseño de logos , carátula y arte
  • Fotografía
  • Piezas audiovisuales  http://www.tragaluz.video/
  • Publicidad
  • Página web
  • Impresión de CD`S
  • Logística y entrega de recompensas

 

COMPARTE ESTA CAMPAÑA Y ACOMPAÑANOS

Te invitamos a hacer parte de SOPLO DE RÍO, a compartir esta campaña con tus amigos tejiendo la red que ayude a consolidar esta iniciativa que  nos permite crear  identidad y país.

También te invitamos a  asistir al concierto de lanzamiento de "Soplo de Río" el  31 de agosto a las 8 de la noche en el Teatro Colón de Bogotá, un concierto dentro de la franja “Toque Colón”. 

Gracias por tu apoyo!!!!!!

 

ENGLISH

SOPLO DE RIO, a Recording for which I have invited Hugo Candelario, to make a magical project that shows Colombia through the ancestral sound of the Marimba de Chonta. The deep empathy that naturally occurs when we play is clearly reflected in this project, which reaffirms the long journey of more than 20 years of fortunate encounters and that sees the light in this new work that will be released on August 3, 2018. 

SOPLO DE RÍO 

"The music of the water" 

We present SOPLO DE RÍO, a recording work around the sound of the Marimba de Chonta that links the Pacific with the rest of the music of Colombia. Antonio Arnedo, saxophonist and composer who has dedicated his life to exploring Colombian music, invites Hugo Candelario González, one of the most important representatives of South Pacific music, to join efforts around the richness, diversity and vitality of our sound heritage. 

http://www.antonioarnedo.com

http://grupo-bahia.blogspot.com/p/hugo-candelario.html

WHO COMPRISES SOPLO DE RÍO? 

This is the first sound recording of the COLECTIVO COLOMBIA that has been gathering musicians for 15 years, who are a reference in the construction of the panorama of Colombian music today. In this encounter: Urian Sarmiento, percussionist, researcher and manager; Juan Miguel Sossa, string instruments player from Colombia; Anamaría Oramas, flutist and composer; Santiago Sandoval, virtuoso guitarist and creator; and José Juvinao, one of the most versatile base players and producers in the country. 

WHY DO WE NEED YOUR CONTRIBUTION?

We recorded in the concert hall of the Luis Angel Arango in Bogotá with Mauricio Ardila (http://www.mardila.com/), one of the best sound engineers in Latin America. We need to complete the post production processes and impression, for which we require resources specifically to cover the following: 

  • Mixing and mastering 
  • Musicians' fees 
  • Design of logos, cover and art 
  • Photography Audiovisual pieces http://www.tragaluz.video/ 
  • Advertising 
  • Web page 
  • CD`s printing 
  • Logistics and rewards delivery 
  •  

SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN AND ACCOMPANY US 

We invite you to be part of SOPLO DE RÍO, to share this campaign with your friends by weaving the network that helps to consolidate this initiative that allows us to create identity. 

We also invite you to attend the launch concert of "Soplo de Río" on August 31 at 8 pm at the Teatro Colón in Bogotá, a concert within the "Toque Colón" band. 

Thank you for being part of SOPLO DE RIO !!!
