Mixing and mastering 
Musicians' fees 
Design of logos, cover and art 
Photography Audiovisual pieces http://www.tragaluz.video/ 

Advertising 
Web page 
CD`s printing 
Logistics and rewards delivery 
 
SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN AND ACCOMPANY US We invite you to be part of SOPLO DE RÍO, to share this campaign with your friends by weaving the network that helps to consolidate this initiative that allows us to create identity. We also invite you to attend the launch concert of "Soplo de Río" on August 31 at 8 pm at the Teatro Colón in Bogotá, a concert within the "Toque Colón" band. Thank you for being part of SOPLO DE RIO !!!

story:
Short Summary

I've been writing songs, making records and playing gigs all over the country for several years.  I made three albums for small labels and got some college radio airplay (most notably for the song "In The City").   For my fourth album, I raised the funds for the production and manufacturing costs by crowd sourcing and I had great success with it.  I was able to make my finest collection of songs with complete artistic control and not come out in debt to a label.  

With each album, I keep trying to up the stakes on the songwriting craft, the production and the quality of the performances.  I try to make albums you can return to over and over again, songs you can take with you.

What We Need & What You Get

We're looking to raise $20,000 to pay for the production of this album and to pay for costs of digital mastering, design and manufacturing of the album for digital download, CD and Vinyl record.   Any additional money made over the target amount will be used to pay for the cost of producing videos for songs from the new album.

With a pledge at the starting level you can pre-order your own download, CD or vinyl LP copy of the new album.  There are many more cool incentive perks for pledges of different levels.  You can have singed lyrics sheets or posters.  I will record a studio version of the cover song of your choice.  You can even pledge and order a concert in your home for you and your friends. 

The Impact

Like all of the musicians I love best, I make music because I love making music.  I  work hard at making my songs, my records and my shows fun, well crafted and easy to listen to.  If you'd like to hear this music, pledge what you can afford and I can afford to make it and give it to you to keep.  

For my last album we were able to raise over $14,000.  We were able to pay for all of the production costs.  We played several concerts in pledgers' homes and recorded a bunch cover versions of pledgers' favorite songs.  The second pressing of the CD was paid for 100% by money made in sales of the CD at shows.

Risks & Challenges

As you all know, A lot has changed in the business of making music in recent times.  It was never easy for performing musicians to finance recordings.  With the dominance of streaming services and the disappearance of so many record companies, it's gotten ever harder.

My last album's campaign taught me that there's still away to make fun, smart and dynamic work and deliver it to fans and hungry listeners without the budget of a big record company.  Rather than one guy putting up the big bucks to own the operation and keep the artist in debt, lots of people can pay $20 or $100 for their own copy of the work and in doing so finance the entire project.

Other Ways You Can Help

I'm not looking to shake anybody down for money who can't afford it.  If you dig the music and you can afford to pre-order a copy of the new album or otherwise pledge, I ask that you contribute what you can afford.  If you can't afford to contribute any money, please check out my website: www.miltonmusic.com, take a listen to the music and pass along the link to the website and this campaign to anyone you know.  If you like any of my songs, sing them, play them, listen to them, tell your friends and come see me play some time.   Thank you all!!

With each album, I keep trying to up the stakes on the songwriting craft, the production and the quality of the performances.  I try to make albums you can return to over and over again, songs you can take with you.

What We Need & What You Get
We're looking to raise $20,000 to pay for the production of this album and to pay for costs of digital mastering, design and manufacturing of the album for digital download, CD and Vinyl record.   Any additional money made over the target amount will be used to pay for the cost of producing videos for songs from the new album.
With a pledge at the starting level you can pre-order your own download, CD or vinyl LP copy of the new album.  There are many more cool incentive perks for pledges of different levels.  You can have singed lyrics sheets or posters.  I will record a studio version of the cover song of your choice.  You can even pledge and order a concert in your home for you and your friends. 

The Impact
Like all of the musicians I love best, I make music because I love making music.  I  work hard at making my songs, my records and my shows fun, well crafted and easy to listen to.  If you'd like to hear this music, pledge what you can afford and I can afford to make it and give it to you to keep.  
For my last album we were able to raise over $14,000.  We were able to pay for all of the production costs.  We played several concerts in pledgers' homes and recorded a bunch cover versions of pledgers' favorite songs.  The second pressing of the CD was paid for 100% by money made in sales of the CD at shows.

Risks & Challenges
As you all know, A lot has changed in the business of making music in recent times.  It was never easy for performing musicians to finance recordings.  With the dominance of streaming services and the disappearance of so many record companies, it's gotten ever harder.
My last album's campaign taught me that there's still away to make fun, smart and dynamic work and deliver it to fans and hungry listeners without the budget of a big record company.  Rather than one guy putting up the big bucks to own the operation and keep the artist in debt, lots of people can pay $20 or $100 for their own copy of the work and in doing so finance the entire project.

Other Ways You Can Help
I'm not looking to shake anybody down for money who can't afford it.  If you dig the music and you can afford to pre-order a copy of the new album or otherwise pledge, I ask that you contribute what you can afford.  If you can't afford to contribute any money, please check out my website: www.miltonmusic.com, take a listen to the music and pass along the link to the website and this campaign to anyone you know.  If you like any of my songs, sing them, play them, listen to them, tell your friends and come see me play some time.   Thank you all!!

story:
QUIÈN ES PATTY?

SOY DOMINICANA HASTA LA TAMBORA.

Nacida y criada en quisquella la bella, República Dominicana, el país  más hermoso del mundo.

Soy Artista, desde que tengo memoria no he podido dejar de expresar arte, a través de la danza, la música , el canto.

Hice teatro musical.

Ballet clásico y danza moderna.

Fui miembro de la Orquesta Sinfónica de Vientos ( soy flautista)

Y amo el arte en todas sus expresiones.

MI EQUIPO DE TRABAJO ES MI FAMILIA

Sin ellos este proyecto no fuera realidad .Por eso quiero agradecer a cada una de las personas que me han apoyado incondicionalmente en esta aventura.

 

En la unión esta la fuerza.

Para poder lograr este hermoso proyecto, necesito de su apoyo para que juntos podamos hacer este sueño realidad .

Juntos lo que podamos recaudar ira dirigido a la creación de mi primer Album Urban pop como cantante solista.

Esta plataforma permite recaudar fondos para artistas independientes como yo y que nuestros proyectos puedan ser financiados por todos nosotros. 

Con su apoyo los fondos de esta campaña se dirigirán a la cobertura de el pago del estudio de grabación, los ingenieros, la producción, masterización de las canciones y demás.

 

 

SORPRESA!!!

Estoy muy agradecida por el apoyo y la buena energía, es por esto que por tu apoyo económico me gustaría poder hacer varios regalos.

De acuerdo al monto que decidas aportar puedes obtener:

1- El albúm musical firmado y dedicado especialmente para ti.

2- Una descarga digital de la producción

3-Estar en primera fila en mi próximo concierto, ser mi invitad@ especial y muchas sorpresas màs.

Resultados:

Una vez terminada la campaña, recibidas un correo electrónico del Patty M TEAM, de cómo hacerte llegar tus recompensas y regalos seleccionados.

Si no puedes hacer una contribución económica no significa que no puedas apoyar de otras maneras.

-Comparte esta campaña con tu amigos, tu vecino, tu primo lejano, hasta el compañero que sentado justo alado de ti. 

Mi corazón rebosa de alegría y se vuelve cada vez mas y mas grande con tu apoyo. Eres importante para mí.

Un fuerte abrazo y muchas bendiciones.

 

Patty <3

story:
Become part of Fyerfly’s team to bring this hauntingly intimate debut album to the world, by pre-ordering a limited edition bundle!

Hello there, it’s Fyerfly here! I’m incredibly excited to announce the coming of my brand new album entitled ‘Connect’; and this is your official invite to become a special part of it!

Background
As a single mother of two children under 9 and in my (early!) 40’s, I’ve been writing, studying and working towards the recording of my first album over the past several years.

...And now the moment has finally arrived!

I began writing poetry from a young age and returned to my music after a long career as a designer and business owner. A classically trained multi-instrumentalist, I was strongly influenced by orchestral composers, jazz, blues & a love of grunge & alternative rock. The resulting sound is a blend of these genres in a delivery of sensual sadcore songs.

My album ‘Connect’ is about embracing the parts of oneself that is usually kept hidden. To honour and love the darkness as well as the light, found within with whole. Together with my team of phenomenal musicians, we have created an intimate world of stories that you may lose (or perhaps find) yourself within.

 

This crowd funding campaign is to help me with the release of my album. I've already invested every last cent I had into creating it, but now I need your help to 'bring it home'.

 

Listen to the first single 'Shadow of the Moon'

 

As a mumma of two, I don't tour. Which means I am a studio artist and rely on the 'wide world of webs' to market and sell my album and merch. The beautiful thing about this is, today we have the technology to not only make this possible as independent artists; but to reach existing audiences that are already fans of our style of music. This is a beautiful opportunity that never existed in the music industry until recently and it means I can remain available to my children.

As a past branding specialist, I've been maximising my knowledge by studying a highly respected music marketing course and implementing these digital marketing techniques to grow my online community (I may have even found some of you this way!) .

The money raised through this campaign will help me contribute to the costs of my CD's and merchandise and to market my album on a grand international scale. Any funds raised above my target, will go towards hiring a music publicist who will help me do all the things I know little about such as media releases, access to industry contacts in radio, media, magazine and blogs etc. as well as film a music video/s for my songs. And more marketing ;)

Without your support, I will remain eternally grateful for the opportunity to have created and produced a beautiful album of my stories. It's been a life changing experience and I have found myself and my people through this journey. I am already blessed.

With your generous support I will be fuelled, motivated, inspired and unstoppable in achieving my dreams, which is to create a self-sustaining career through my music. I will find and nurture my fans all over the world, and together we will all enjoy this magic musical world of artistic expression...!

 

What I Need & What You Get

I am seeking $5,000 to cover the following costs (inc gst)

  • $2,230 for CDs
  • $1,200 for tshirts
  • $300 candles/leather/materials
  • $500 Online marketing (Facebook/GoogleAds)
  • $200 upgrade my web store
  • campaign charges, credit card charges, taxes, postage and contingencies

(I've already invested $24.5k in Production, Musicians, Sound engineering/Mixing/Mastering, Travel & Accommodation)

----------------------

Have you ever had that silent gushing feeling that goes with knowing that something you've done has helped enrich someone else's life? Well by contributing to this campaign, that's exactly what you'll be doing for me. I want you to know that as my supporter, I see you as a part of my fan based label. Without your help, I may never be heard, so you backing me validates me as an artist. I want to show you how much I appreciate your help and offer you what you'll value most through these perks. They’ve been prepared for you with love and consideration, and I hope that that is also how they’ll be received.

 

The Impact

In simple terms, if just 50 people contribute AU$100 I could reach my target. That's exciting!!  With my love and gratitude, I could send you all your exclusive perks, relish this journey with you as a partner AND release my album directly to the people that love my kind of sound and culture.

If 100 people would contribute AU$100, I could create a music clip/s, hire a publicist and market myself as well as any established pro, and prove that fan based labels mean more than any commercial entity could, because you actually care. That's powerful!! I'm sure I'd cry.

So why trust me? Firstly because you love my music and my culture. You know that my team and I have already produced quality results and my album is something that should be shared. So far I've released two singles in my music career and won a partial scholarship with US Music Business Coach Cari Cole with my debut single, 'Captured'; I raised Music Label interest with both my single releases 'Captured' and 'Golden Arrow'; I work with a highly respected production team and with talented musicians (some composers in their own rights), and together we create beautiful music. So not only are you supporting me, but you are also supporting people like me in the 'indie-music' business. 

This is only the beginning. Just imagine what I can do with an entire album...?! I believe in me and I hope you do too.

 

How you can partner with Fyerfly

  • Make a donation by clicking the 'Back It' link, or 'Make a contribution'
  • Purchase an exclusive pre-order perk
  • Post the bundle you bought on Facebook or Instagram, hashtag #fyerfly and tag me @fyerflymusic so I can say thanks right away & let everyone know how beautiful you are!
  • Encourage your friends & music lovers to also join our fan based label!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Leave me a review on my Facebook and YouTube pages
  • Join my tribe by subscribing to my mail list
  • Click on the Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word on your socials
  • Follow me on Spotify, Instagram, YouTube... etc etc ;)

 

Contributions, no matter how big or small, are received with my love & gratitude.

For your kindness, I thank you x

story:
Circus Bella 

Founded in 2008, Circus Bella brings the magic of the single-ring circus to people of all ages through thrilling feats of balance and strength, elegant demonstrations of grace, and outrageous humor, all performed to original music composed and directed by the highly-acclaimed multi-instrumentalist Rob Reich. Circus Bella is proud to revive the tradition of the homegrown circus through productions that are accessible, festive, and fun!

The All-Star Band 

Since its inception, the Circus Bella All-Star Band has been an essential part of the Circus Bella experience. Every act in the show is perfectly paired with a unique score, heightening the impact of the performance. 

Over the years, the band has become a well-oiled machine, churning out insane clown marches, slow suspenseful dramatic arcs, and generally FUN music. Rob composes music to purposely feature the talents of the individual musicians in the band. Every instrument contributes to the clamor. The typical Circus Bella show has a 6-piece band, but for this album we will be expanding to 10-pieces, blowing the music up into gigantic proportion!

The Circus Bella All-Star Band released their self-titled debut album in 2011. The band has come a long way since then; a sequel is due!

Rob Reich

Multi-instrumentalist and composer Rob Reich is quintessentially what makes the San Francisco music scene a vibrant and vital mecca for independent music; he’s become one of its stalwart underground artists. Steeped in music since beginning piano lessons at age three, he graduated with a degree in Music Composition from Oberlin Conservatory of Music, studying with composers John Luther Adams and Pauline Oliveros. Reich subsequently moved to the Bay Area, where he discovered the accordion, now his primary instrument. Over the years he’s played with many genre-defying bands including Tin Hat and Gaucho. In January 2019, he released "Swings Left", an album of original swing music. Reich’s musical voice lives on the edges of jazz, classical, and pop music, embodying a spirit of irreverent experimentation with a strong melodic core. More info at www.robreich.com

We need $12,000 to make this recording happen!

Funds will be used for:

  • Artist fees for 10 musicians. The band will feature the talents of the Bay Area's finest musicians including long-time veterans of the Circus Bella Band:
    • Ian Carey - trumpet
    • Andrew Stephens - trumpet
    • Kasey Knudsen - saxophone
    • Sheldon Brown - saxophone
    • Alisa Rose - violin
    • Matt Heulitt - guitar
    • Greg Stephens - trombone
    • Jonathan Seiberlich - tuba
    • Michael Pinkham - drums
    • Rob Reich - accordion, piano, sound fx, etc.
  • Studio Rental & Engineer
    • We will be recording in the fabulous Tiny Telephone with studio wizard Jacob Winik who has collaborated with Rob Reich on his previous 2 releases. Jacob's credits also include Magnetic Fields, John Vanderslice, and apparently Gonzo (the muppet)!
  • Mixing, Mastering, Design and Production
    • Turn up the slide whistles, turn down the glockenspiel - we'll need to get the balance just right to make this circus music POP!

We're really proud of the music we've been making together and are excited to record and share it with you! Thanks is advance for supporting this campaign and spreading the word, to help the music reach more ears and hearts.

story:
Luke's been my closest friend the last 6 years of my life.  We were roommates, become fathers together, started a band together, and now started a church together.

Every chapter of this journey has been marked by Luke's faithful and selfless love and support of me, my family, and all those connected to our endeavors.

If you've been in any proximity of him, you've been seen, supported, and strengthened by his peace-seeking and peace-making ability to ask the right question, serve the right need, and give you the right amount of space and challenge to succeed. 

 

By giving towards this surprise gift, we will send three loud messages to Luke

1. THANK YOU!!!

2. YOU AND YOUR MUSIC ARE A GIFT TO THIS WORLD! 

3. WE WANT TO RETURN THE FAVOR AND SEE, SUPPORT, AND STRENGTHEN YOU in your dreams and serve the need to make that happen....with money and words of encouragement!

 

Your Part

1. Moolah! Give $30, 100, 200, whatever.... towards our goal fo $3K which go to helping him finish his recording faster!

2. Write an encouraging note for him to be make time to be selfish, to take time to WRITE, RECORD, PRODUCE, AND RELEASE his beautiful music to the world AS SOON AS POSSIBLE! 

 

The Impact

The biggest thing that holds Luke back from producing is money, and time. The reason why he doesn't make as much time is the great amount of care he has for his friends, family, gym community, and church community. By us pooling our money and encouraging words together, we will help him overcome those hurdles to do what he's longing to do...what's he's made to...and bring beautiful music into this world :)

 

Tell Everyone! 

Tell those who know and love him-->(send this link)

Tell those who don't--->

  • Show them it's good music....LIKE REALLY GOOD MUSIC!  (send them this link) https://lukelynass.bandcamp.com/?fbclid=IwAR1FC...

story:
About My Project

I am a 23-year-old performing singer-songwriter, guitarist and dancer from Stillwater, Minnesota. Since graduating from the University of Minnesota in December 2018, I’ve been working on writing my own songs. In August I worked with producer, composer and musician Andrew Turpening (BMI, https://www.entraance.com/about) to record a cover of the Cuban song “Ámame Como Soy” and my first original song, “Leaving For The Amazon.” I came off the recording session motivated and charged with energy. Now I am determined to record an EP with Andrew from December 8-13, 2019. The Extended Play record will showcase seven songs: four originals and three covers, about 28 minutes of music total. If I meet this campaign goal, I will be able to record the EP, master it, make 1,000 CD copies, and launch my artist website. After the CDs are duplicated, I will sign and number each one before they are shrink-wrapped. I envision a classic Blue Note look for the album design. I will then aim to have a CD release party in June 2020. With your help I can make this vision happen!!!

My Musical Education and Artistic Style

For six years, I have worked on writing music in addition to studying violin, piano, guitar, dance and classical singing. Based in the Twin Cities, I spent time in Ecuador, Cuba, India, and Brazil absorbing new music styles. My singing reflects influences from U.S. jazz, Cuban and Brazilian music with a personal twist.  

With the guitar, I dove into Yaraví folksongs in Ecuador, son-montuno rhythms in Cuba, and Bossa Nova grooves in Brazil. I am working on combining my U.S. jazz and folk roots guitar fingerstyle technique with rhythms and progressions from abroad. 

 

Recording the First Two Songs

Andrew and I collaborate really well together. Recording the first two songs went smoothly and we were able to get the ideas out and polish them over a period of hours. The recording process was an eye-opener that showed me how musical styles can be synthesized. My first original song, “Leaving For The Amazon,” uses a melody I came up with in Brazil over the summer. The English lyrics are jazzy. The guitar chords and rhythm are straight Bossa Nova. The lyrics evoke a friend’s tumultuous experience with two different men in Havana, Cuba. I brought the lyrics, melody, and guitar part to the recording session. Andrew added the bass and drums. His meticulous attention to detail helped me find the true character of my song and made sure the music personified the lyrics. I learned how diction and rhythmic emphasis are essential in conveying a message. Recording “Leaving For The Amazon” felt like a 100-hour master-class channeled into a couple days. Andrew and I have a history of making songs happen in the way I envision them. 

 

The Role of My Parents

My parents continue to play a role in my artistic development. My mom is a photojournalist who will take the photos for the CD. My dad is a writer and graphic artist, and will help design the cover art. More than anything they have taught me the importance of perseverance in the arts. 

 

What This Project Means to Me

This album combines years of work and study and will be the wind that lifts my wings. Now I am ready to go for it and fly. Your support of this project means I can realize my artistic dream. Thank you!

 

The Cost Breakdown

I will record the EP with Andrew from December 8-13.

Engineering/producing/mixing at about $30/hour for six days of 8 hour days - $1440 

Hiring other musicians to perform on the album - $350

Mastering the EP (about a 3-hour session for the whole album) with Greg Reierson of Rare Form Mastering - $500

CopyCats price for 1,000 CDs with shrink wrap (included in the price is for Anna DePagter, their designer, to layout the designs to be ready for print) - $1275

Artist website on Wix.com - $100

5% of funds raised for IndieGoGo fees and perk fulfillment   - $183

Total: $3,848

If we surpass this amount, a stretch goal of my campaign would be to start album two! Even if I do not meet the $3,848 goal, every penny will still go towards this musical vision. Now I am synthesizing my influences from around the world into original songs for an EP. Now is the time to pursue this dream. 

 

Risks and challenges

A big risk in this campaign is not making the full amount, in which case I will have to hustle to make the money. However, I am determined to record these songs regardless of whether I reach the $3,848 amount. The plan detailed above can be done in phases.  Recording will happen first, followed by mastering (which could happen in 2020 if needed), followed by CD copies. My music will get out into the world. A delayed timeline will not hinder me from writing and composing music.

Another challenge is writing original music. I used to find it very difficult to finish an original song. I had 15 half-written songs, but could not complete one. Recording “Leaving For The Amazon” with Andrew taught me how to finish a project on deadline and trust myself. Now original material is flowing out of me.

 

Perks

Get a signed CD - $15

Get 4 signed CDs - $45

Get 4 CDs and your name mentioned in the liner notes - $75

Get 7 CDs and your name in the liner notes - $100 

I will perform at your home (includes 5 CDs) - $200

Home concert with 8 CDs and your name in the liner notes! - $300

 

Check out this article to learn more about my music studies abroad!

https://cla.umn.edu/global-studies/news-events/...

story:
About Me

I’m George Coleman Jr. a drummer, composer and son of two musical jazz greats, saxophone legend George Coleman Sr. and organist, composer and vocalist, Gloria Coleman. Though I have played with many of the greats over the years on their projects, I haven't released a solo album of my own, and as many of my friends, fans and colleagues have kindly reminded me, it’s a bit overdue. I need your help to make this album happen so I can share the beautiful gift of music I have been given with audiences here in the US and beyond!

About the Project

"Resurgence" is an album that is all about joy. 

Resurgence is an album that takes my Memphis roots in blues music and my love of Cuban rhythm and marries them in a celebration of joy that is bound to make you dance. It's a feel good album all about heart and soul, a celebration of love, and a tribute in joy to a dear friend of mine, the late Harold Mabern, a Memphis-born jazz pianist who always led with his heart in life and music. 

My mother, Gloria Coleman, is really my main inspiration for the blues elements of this project, and my trip to Cuba to learn to play Bata is my inspiration for the Latin flavored material on the album. My father, George Coleman Sr., will be writing an original piece for the album to commemorate Harold and will be playing on the record along with my band. 

Our producer on the day will be the legendary drummer, and my own personal mentor, Michael Carvin . 

My goal for this album is to make you feel so good you can't help but celebrate. 

A Tribute to Harold

Life is funny and just when you think you’ve got it licked, even for a minute, tragedy can strike. Two weeks before I planned to finalize this IndieGoGo project for my recording, legendary pianist Harold Mabern, my dad’s best friend and bandmate since their days back in high school in Memphis, unexpectedly passed away.

My dad was obviously devastated, as very few of his friends and musical colleagues are still alive, but Harold was much more than that--- he was family, and one of dad’s last links to his birthplace, Memphis, Tennessee -that was the incubator of his genius. Harold was also a musical and spiritual uncle to me, and besides being one of the greatest musicians I’ve ever known, he was one of the kindest, funniest and musically knowledgeable people you would ever meet. I never heard him raise his voice to a single person in all the years I knew him and he taught and mentored hundreds of students in his almost 40 years of teaching at William Paterson University.

On the way back from a performance I’d taken my dad to after Harold's passing, in an effort to cheer him up, he said to me, “Son if you want me to, I’d be happy to play on a track or two of your project."

I wasn’t actually sure how to respond so I was quiet for a minute and he said, “I know you want this to be your own thing, but while Sonny Stitt said, 'Every tub must sit on its own bottom,' it would be nice to do a tune of Mabern’s, and I’d like to write an original, maybe a ballad for him, as part of the project.” 

Legendary saxophonist, my father, George Coleman Sr. is writing a special track for this album. 

Why Now?

This is my opportunity to bring more joy into the world. 

The world needs more joy. The world needs more love. It's too easy for us to forget to celebrate this one, beautiful life we have to live when the pressures of daily life are causing us so much stress and anxiety. I want to remind you that you deserve happiness, that you deserve to feel love, that you deserve to smile and dance and be free. 

Harold's passing reminds me to be present to every moment and make it count. I need to make this album now because it's my opportunity to bring light into the world and to do it with my dad while he's still playing at his prime. 

I'm ready to make you DANCE. 

make funny GIFs like this at MakeaGif
 

Meet the Band

Resurgence my first album as a bandleader, and I am so excited to be working with such amazing musicians on this project. 

Mike DiRubbo, Alto Sax

Paul Bollenback, Guitar

Brian Charette, Organ

George Coleman, Drums and Bandleader

Special Guests on the Album

My father and NEA Jazz Master George Coleman Sr. will be writing an original composition for this album and will be playing as a guest on select tracks. We will also have my dear friend of 20+ years, Danny Sadownick, sitting in on percussion. 

George Coleman Sr., Saxophone

Daniel Sadownick, Percussionist 

What We Need 

We need to raise $15,000 to make this album happen. 

Here’s where your money will go:

$9,000  Production (studio recording/musician/producer’s fees)

$1,000    Licensing/publishing costs

$3,000    Mixing and Mastering

$2,000    Physical Production (CD + Art)

If we raise $20,000 and beyond we can make amazing music videos to showcase the band and spread the word of this music far and wide.

Anything we raise beyond $20,000 we’ll use to perform free concerts at high schools in Newark, NJ, Memphis, TN and New York City, the three cities where I or members of my family were raised.

Our perks are awesome and include unreleased mp3’s, a documentary movie poster, private screening of the Coleman Family documentary, pre-release copy of the George Coleman Sr.’s book on Jazz Harmony, and much more…

Other Ways You Can Help

COME SEE US PLAY

Both myself and members of my band play in clubs around the city, both together and on other projects. Come out and support your local musicians whenever you can!

KEEP IN TOUCH

Drop me a line so I can put you on my e-blast so you can come see the band play live in the New York Area and be kept up to date on this project. 

SHARE, SHARE, SHARE!

Help spread the word of this campaign via email, social media or word of mouth.

Thank You For Your Support

As an artist, the process can often feel very lonely, but I have been blessed to have the amazing support of friends, family, and fans through the ups and downs. So many of you have helped me over the years to make my dreams come true through my art and for that, I’m truly grateful. I appreciate you all more than you know, and I don’t ask lightly for your hard-earned money and support. My family and I are indebted to you for your unconditional support over these many years.

I'm asking you once more to believe in me. I promise you won't be disappointed. 

I know you’ve got my back.

story:
Short Summary

We, the members of Carpe Diem String Quartet and Erberk Eryılmaz, began our relationship in 2012 when we were serendipitously introduced to one of his works, Miniatures Set No. 4, while performing a residency at Carnegie Mellon University. Since then, we have been inspired by each other’s creative energies - we are moved by Eryılmaz’s unique combination of the traditional classical string quartet with exotic, exciting, and vivacious Middle Eastern and Eastern European folk elements; Eryılmaz is encouraged by our ability to effectively translate and interpret the energy of his musical language to the national and international stage. 

Our artistic relationship with Eryılmaz has culminated in the recording Dances of the Yogurt Maker. Through Eryılmaz’s music and our interpretation, this recording will give listeners the experience of stepping into the new and beautiful cultures of Turkey, Bulgaria, Greece, Romania, Syria, and more.

The works included in this album are:

  1. Dances of the Yogurt Maker for String Quartet
  2. Miniatures Set No. 4 for String Quartet
  3. Miniatures Set No. 5 for String Quartet and Turkish Folk Percussion
  4. Thracian Airs of Besime Sultan for String Quartet
  5. Hoppa! 3 for String Quartet and Darbuka
  6. Insistent Music for Piano Quintet

 

What We Need & What You Get

This recording will be produced by Grammy Award-winning producer Judith Sherman, will take place at Rice University Duncan Hall in Houston, TX, and will be released on the Naxos Label. Together, we and Eryılmaz will be funding this recording project, and the $5,000 raised here will go towards hiring Ms. Sherman and covering costs associated with release on the Naxos Label. If this goal is exceeded, the additional funds will go towards Ms. Sherman and Carpe Diem’s travel and housing costs. 

We and Eryılmaz are incredibly grateful to our friends and family for donating their time and talent as perks for this fundraiser. These perks include:

  1. Direct music download 
  2. Carpe Diem T-Shirts
  3. Free CD
  4. Wooden Davul stick signed by Eryılmaz and Carpe Diem
  5. Pottery by Cheres Pottery - Thank you to Sarah Hawkey
  6. Custom Shoe Design - Thank you to Libby Sauer
  7. Lesson or chamber music coaching offered by members of the quartet and colleagues
  8. Composition lesson with Erberk Eryılmaz
  9. Original Paintings - Thank you to Karina Wetherbee and Sunni Tieze
  10. Dinner with Carpe Diem
  11. Carpe Diem outreach concert at a Columbus area school, business, skilled nursing facility, or similar organization of the donor’s choice.
  12. Private house concert presented by Carpe Diem String Quartet

Carpe Diem String Quartet is a registered 501(c)3 nonprofit Tax ID #: 20-4351770, which makes all donations tax deductible. We hope you enjoy these perks and consider donating any amount, large or small.

 

The Impact

America is a unique multicultural country - people are able to experience a plethora of cultures each day without leaving their hometown. As an immigrant composer, Eryılmaz feels a responsibility to contribute to the richness of the American culture by bringing music from Turkey, the Middle East, and Eastern Europe to the American stage. The members of Carpe Diem String Quartet feel a responsibility to support the voices of living composers, celebrate their unique musical voices, and interpret the music compellingly and accessibly. With this recording, we all hope that listeners are able to experience and be moved by new cultures, and feel more connected to beauties that all humankind has to offer.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

No contribution is too small, however we do understand that it is not always possible for everyone to contribute financially. If you are not able to contribute financially, we hope you consider sharing our project with your family and friends, following us on social media, and attending to our concerts next time we are in your hometown!

 

A Sneak Peek Into the Works - Words by the Composer

Dances of the Yogurt Maker for String Quartet

Dances of the Yogurt Maker is my free improvisation on eight folk dances from Silifke (Southern Turkey). Silifke is a town that is famous for their yogurt and other dairy products. In the piece, the instruments imitate Turkish folk instruments and their playing styles. All eight dances are connected to form one continuous work. All of these songs are love songs, but they somehow mention yogurt and other dairy products either to make the lyrics rhyme, or to describe their emotions. For example, in “Ham Çökelek,” a husband wishes that his wife chokes and dies while eating raw cheese curds so he can spend the rest of his life with the neighbor girl. On the other hand, in “Silifke’nin Yogurdu,” yogurt is used to rhyme while the protagonist is describing how much he loves his lover. All these folk songs are similarly absurd, fun, and upbeat. I tried to bring that character to the piece.

 

Insistent Music for Piano Quintet

Insistent Music (2019), a five-movement work with connected movements, is inspired by the folk music of Eastern Europe which has endless energy and an insistent optimistic attitude towards sad life events. These inspirations present themselves in the work as a variety of repeated percussive patterns and bursting melodic lines inspired by the folk string playing styles of Eastern Europe.

 

Hoppa! 3 for String Quartet and Darbuka

Hoppa! 3 for String Quartet and Darbuka is part of a series of works on immigration and music that traveled as a result of migration. Hoppa! 3 particularly focuses on the shared folk dances and songs between Turkey and Syria. These two cultures speak two different languages, Turkish and Arabic, but when it comes to music many things are inseparable. This piece emphasizes the unity between the music of these cultures and makes them live together in music. The work consists of four connected movements inspired by the masters of string playing from Eastern Europe to the Middle East.

The title of the work “Hoppa!” is an expression used commonly in Turkish and Eastern European cultures meaning “Come on! Let’s go!”. This forward, ecstatic attitude describes the primary aim of the work, which is to bring the raw energy of folk music from local villages, street weddings, and sunflower fields to the concert stage. 

 

Thracian Airs of Besime Sultan for String Quartet

Thracian Airs of Besime Sultan (2015) is my free improvisation on the folk music of the Thracian region. This six-movement, through-composed piece explores folkloric dances and styles from a large geographical area, including Bulgaria, Greece, Romania and Turkey.

The work was commissioned by Apollo Chamber Players (featuring Tim Pitts and Matthew McClung) and Roma clarinetist Ismail Lumanovski, and it is dedicated to my late grandmother, Besime Civelek. My grandmother was the only member of my family who was from Thrace, and in our last phone conversation, she expressed how much she loves my music. During the summer of 2014, she and I listened to my entire catalog of works. As the sultan of the family, we affectionately called her 'Besime Sultan'.

Thracian Airs of Besime Sultan exists in three versions: I. String quartet, II. Chamber ensemble (clarinet, percussion and string quintet), and III. Solo clarinet, percussion and orchestra.

 

Miniatures Set No. 4 for String Quartet

The Miniature, a visual art form popular during the Ottoman Empire, was used to represent important events in compact paintings. Miniatures Set No. 4 (2013) is a five-movement suite based on Turkish folk dances and instrumental song styles. Although all of the material is original, these movements are highly influenced by the playing styles of master performers of previous centuries. 

"Sirto" is a fast 2/4 dance which is also shared with Greeks and very common on the European side of Turkey. 

"Saz Semaisi" is an instrumental section that is used in religious rituals and in Ottoman court music. This movement later turns to a çiftetelli, which is a type of belly dance. 

"Bolu Oyun Havası" is a 2/4, medium tempo dance from northern Turkey. 

"Taksim" is a very common improvisational movement which is a modal preparation to a song or an instrumental piece in traditional Turkish music. 

"Sıksaray Horon Havası" is a very fast dance in 7/16 from northeast Turkey. This dance is commonly played by a small stringed instrument called a kemençe. With the extended techniques of string playing, the whole ensemble imitates the sound that is produced by this instrument.

Although in folk and traditional music the meters would stay the same throughout each movement, since dancing is not a part of the performance of the piece, in this set of miniatures the meters change freely for fun as well as aesthetic purposes.

 

Miniatures Set No. 5 for String Quartet and Turkish Folk Percussion

Miniatures Set No. 5 for String Quartet and Turkish Folk Percussion (2015) is a five-movement suite based on Turkish folk dances and instrumental song styles. The work was originally written for Saxophone, Viola and Optional Percussion, and was commissioned by the Irrelevants (saxophonist Carrie Koffman and violist Tim Deighton). The set covers a large geographical area from the east to the west of Turkey. 

The five movements are:

I – Hopa Barı (Dance of Hopa): A fast dance in 6/8 from the northeast region of Turkey 

II – Kaşık Havası (Spoon Air): Wooden spoon dance from Central Anatolia

III – Aksak Horo (Irregular Metered Dance): Irregular metered dance from the Balkans

IV – Ağır Aksak Şarkı (Slow Irregular Metered Song): A song style that is common in Ottoman court music

V – Göbek Havası (Belly Air): A famous belly dance air from the Thracian region of Turkey
story_txt:
Short Summary
We, the members of Carpe Diem String Quartet and Erberk Eryılmaz, began our relationship in 2012 when we were serendipitously introduced to one of his works, Miniatures Set No. 4, while performing a residency at Carnegie Mellon University. Since then, we have been inspired by each other’s creative energies - we are moved by Eryılmaz’s unique combination of the traditional classical string quartet with exotic, exciting, and vivacious Middle Eastern and Eastern European folk elements; Eryılmaz is encouraged by our ability to effectively translate and interpret the energy of his musical language to the national and international stage. 
Our artistic relationship with Eryılmaz has culminated in the recording Dances of the Yogurt Maker. Through Eryılmaz’s music and our interpretation, this recording will give listeners the experience of stepping into the new and beautiful cultures of Turkey, Bulgaria, Greece, Romania, Syria, and more.
The works included in this album are:

Dances of the Yogurt Maker for String Quartet
Miniatures Set No. 4 for String Quartet
Miniatures Set No. 5 for String Quartet and Turkish Folk Percussion
Thracian Airs of Besime Sultan for String Quartet
Hoppa! 3 for String Quartet and Darbuka
Insistent Music for Piano Quintet

 

What We Need & What You Get
This recording will be produced by Grammy Award-winning producer Judith Sherman, will take place at Rice University Duncan Hall in Houston, TX, and will be released on the Naxos Label. Together, we and Eryılmaz will be funding this recording project, and the $5,000 raised here will go towards hiring Ms. Sherman and covering costs associated with release on the Naxos Label. If this goal is exceeded, the additional funds will go towards Ms. Sherman and Carpe Diem’s travel and housing costs. 
We and Eryılmaz are incredibly grateful to our friends and family for donating their time and talent as perks for this fundraiser. These perks include:

Direct music download 
Carpe Diem T-Shirts
Free CD
Wooden Davul stick signed by Eryılmaz and Carpe Diem
Pottery by Cheres Pottery - Thank you to Sarah Hawkey
Custom Shoe Design - Thank you to Libby Sauer
Lesson or chamber music coaching offered by members of the quartet and colleagues
Composition lesson with Erberk Eryılmaz
Original Paintings - Thank you to Karina Wetherbee and Sunni Tieze
Dinner with Carpe Diem
Carpe Diem outreach concert at a Columbus area school, business, skilled nursing facility, or similar organization of the donor’s choice.
Private house concert presented by Carpe Diem String Quartet

Carpe Diem String Quartet is a registered 501(c)3 nonprofit Tax ID #: 20-4351770, which makes all donations tax deductible. We hope you enjoy these perks and consider donating any amount, large or small.
 

The Impact
America is a unique multicultural country - people are able to experience a plethora of cultures each day without leaving their hometown. As an immigrant composer, Eryılmaz feels a responsibility to contribute to the richness of the American culture by bringing music from Turkey, the Middle East, and Eastern Europe to the American stage. The members of Carpe Diem String Quartet feel a responsibility to support the voices of living composers, celebrate their unique musical voices, and interpret the music compellingly and accessibly. With this recording, we all hope that listeners are able to experience and be moved by new cultures, and feel more connected to beauties that all humankind has to offer.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
No contribution is too small, however we do understand that it is not always possible for everyone to contribute financially. If you are not able to contribute financially, we hope you consider sharing our project with your family and friends, following us on social media, and attending to our concerts next time we are in your hometown!
 
A Sneak Peek Into the Works - Words by the Composer
Dances of the Yogurt Maker for String Quartet
Dances of the Yogurt Maker is my free improvisation on eight folk dances from Silifke (Southern Turkey). Silifke is a town that is famous for their yogurt and other dairy products. In the piece, the instruments imitate Turkish folk instruments and their playing styles. All eight dances are connected to form one continuous work. All of these songs are love songs, but they somehow mention yogurt and other dairy products either to make the lyrics rhyme, or to describe their emotions. For example, in “Ham Çökelek,” a husband wishes that his wife chokes and dies while eating raw cheese curds so he can spend the rest of his life with the neighbor girl. On the other hand, in “Silifke’nin Yogurdu,” yogurt is used to rhyme while the protagonist is describing how much he loves his lover. All these folk songs are similarly absurd, fun, and upbeat. I tried to bring that character to the piece.
 
Insistent Music for Piano Quintet
Insistent Music (2019), a five-movement work with connected movements, is inspired by the folk music of Eastern Europe which has endless energy and an insistent optimistic attitude towards sad life events. These inspirations present themselves in the work as a variety of repeated percussive patterns and bursting melodic lines inspired by the folk string playing styles of Eastern Europe.
 
Hoppa! 3 for String Quartet and Darbuka
Hoppa! 3 for String Quartet and Darbuka is part of a series of works on immigration and music that traveled as a result of migration. Hoppa! 3 particularly focuses on the shared folk dances and songs between Turkey and Syria. These two cultures speak two different languages, Turkish and Arabic, but when it comes to music many things are inseparable. This piece emphasizes the unity between the music of these cultures and makes them live together in music. The work consists of four connected movements inspired by the masters of string playing from Eastern Europe to the Middle East.
The title of the work “Hoppa!” is an expression used commonly in Turkish and Eastern European cultures meaning “Come on! Let’s go!”. This forward, ecstatic attitude describes the primary aim of the work, which is to bring the raw energy of folk music from local villages, street weddings, and sunflower fields to the concert stage. 
 
Thracian Airs of Besime Sultan for String Quartet
Thracian Airs of Besime Sultan (2015) is my free improvisation on the folk music of the Thracian region. This six-movement, through-composed piece explores folkloric dances and styles from a large geographical area, including Bulgaria, Greece, Romania and Turkey.
The work was commissioned by Apollo Chamber Players (featuring Tim Pitts and Matthew McClung) and Roma clarinetist Ismail Lumanovski, and it is dedicated to my late grandmother, Besime Civelek. My grandmother was the only member of my family who was from Thrace, and in our last phone conversation, she expressed how much she loves my music. During the summer of 2014, she and I listened to my entire catalog of works. As the sultan of the family, we affectionately called her 'Besime Sultan'.
Thracian Airs of Besime Sultan exists in three versions: I. String quartet, II. Chamber ensemble (clarinet, percussion and string quintet), and III. Solo clarinet, percussion and orchestra.
 
Miniatures Set No. 4 for String Quartet
The Miniature, a visual art form popular during the Ottoman Empire, was used to represent important events in compact paintings. Miniatures Set No. 4 (2013) is a five-movement suite based on Turkish folk dances and instrumental song styles. Although all of the material is original, these movements are highly influenced by the playing styles of master performers of previous centuries. 
"Sirto" is a fast 2/4 dance which is also shared with Greeks and very common on the European side of Turkey. 
"Saz Semaisi" is an instrumental section that is used in religious rituals and in Ottoman court music. This movement later turns to a çiftetelli, which is a type of belly dance. 
"Bolu Oyun Havası" is a 2/4, medium tempo dance from northern Turkey. 
"Taksim" is a very common improvisational movement which is a modal preparation to a song or an instrumental piece in traditional Turkish music. 
"Sıksaray Horon Havası" is a very fast dance in 7/16 from northeast Turkey. This dance is commonly played by a small stringed instrument called a kemençe. With the extended techniques of string playing, the whole ensemble imitates the sound that is produced by this instrument.
Although in folk and traditional music the meters would stay the same throughout each movement, since dancing is not a part of the performance of the piece, in this set of miniatures the meters change freely for fun as well as aesthetic purposes. Miniatures Set No. 5 for String Quartet and Turkish Folk Percussion
Miniatures Set No. 5 for String Quartet and Turkish Folk Percussion (2015) is a five-movement suite based on Turkish folk dances and instrumental song styles. The work was originally written for Saxophone, Viola and Optional Percussion, and was commissioned by the Irrelevants (saxophonist Carrie Koffman and violist Tim Deighton). The set covers a large geographical area from the east to the west of Turkey. 
The five movements are:
I – Hopa Barı (Dance of Hopa): A fast dance in 6/8 from the northeast region of Turkey 
II – Kaşık Havası (Spoon Air): Wooden spoon dance from Central Anatolia
III – Aksak Horo (Irregular Metered Dance): Irregular metered dance from the Balkans
IV – Ağır Aksak Şarkı (Slow Irregular Metered Song): A song style that is common in Ottoman court music
V – Göbek Havası (Belly Air): A famous belly dance air from the Thracian region of Turkey

story:
Short Summary

Hi I'm Lynn Miles. I'm a Canadian Singer/songwriter with 14 albums out. I write lots of songs, so I'd like to record album # 15.

I'm trying to raise money so I can record my album in an analogue studio with an acoustic  grand piano. I want the album to sound beautiful.

If I can raise the funds to do this, it will help me continue on my musical/life path. I make my living by touring, and playing festivals. Touring is always helped by releasing a new record, it creates a talking point and energy for promoters and artistic directors. I also really want to see my new songs a have life out there in the world!

 

What I Need & What You Get

I'm asking for $25,000 that's the minimum I need to record in a professional studio, pay an engineer, musicians, mastering,  CD design/art work, manufacturing of hard copies , and mailing costs.  If I'm successful and make more than the goal, the funds will be put towards more time in the studio, because in the recording world, time is money, and time is a luxury.  To be able to record without always watching the clock would be sublime.

Check out my list of perks to see what I'm offering. If there's something I'm not offering, and you have and idea of what you'd like, feel free to ask, maybe a songwriting lesson/visit to the studio etc

If I don't reach my goal, I'll start recording anyway. I always prefer to record an album in one or two chunks of time. I don't like drawing it out over a long period I think the focus can get lost. That being said, I would keep recording, the process would take  longer because I'll have to take my time in terms of coming up with funds to pay for studio time etc. Whatever happens my goal is to put out a record. If the funds are lower than my goal, I'll have to cut some corners on studio time, musicians etc.  I'm grateful to have been able to have put out all the CD'S I have, and I will find a way to carry on!!  You're support would make this process happen in a timely way, and would allow me to not have to make artistic compromises.

If you're a fan of my music, this project will be in keeping with what I've released in the past, but will also hopefully show the growth and maturity in my songwriting. I also think my voice is stronger than ever, singing has been feeling really good. Can't wait to record.

I've successfully completed other crowdfunding campaigns. One for my Winter album and one with THE LYNNeS for our CD "Heartbreak Song For The Radio". I've recorded 14 of my own albums and produce 5 other albums for other artists, so I know the costs involved, I know the pitfalls, what to look out for, and how to complete a project.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, but want to help, sharing my campaign will assist me greatly.

There are Indiegogo share tools for that very purpose.

story:
ACA Symphony is Playing Carnegie Hall!

The ACA Symphony Orchestra is going to play a concert at New York's  Carnegie Hall in March, and you can get a lasting record of the event while helping support this great group of kids on  this fantastic trip. 

Just click Back It to become a sponsor.

About the Concert

The ACA Symphony Orchestra is scheduled to perform at Carnegie Hall on March 16th. Prior to the performance, they will participate in an ensemble workshop with a festival clinician. After their performance, they will receive written critiques, a group photo, and an audio recording of their performance.

Repertoire for Carnegie Concert: Anna Mercereau, Teacher, Conductor, and Director

  • "Hoe-down" from Rodeo, Aaron Copland
  • American In Paris, George Gershwin
  • Tribute to Adagio for Strings, Samuel Barber
  • New World Symphony, Antonín Dvořák
  • The Columbia River Suite by Doris Gazda
     

About the Trip

In the weekend leading up to the Carnegie Hall performance, we will tour the Metropolitan Opera House and attend a Broadway show. We’ll take in some science, art and architecture at the Museum of Natural History, the Metropolitan Museum of Art, and St. Patrick’s Cathedral. We’ll also get a chance to see iconic New York City, including the Empire State Building, Rockefeller Center, and Central Park.

That Monday evening, we will perform at Carnegie Hall!

How You Can Help - What You Get

There are two ways you can help our group make enough to go on this trip:

1. You can share this email via social media.
2. You can click click Back It to become a sponsor and select a donation level. 

Every level of support will receive a thank you recording called "Best of the Season 2019" via digital download. This recording will only be available through this campaign, and includes a great collection of beautifully played chamber and orchestra pieces - some contemporary and some traditional. If you'd like to support at a higher level, you can choose a CD, a personalized postcard from NYC, or a photograph of your student at Carnegie Hall. We'll ship your thank you gift to you in May.

How Funds Will Help Support The Trip

The cost for each student to take this trip is $2,150, including airfare, food, lodging, a Broadway production, and a few museums. The families of these kids have already been doing extensive fundraising, including busking, bake sales, and bottle collections (to name a few).

Our goal for this fundraiser is for each student to raise at least $350. If each student can arrange just a handful of these sponsorships, we can defray much of the cost of this life-changing trip, and allow them to focus on preparing to play their first concert at Carnegie.

When we pitched CrowdFunding to the Orchestra students and parents, I asked them how they wanted to divide the proceeds from this campaign and was really humbled by their response: Every single student and parent in attendance said they wanted all proceeds shared among the whole group.

Timeline For This Campaign, The Concert, and Recordings

This campaign closes mid-December. The trip is in March.
Beginning in April, we'll collect recordings from the season into a Best Of collection, and make a professionally produced CD and digital download. In May, symphony members will get together to package and ship the CDs to supporters.

If you donate at the postcard level, you'll get the download and CD, plus you'll also receive a personalized postcard from NYC in March.

If you donate at the picture level, you'll receive the download and CD (May), the postcard in March, and the photo in May. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Share this link on social media:

story:
Greetings!

MY STORY: I'm Elaine Dame, a Chicago-based jazz singer, bandleader, flutist and vocal jazz instructor. I have been performing professionally (it's how I make my living) for almost twenty years. I'm gearing up for my 3rd recording and I need your help. Do you like all the excellent music from the 1970s? You do?! Far out! Read on!

WHY THIS? I have been thinking about this project for almost five years, wanting to sing and record all my favorite music from the 1970s, arranged in a jazz style. You see, I grew up in the 70s, so the connection that I have to music from this era is deep and sentimental. I can hear any song from that decade and instantly think of a specific moment growing up in Stevensville, MI. For those of us that grew up in the 1970s, we were blessed with some inCREDibly good music, including blues, pop-rock, soft rock, classic rock, funk, R & B and hey, even disco. 

There will be a wide range of styles and songs on the recording and I've enlisted one of the most talented musicians and composers in Chicago, or anywhere for that matter, to help me arrange these tunes: Chris Madsen.

For those of us that grew up with the music, it will most certainly bring about joyous feelings of nostalgia and you'll be able to hear a classic song from the era completely redesigned, making you think of and feel the tune in a new way. Additionally, I'm hoping to introduce "new" music to new listeners of all ages. Finally, this is feel-good music! We need it now more than ever! 

THE BREAD, MAN:  producing your own CD is incredibly costly. I produced my first CD in 2005 and the total cost was $20,000.  My sophomore recording, released in 2015, cost almost $28,000. It is virtually impossible for an independent artist like me to make a recording without financial help. I am engaging in the day-to-day hard work that it takes to keep a small business going, while still trying to grow as an artist and put food on the table.  In addition, the recession took its toll on musicians (I lost ALL of my income sources at the time, including income from private music lessons, corporate events, weddings, clubs....everyone was downsizing) and we were all just struggling to make it through, as most people were.

Nonetheless, musicians like myself have a need to document our progress, to tell our musical stories, to express ourselves in a collaborative way with our colleagues. Then after we create the music, we want to get it out there via radio promotion, industry publications, TV appearances and live touring. We want to take our time and do it right, without rushing, so we're shooting for a July 2020 release.

I have a burning desire to record this material and create something new! Boogie on down to those perks, man!

YOUR CONTRIBUTION: no matter how small, will help me make my dream come true. 

What I Need & What You Get 

I've got some incredible perks for you to choose from, from a concert in your home to music lessons to YOU picking one of YOUR favorite tunes from the 1970s for us to include on the recording.

Also, you may be asking yourself: Why does she need all that dough to make a CD?! Explore the pie chart below (who doesn't love a good pie chart?!) to see exactly where the money will be spent.

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you choose not to contribute, that's O.K. It doesn't mean you can't help! If you know of anyone who might enjoy a wonderfully arranged vocal jazz record featuring music from the 1970s with phenomenal, world-class jazz musicians, please help me get the word out by sharing my campaign via social media. Music is a great gift as well! Or you can purchase the Voice Lesson perk and gift that special someone a private vocal lesson with me. 

Thank you from the bottom of my heart for your support, encouragement, and contribution!       I love you! Keep on truckin'!

Questions About Anything? 

Email me at elaine_dame@hotmail.com

story:
Short Summary

We’re an independent band of four brothers who have been playing music together for the past 16 years.

As an independent self-managing and self released band, we have been able to retain creative control and freedom of our music, preserving authenticity in the way we write, produce and record music. We feel that this is has had a positive influence on our music and crowd funding would allow us to keep working the way we would like to.

Previous releases - ‘Wash Away’, Wake Up In A Dream’ and ‘Moving in Slow Motion’ --have done really well, reaching number 2 in the Spotify Viral 50 chart, some tracks with over 350k streams, with continued support by BBC Radio 6 Music, Radio Scotland & Radio nan Gaidheal, Passport Approved worldwide, STV and TV sync work with Hollyoaks, Tattoo Fixers and BT sport. 

Our album is not only something that we as a band have always aspired to, but which our fans have been requesting since the beginning of our professional music career. As we have self-funded all of our EPs, we have only been financially capable of releasing a maximum of 4 songs at a time, but with additional contribution from fans we would be able to afford the recording and releasing of our 11 track debut album. 

We have recorded half the album, six songs, so far, investing £6000 of our own money. We’re aiming to raise a further £15,000 which would help us finish the recording of the album, pay for producers, studio time and mastering of the album as well as the release and marketing of the album. £6,000 would secure the recording, production, studio time and mastering of the album. £9,000 would be invested into our PR and digital marketing such as press, blogs and radio plugs as well as band merchandise, music videos, artwork, vinyls and CDs. Contributions would help us achieve our dream of releasing an album that we’ve been tirelessly writing for the past three years.

The backing of contributors would give us the opportunity to produce our largest catalogue of work so far. We are extremely excited to present our album to our fans to show the new direction and soundscape that our music has taken, as a result of Ded Rabbit working with sound engineers and producers of RAK studio, Robbie Nelson and Mike Horner.

Through the perks we can offer, we will be able to give something back to the listeners, fans and contributors.

 

Originally from Yorkshire, Ded Rabbit moved to the Highlands in 1996 and through the isolation and a developing love of music, the brothers started playing music together. After moving to Edinburgh to study, they started working together in the studio, releasing their EPs ‘Wash Away’ 2014, ‘Wake Up In A Dream’ and ‘Moving In Slow Motion’. In 2015 the brotherly unit began their highly successful partnership with Glasgow based Rocket Science Studios, who have recorded the likes of Texas and Bell & Sebastian.

 

“Their music echoes the influences they cite like Hendrix and The Beatles (post-1965) but they are avid gig-goers too, eager to see what is going on nowadays, so they are just as likely to be out watching Peace or Palma Violets as they are at home listening to Abbey Road or Electric Ladyland”- John Paul Mason, Daily Record.

“With hints of The Housemartins and early Arctic Monkeys infused with a twist of funk and original lyrics, they have created a distinctive and highly listenable sound of their own.” - Olaf Furniss & Derick Mackinnon, Artist Of The Week: Scotland On Sunday.

“I know they're very hard working and are building up a good following in the capital... classic Indie sound” - Vic Galloway, BBC Radio Scotland.

"Undeniable stage presence and performance skills”(-)”An exciting live band that will appeal widely and who are definitely festival-ready” - David Balfour, Record Of The Day.

The brothers are working on their debut album which is due to be released in 2020.

“It’s an explosive affair when you see Ded Rabbit live. I’d put them up there with Catfish and The Bottlemen as one of the best live acts around at the moment.” - Jim Gellatly.Amazing Radio.

Why It's Important To Us

You only get one shot at a debut album! As a band of four brothers we’ve always dreamt of releasing our debut album. Maintaining creative control is something we’ve always felt strongly about and as it’s our first album we want it to be how exactly how we want it.  

 

What You’ll Help Us Achieve

-Contributors would help make the album possible - from pre-production & production itself to post-production. This would include travel costs, studio time, production and engineer costs & mastering. 

- Contributors would also help pay for PR Promotion of the Album through paying blogs, radio pluggers, music videos, digital marketing through Facebook & Instagram etc.

The funds would also go towards making physical CDs and vinyl as well as new merchandise. 

- Releasing a 11 track album would be financially beneficial for us, not only through plays and purchasing of the album but also through Sync. 

 

What We Need

Break down:

PR £1500

Radio plugger £1500

Digital Marketing £1000

Artwork £500

Videos £1000

1000 Vinyl & 100 CDs £3000

Merch £500

Recording – production, studio time £4000

Mastering £2000

Total - £15,000

 

Where The Funds Will Go

The first £6,000 will be dedicated to the production and post-production process of recording and mastering the album. With £6,000 this would guarantee us -insert number of hours of studio time & amount of songs – with producers & sound engineers Mike Horner and Robbie Nelson as well as paying for the post-production time required for them to edit and master the album. Any money raised past £6,000 will be dedicated to the release. 

 

The Impact

Now as a band, we are motivated to take our musical careers to the next level by investing in the expertise of RAK Studio producers. By working with Robbie & Mike our aim is to try to capture our live sound. Self funding the album enables us to maintain creative control which has always been something important to us brothers. Being able to record in RAK Studio’s large live studio rooms, we have been able to capture the live sound and essence of our music. 

Last year we earned as much money through sync work (TV. and adverts) as we did through live performances. Having a whole new album of 11 tracks would give us a platform to further pursue such revenue, so increasing our sustainability. 

Having further financial support towards the album would ensure a successful PR and radio campaign and would guarantee us further exposure and promotion of the album, whilst building on our previous success with our EP releases.

Every investment, no matter how small or large, whether we meet our full target or not, would be a integral part of the recording and releasing of the album. 

Indiegogo allows us to use any funds raised through the campaign process whether on target or below, but with contributors’support the full target could be reached & we would not only be able to record the remaining tracks of the album, but invest in the promotion and marketing launch that it deserves.

Any contribution will bring the materialisation and reality of recording and realising the album a little closer. Even if Ded Rabbit don’t meet their target, the money contributed will be used towards the recording and release of the album and will make it possible.

This is the first time we have crowd funded a project although we have always self released and self managed our music. We’ve managed to achieve a remarkable amount self releasing our previous EP’s with over 350k spotify streams on some tracks, tours across Europe, regular airplay on BBC Radio 6 music, Radio Scotland, Radio nan Gaedheal, Passport Approved worldwide, STV  & regular TV sync work with Hollyoaks, Tattoo Fixers and BT sport. 

 

Risks & Challenges

One obstacle that could be a problem is we don’t raise enough money to finish the album in RAK studios. If this were to happen we have a plan B in place whereby we would only use RAK studios for the bigger drum sounds and use a smaller live room in a cheaper studio or Mike’s home studio as an alternative. 

Any contribution would be greatly appreciated but we need all the help we can get right now and if you’re able to let anyone else know about helping us reach our goal then that would be brilliant. 

 

You can help spread the word by using the Indiegogo share tools and sharing it on social media. 

Thanks for all your help and support!
story_txt:
Short Summary
We’re an independent band of four brothers who have been playing music together for the past 16 years.
As an independent self-managing and self released band, we have been able to retain creative control and freedom of our music, preserving authenticity in the way we write, produce and record music. We feel that this is has had a positive influence on our music and crowd funding would allow us to keep working the way we would like to.
Previous releases - ‘Wash Away’, Wake Up In A Dream’ and ‘Moving in Slow Motion’ --have done really well, reaching number 2 in the Spotify Viral 50 chart, some tracks with over 350k streams, with continued support by BBC Radio 6 Music, Radio Scotland & Radio nan Gaidheal, Passport Approved worldwide, STV and TV sync work with Hollyoaks, Tattoo Fixers and BT sport. 
Our album is not only something that we as a band have always aspired to, but which our fans have been requesting since the beginning of our professional music career. As we have self-funded all of our EPs, we have only been financially capable of releasing a maximum of 4 songs at a time, but with additional contribution from fans we would be able to afford the recording and releasing of our 11 track debut album. 
We have recorded half the album, six songs, so far, investing £6000 of our own money. We’re aiming to raise a further £15,000 which would help us finish the recording of the album, pay for producers, studio time and mastering of the album as well as the release and marketing of the album. £6,000 would secure the recording, production, studio time and mastering of the album. £9,000 would be invested into our PR and digital marketing such as press, blogs and radio plugs as well as band merchandise, music videos, artwork, vinyls and CDs. Contributions would help us achieve our dream of releasing an album that we’ve been tirelessly writing for the past three years.
The backing of contributors would give us the opportunity to produce our largest catalogue of work so far. We are extremely excited to present our album to our fans to show the new direction and soundscape that our music has taken, as a result of Ded Rabbit working with sound engineers and producers of RAK studio, Robbie Nelson and Mike Horner.

The brothers are working on their debut album which is due to be released in 2020.
