story:
"All of You"

Our First Full Album: New Music for the Movement!

Hey, I'm Adam Gottlieb, and my band is Adam Gottlieb & OneLove. We make music for the movement, songs inspired by the growing social response to the revolutionary times we are living through, meant to inspire those who are in the struggles to secure such basic human rights as housing, food, healthcare, clean water, a livable planet, education, and peace and justice in our communities, as well as from the police/justice system, etc. I believe all of us who are struggling are in one way or another fighting for a new world where peace is the reality of our lives, where there will be no need for poverty, hunger, pollution, prisons or police. I believe such a world is not only possible, but necessary. And I believe music is playing an important role in gathering, galvanizing and inspiring this movement, as it always has.

We are currently finishing up our first full album, "All of You," an epically ambitious project that has truly been a creation not just of our band but of the many voices and visions of this movement who inspired the songs. The band and I started working on the earliest songs with my band when we first formed in the summer of 2014, so in that sense this album has been over four years in the making. We began the recording process in early February of 2018, and we are now in the final stages of recording: adding finishing touches such as auxiliary percussion, background vocals, audio samples, etc. We will soon be moving into the mixing and mastering stage, to be followed by distribution, duplication and promotion.​ All of this takes money, and our budget for the album, which I have been paying for out of pocket, is almost spent (including a $2500 grant we won from the Chicago Department of Cultural Affairs and Special Events for the project!). The cost to make and release this album will be just over $10,000, which is the amount that I am attempting to raise with this crowd-funding campaign. Making this amount from donations will allow us to not only secure the resources for finishing the project, but to create a budget for distributing, duplicating, and marketing the album so that we can launch it into the world with as much energy as it deserves!

The photo collage that will serve as the foundation for the artwork (in progress) for "All of You"

 

Compared to our debut EP that came out last year, "Cicada Season," this new album is a BEAST! (You might say that if the EP was a cicada, the album is a lion!) "Cicada Season" showcased five songs that were eclectic, but all grounded in the basic acoustic folk-rock sound we are rooted in (with reggae and blues overtones). We describe our music in many ways: "Folk-Hop Fusion," "Modern Folk-Rock," "Folk/Rock/Reggae Fusion with Hip Hop, Funk, and Blues overtones," etc. "All of You" will have 12 original songs with all of the elements that Cicada Season had and more, representing a much wider range of the styles that OneLove blends, including elements of Hip Hop, Funk, Hard Rock, and Ska! It will also feature live horns on over half of the songs, as well as a wide variety of featured vocalists, spoken word artists, instrumentalists, and sound design elements with audio samples from first-hand interviews and protests/actions we have been involved with. 

The horn players from Fatbook who recorded on the album. From left to right: Evan Jacobson, (Trombone), Adam Gottlieb, Anthony Beck (Sound Engineer), Constantine Alexander (Trumpet), Roy McGrath (Tenor Saxophone)

Ever since I was a kid, the music that I have loved the most has been music that had both a contagious energy and a conscious message expressed through honest poetry. I have always believed in the power of such music to change the world. I have a wide range of influences, which are reflected in the eclectic and genre-fusing sound that OneLove delivers. My biggest inspirations have been Bob Marley, The Beatles, Bob Dylan, Sly & The Family Stone, Tracy Chapman, and, more recently, Hip Hop artists such as Lauryn Hill, Flobots, Brother Ali, and Rebel Diaz, as well as modern folk-rock and reggae-fusion artists such as Nahko & Medicine for the People, Wookiefoot, Trevor Hall, Dustin Thomas, and more. If I can inspire you in your struggle to live up to your full potential - and to push humanity forward by doing so - the way that these artists have inspired me, then my time here on earth will not be wasted.

Which brings me to the real meaning of the album's title: "All of You." It applies to both the individual and collective level: on the individual level, life demands that you show up with your whole self, with all of YOU. (And this is especially true about the crisis we are living through in these times.) And on the collective level, it will take ALL of us to completely transform the world from the old society to the new one: to create a world where all of us can truly be all of who we truly are. So that's who the album is for, and who the fight itself is for: "All of You."

 

What We Need:

Here's what we need the money for, specifically:

  • Recording: $4500
  • Core Band: $2200
  • Guest Musicians: $625
  • Artwork: $330
  • Mixing and Mastering: $700
  • Digital Distribution: $115
  • Physical CD Duplications: $1000
  • Payment to videographer for one official music video from album: $200
  • Merch (Shirts, Posters, Stickers, etc): $350

 

The Impact

(What We Mean By #MusicForTheMovement...)

  • One beautiful part of the concept of the album is that we have woven in audio samples from interviews with people responding to the question: "What is your vision that keeps you going?" These samples, along with others from first-hand interviews at protests, actions, teach-ins, and other events, form an important theme throughout the album.
  • Many of the songs are intensely personal at the same time as being pointedly political. "Under the Viaduct," for example, tells the story of a heroic resistance effort led by residents of Tent City, a community of folks seeking refuge under the bridges of Lawrence and Wilson Avenues at Lake Shore Drive in the Uptown Neighborhood of Chicago. They were demanding a real solution to the housing crisis that drove them there, and protesting a City-enforced eviction from the viaducts in September of 2017. I wrote the song at the request of one of the Tent City residents, an unhoused comrade who we were working with in that struggle. The lyrics were inspired by the Psalms, because the evictions took place during the Jewish High Holidays. Audio samples of first-hand interviews from the day their struggle climaxed in a dramatic traffic-shut-down action on Lake Shore Drive are woven into the album version of the song.
  • Two songs on the album, "Kylo" and "Water is Life," came directly out of my experiences around traveling to Standing Rock in the fall of 2016 to participate in the resistance against Energy Transfer Partners' Dakota Access Pipeline. The song "Kylo" is named after Kylo Prince, one of the Water Protectors we met who were traveling around the country that summer, raising awareness of their struggle and calling on supporters to join the effort. When my partner Diana and I did go up to the resistance camps in Cannonball, ND, that October along with our comrade Brett to cover the story for the People's Tribune, we met up with those same folks again, and interviewed them along with many other Water Protectors. What stood out to me most from that experience was a powerful truth: the resistance demonstrated a kind of unity across national/racial/ethnic and ideological lines unlike any I had seen before; and this kind of unity was also part of the vision - and the prophecies - that inspired so many of the Water Protectors we talked to.
  • "Water is Life" is a prayer song and a protest song intended to be used by folks in the movement. It features Diana Zwinak and El La Katrina - two powerful women Water Protectors - offering Spoken Word Poetry to complement the repetitive chant of the song's chorus. It also features vocals from three young children Water Protectors - children of a friend of ours who took her whole family to Standing Rock and is a fierce organizer here in Chicago. It is the longest song on the album at 10 minutes, and is the only song we recorded without a metronome. It is a sacred song.
  • The single off the album, "Heart Beat," features a unique instrumentation with keys as well as a verse from Chicago emcee-musician LO Kari, as well as an excerpt from a poem by Chicago organizer/artist/abolitionist Ethos, and an excerpt from a "vision" interview with Chicago organizer and artist Damon Williams. It is one of our best songs to play live on the stage, and one of the most powerful songs on the album. 
  • The album follows a musical and narrative arc to tell a larger story out of many stories. Ultimately, it is about a vision of the peaceful world that is possible and necessary. But it is also a story about the destruction of our planet and of our society in this age of late capitalism. So many issues are touched on: homelessness, police violence, genocide, the oil market, war, global warming, environmental destruction, sexism/patriarchy, racism, violation of indigenous treaties/sovereignty, water contamination, school closings, and more. But the album begins and ends decisively on a high note - it is meant to inspire with the power of our common vision.

So you see, when we say "music for the movement," we don't simply mean songs about social issues. We mean music that is part of a permanent dialogue with, and struggle alongside, our brothers and sisters and comrades fighting for a decent life. Many of the songs on this album are about real events and people who you may or may not have heard about, but who are practical leaders in battles over housing, environmental justice, police and prison reform/abolition, clean water, a livable planet, peace, and many other issues. All of these fronts of struggle are part of what we mean by "the movement." By supporting this project, you are supporting our effort to not only help tell the stories of these struggles, but to give the music back to the movement itself as an offering. We believe music has the power to uplift the spirits of people in struggle all over the world and inspire the next generation of revolutionaries.

To become more familiar with our work, you can read the lyrics to the entire album here. And if you haven't already, you can listen to our EP, "Cicada Season," here. You can also check out the other videos attached to this campaign! And one more very special thing. I am really amazed at what one of my fans, Ben Eicher, wrote about my stop in Chadron, Nebraska for the People's Tribune. You can read his article here.

And here are the PERKS we are offering our generous donors:

  • $1 - THANK YOU! A public "Thank You" by name on our FB page
  • $15 - DOWNLOAD: A public "Thank You" and a download of the album!
  • $33 - AUTOGRAPHED CD:
    • All of the above plus a signed physical CD! (*does not include shipping costs)
  • $50 - MERCH PACK: All of the above plus:
    • A signed copy of the Cicada Season EP
    • A signed "All of You" poster
    • *does not include shipping costs
  • $75 - SUPER MERCH PACK! All of the above plus:
    • A signed copy of the Cicada Season poster
    • A download of our entire music catalog on bandcamp (includes 3 singles in addition to the EP and the album)
    • A "Cicada Season" lyric book
    • A hand-written thank you card from Adam on the back of a glossy photo from the album collage process
    • *does not include shipping costs
  • $100 - SUPER FAN PACK! All of the above plus:
    • Handwritten lyrics of a OneLove song of your choice!
    • Links to exclusive behind-the-scenes content from the making of the album
    • A download of a surprise remix of one of the songs from the album!
  • $200 - MUSIC/POETRY FEEDBACK
    • All of the above plus in-depth professional feedback from Adam on up to three of your own original poems or songs
  • $300 - VIDEO HANG WITH ADAM!
    • ​All of the above plus an hour-long video call session with Adam
  • $400 - COVER SONG OR POEM OF YOUR CHOICE!
    • ​​All of the above plus I will learn, record, and send you a performance of a poem or song of your choice!
  • $500 - ORIGINAL SONG OR POEM!
    • ​All of the perks up to the $300 level, plus I will write you an original song or poem for a topic/occasion of your choice!
  • $1000 - PRIVATE CONCERT!
    • All of the perks up to the $300 level, plus an hour-long performance from Adam
    • *does not include travel and lodging costs

**I will get to these individualized perks in the order that the corresponding donations come in! Depending on how epic of the response to this campaign is, it might take me a while to get to some of them, but I guarantee that I will get all of these perks to you! (Hopefully within a two months for the low-end ones and within six months for the high end ones).

Timeline, Risks & Challenges

We are almost finished with the project, so at this point it is basically as certain as just about anything is certain that we are going to finish it! (G-d willing!!). The main risk/challenge at this point is simply that the project - and the release - get slowed down and pushed back further due to normal kinds of scheduling challenges. A million factors limit how much time we can book at Audio Warrior Productions studio each week where we are recording and working on the album with our sound engineer, Anthony Beck. Because making an album of this kind is such an intensive and time-consuming process, and because everyone involved is busy hustling to survive (#capitalism), it has been difficult to meet our intended deadlines for each stage of the process, but we keep pushing forward and adjusting as needed.

We have already had to push back the expected release from October to November - and we are prepared to push it back further than that if necessary, but we will not sacrifice the quality of the music for an earlier release date! In the long run, the release date is not what matters - what matters is the music on the record, that we hope will last forever. So we want to do it right.

Other than that, and barring emergencies, there are really no significant risks or obstacles at this point!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Of course every dollar counts, and we are so grateful for donations of any amount! But we also understand that sometimes, you just aren't in a position to give. If that's the case for you, and you still want to support, there are many other ways to help out in lieu of (or in addition to!) donating:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign! (You can use the Indiegogo share tools, post/email/call/text your friends about it, and even - what a concept - tell people about it in REAL LIFE!)
  • Turn people on to our music who haven't heard us yet, and share our FB page where they will learn about this campaign and other OneLove goings-on.
  • Put us in touch with people who you think would be interested in helping out or covering our story.
  • Offer us another service such as photography, videography, social media assistance, etc!

 

And, if we don't reach our full goal...​

We will prioritize all of the resources we get toward the most concrete outstanding costs of completing the album (recording, mixing, and mastering), and continue to hustle in order to pay the rest of the costs out of pocket. The process may be slowed down, but we will be able to complete the album regardless. We are consciously NOT choosing to run this campaign as an "all-or-nothing" fundraiser. We are grateful for every dollar donated. 

 

❤️ THANK YOU!!! ❤️

Adam Gottlieb & OneLove (2018). From left to right: Diana Zwinak (Manager), Jed Lickerman (Lead Guitar), Tony Mest (Drums), Noah Silver-Mathews (Bass), Adam Gottlieb (Guitar, Lead Vocals), Amanda Suckow (Violin, Mandolin, Vocals)
story_txt:
"All of You"
Our First Full Album: New Music for the Movement!
Hey, I'm Adam Gottlieb, and my band is Adam Gottlieb & OneLove. We make music for the movement, songs inspired by the growing social response to the revolutionary times we are living through, meant to inspire those who are in the struggles to secure such basic human rights as housing, food, healthcare, clean water, a livable planet, education, and peace and justice in our communities, as well as from the police/justice system, etc. I believe all of us who are struggling are in one way or another fighting for a new world where peace is the reality of our lives, where there will be no need for poverty, hunger, pollution, prisons or police. I believe such a world is not only possible, but necessary. And I believe music is playing an important role in gathering, galvanizing and inspiring this movement, as it always has.
We are currently finishing up our first full album, "All of You," an epically ambitious project that has truly been a creation not just of our band but of the many voices and visions of this movement who inspired the songs. The band and I started working on the earliest songs with my band when we first formed in the summer of 2014, so in that sense this album has been over four years in the making. We began the recording process in early February of 2018, and we are now in the final stages of recording: adding finishing touches such as auxiliary percussion, background vocals, audio samples, etc. We will soon be moving into the mixing and mastering stage, to be followed by distribution, duplication and promotion.​ All of this takes money, and our budget for the album, which I have been paying for out of pocket, is almost spent (including a $2500 grant we won from the Chicago Department of Cultural Affairs and Special Events for the project!). The cost to make and release this album will be just over $10,000, which is the amount that I am attempting to raise with this crowd-funding campaign. Making this amount from donations will allow us to not only secure the resources for finishing the project, but to create a budget for distributing, duplicating, and marketing the album so that we can launch it into the world with as much energy as it deserves!

The photo collage that will serve as the foundation for the artwork (in progress) for "All of You"
 
Compared to our debut EP that came out last year, "Cicada Season," this new album is a BEAST! (You might say that if the EP was a cicada, the album is a lion!) "Cicada Season" showcased five songs that were eclectic, but all grounded in the basic acoustic folk-rock sound we are rooted in (with reggae and blues overtones). We describe our music in many ways: "Folk-Hop Fusion," "Modern Folk-Rock," "Folk/Rock/Reggae Fusion with Hip Hop, Funk, and Blues overtones," etc. "All of You" will have 12 original songs with all of the elements that Cicada Season had and more, representing a much wider range of the styles that OneLove blends, including elements of Hip Hop, Funk, Hard Rock, and Ska! It will also feature live horns on over half of the songs, as well as a wide variety of featured vocalists, spoken word artists, instrumentalists, and sound design elements with audio samples from first-hand interviews and protests/actions we have been involved with. 

The horn players from Fatbook who recorded on the album. From left to right: Evan Jacobson, (Trombone), Adam Gottlieb, Anthony Beck (Sound Engineer), Constantine Alexander (Trumpet), Roy McGrath (Tenor Saxophone)
Ever since I was a kid, the music that I have loved the most has been music that had both a contagious energy and a conscious message expressed through honest poetry. I have always believed in the power of such music to change the world. I have a wide range of influences, which are reflected in the eclectic and genre-fusing sound that OneLove delivers. My biggest inspirations have been Bob Marley, The Beatles, Bob Dylan, Sly & The Family Stone, Tracy Chapman, and, more recently, Hip Hop artists such as Lauryn Hill, Flobots, Brother Ali, and Rebel Diaz, as well as modern folk-rock and reggae-fusion artists such as Nahko & Medicine for the People, Wookiefoot, Trevor Hall, Dustin Thomas, and more. If I can inspire you in your struggle to live up to your full potential - and to push humanity forward by doing so - the way that these artists have inspired me, then my time here on earth will not be wasted.
Which brings me to the real meaning of the album's title: "All of You." It applies to both the individual and collective level: on the individual level, life demands that you show up with your whole self, with all of YOU. (And this is especially true about the crisis we are living through in these times.) And on the collective level, it will take ALL of us to completely transform the world from the old society to the new one: to create a world where all of us can truly be all of who we truly are. So that's who the album is for, and who the fight itself is for: "All of You."
 
What We Need:
Here's what we need the money for, specifically:

Recording: $4500
Core Band: $2200
Guest Musicians: $625
Artwork: $330
Mixing and Mastering: $700
Digital Distribution: $115
Physical CD Duplications: $1000
Payment to videographer for one official music video from album: $200
Merch (Shirts, Posters, Stickers, etc): $350

 
The Impact
(What We Mean By #MusicForTheMovement...)

One beautiful part of the concept of the album is that we have woven in audio samples from interviews with people responding to the question: "What is your vision that keeps you going?" These samples, along with others from first-hand interviews at protests, actions, teach-ins, and other events, form an important theme throughout the album.

Many of the songs are intensely personal at the same time as being pointedly political. "Under the Viaduct," for example, tells the story of a heroic resistance effort led by residents of Tent City, a community of folks seeking refuge under the bridges of Lawrence and Wilson Avenues at Lake Shore Drive in the Uptown Neighborhood of Chicago. They were demanding a real solution to the housing crisis that drove them there, and protesting a City-enforced eviction from the viaducts in September of 2017. I wrote the song at the request of one of the Tent City residents, an unhoused comrade who we were working with in that struggle. The lyrics were inspired by the Psalms, because the evictions took place during the Jewish High Holidays. Audio samples of first-hand interviews from the day their struggle climaxed in a dramatic traffic-shut-down action on Lake Shore Drive are woven into the album version of the song.

Two songs on the album, "Kylo" and "Water is Life," came directly out of my experiences around traveling to Standing Rock in the fall of 2016 to participate in the resistance against Energy Transfer Partners' Dakota Access Pipeline. The song "Kylo" is named after Kylo Prince, one of the Water Protectors we met who were traveling around the country that summer, raising awareness of their struggle and calling on supporters to join the effort. When my partner Diana and I did go up to the resistance camps in Cannonball, ND, that October along with our comrade Brett to cover the story for the People's Tribune, we met up with those same folks again, and interviewed them along with many other Water Protectors. What stood out to me most from that experience was a powerful truth: the resistance demonstrated a kind of unity across national/racial/ethnic and ideological lines unlike any I had seen before; and this kind of unity was also part of the vision - and the prophecies - that inspired so many of the Water Protectors we talked to.

"Water is Life" is a prayer song and a protest song intended to be used by folks in the movement. It features Diana Zwinak and El La Katrina - two powerful women Water Protectors - offering Spoken Word Poetry to complement the repetitive chant of the song's chorus. It also features vocals from three young children Water Protectors - children of a friend of ours who took her whole family to Standing Rock and is a fierce organizer here in Chicago. It is the longest song on the album at 10 minutes, and is the only song we recorded without a metronome. It is a sacred song.
The single off the album, "Heart Beat," features a unique instrumentation with keys as well as a verse from Chicago emcee-musician LO Kari, as well as an excerpt from a poem by Chicago organizer/artist/abolitionist Ethos, and an excerpt from a "vision" interview with Chicago organizer and artist Damon Williams. It is one of our best songs to play live on the stage, and one of the most powerful songs on the album. 

The album follows a musical and narrative arc to tell a larger story out of many stories. Ultimately, it is about a vision of the peaceful world that is possible and necessary. But it is also a story about the destruction of our planet and of our society in this age of late capitalism. So many issues are touched on: homelessness, police violence, genocide, the oil market, war, global warming, environmental destruction, sexism/patriarchy, racism, violation of indigenous treaties/sovereignty, water contamination, school closings, and more. But the album begins and ends decisively on a high note - it is meant to inspire with the power of our common vision.


So you see, when we say "music for the movement," we don't simply mean songs about social issues. We mean music that is part of a permanent dialogue with, and struggle alongside, our brothers and sisters and comrades fighting for a decent life. Many of the songs on this album are about real events and people who you may or may not have heard about, but who are practical leaders in battles over housing, environmental justice, police and prison reform/abolition, clean water, a livable planet, peace, and many other issues. All of these fronts of struggle are part of what we mean by "the movement." By supporting this project, you are supporting our effort to not only help tell the stories of these struggles, but to give the music back to the movement itself as an offering. We believe music has the power to uplift the spirits of people in struggle all over the world and inspire the next generation of revolutionaries.
To become more familiar with our work, you can read the lyrics to the entire album here. And if you haven't already, you can listen to our EP, "Cicada Season," here. You can also check out the other videos attached to this campaign! And one more very special thing. I am really amazed at what one of my fans, Ben Eicher, wrote about my stop in Chadron, Nebraska for the People's Tribune. You can read his article here.


And here are the PERKS we are offering our generous donors:


$1 - THANK YOU! A public "Thank You" by name on our FB page

$15 - DOWNLOAD: A public "Thank You" and a download of the album!

$33 - AUTOGRAPHED CD:All of the above plus a signed physical CD! (*does not include shipping costs)


$50 - MERCH PACK: All of the above plus:
A signed copy of the Cicada Season EP
A signed "All of You" poster
*does not include shipping costs



$75 - SUPER MERCH PACK! All of the above plus:
A signed copy of the Cicada Season poster
A download of our entire music catalog on bandcamp (includes 3 singles in addition to the EP and the album)
A "Cicada Season" lyric book
A hand-written thank you card from Adam on the back of a glossy photo from the album collage process
*does not include shipping costs



$100 - SUPER FAN PACK! All of the above plus:
Handwritten lyrics of a OneLove song of your choice!
Links to exclusive behind-the-scenes content from the making of the album
A download of a surprise remix of one of the songs from the album!



$200 - MUSIC/POETRY FEEDBACKAll of the above plus in-depth professional feedback from Adam on up to three of your own original poems or songs


$300 - VIDEO HANG WITH ADAM!​All of the above plus an hour-long video call session with Adam


$400 - COVER SONG OR POEM OF YOUR CHOICE!​​All of the above plus I will learn, record, and send you a performance of a poem or song of your choice!


$500 - ORIGINAL SONG OR POEM!​All of the perks up to the $300 level, plus I will write you an original song or poem for a topic/occasion of your choice!


$1000 - PRIVATE CONCERT!
All of the perks up to the $300 level, plus an hour-long performance from Adam
*does not include travel and lodging costs



**I will get to these individualized perks in the order that the corresponding donations come in! Depending on how epic of the response to this campaign is, it might take me a while to get to some of them, but I guarantee that I will get all of these perks to you! (Hopefully within a two months for the low-end ones and within six months for the high end ones).

Timeline, Risks & Challenges
We are almost finished with the project, so at this point it is basically as certain as just about anything is certain that we are going to finish it! (G-d willing!!). The main risk/challenge at this point is simply that the project - and the release - get slowed down and pushed back further due to normal kinds of scheduling challenges. A million factors limit how much time we can book at Audio Warrior Productions studio each week where we are recording and working on the album with our sound engineer, Anthony Beck. Because making an album of this kind is such an intensive and time-consuming process, and because everyone involved is busy hustling to survive (#capitalism), it has been difficult to meet our intended deadlines for each stage of the process, but we keep pushing forward and adjusting as needed.
We have already had to push back the expected release from October to November - and we are prepared to push it back further than that if necessary, but we will not sacrifice the quality of the music for an earlier release date! In the long run, the release date is not what matters - what matters is the music on the record, that we hope will last forever. So we want to do it right.
Other than that, and barring emergencies, there are really no significant risks or obstacles at this point!

 
Other Ways You Can Help
Of course every dollar counts, and we are so grateful for donations of any amount! But we also understand that sometimes, you just aren't in a position to give. If that's the case for you, and you still want to support, there are many other ways to help out in lieu of (or in addition to!) donating:


Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign! (You can use the Indiegogo share tools, post/email/call/text your friends about it, and even - what a concept - tell people about it in REAL LIFE!)

Turn people on to our music who haven't heard us yet, and share our FB page where they will learn about this campaign and other OneLove goings-on.

Put us in touch with people who you think would be interested in helping out or covering our story.

Offer us another service such as photography, videography, social media assistance, etc!

 
And, if we don't reach our full goal...​
We will prioritize all of the resources we get toward the most concrete outstanding costs of completing the album (recording, mixing, and mastering), and continue to hustle in order to pay the rest of the costs out of pocket. The process may be slowed down, but we will be able to complete the album regardless. We are consciously NOT choosing to run this campaign as an "all-or-nothing" fundraiser. We are grateful for every dollar donated. 
 

❤️ THANK YOU!!! ❤️
Adam Gottlieb & OneLove (2018). From left to right: Diana Zwinak (Manager), Jed Lickerman (Lead Guitar), Tony Mest (Drums), Noah Silver-Mathews (Bass), Adam Gottlieb (Guitar, Lead Vocals), Amanda Suckow (Violin, Mandolin, Vocals)

story:
Juli Keown Music

Fireweed Impressions is my debut album.

I’m a singer-songwriter from Southeast Alaska and my grandparents are my biggest inspiration. They formed several bands, throughout my childhood, playing around southeast Alaska and Sweden.

I spent 6 years living in Austin, TX, playing live shows, tuning into my voice, style and befriending some extraordinary musicians. There have been years of preparing to record this album. The only thing needed now are the funds. That’s where you and this campaign come in to play.

The Dollar Bills

I spend my summers working in my home town, Hoonah, Alaska. My mother owns a northwest coast art gallery and is an artist herself. I make jewelry and help her with the store as well as her natural Alaskan botanicals line, Tlingit Botanicals. 

I have saved enough to front the smaller expenses (travel, housing, rehearsal space, gear, etc.) myself but I still need help raising money for the actual studio time and paying friends, artist, and musicians who contribute their time. 

I'm asking for $9250. The funds I am able to raise dictate the amount of time I can spend in the studio and the number of musicians that will be involve in creating Fireweed Impressions as well as the amount of soul there will be room for on the album. 

I could easily put $9250 to good use, so dream big with me and let's see what happens. 

Designed by Yours Truly

I have started my design work, getting inspired by the Fireweed Impressions album concept. As a backer you can contribute however much you would like. There is also the option to choose a perk package. I will be designing all kinds of fun merch for you!

Perk Items Include:

-Pre-Release Album Downloads and Signed Physical Copies

-Limited Edition Posters

-Fireweed Impressions Album T-shirts and Totes

-Stickers, Buttons, Patches

-Limited Edition Lyric and Artwork Book

-Cover Songs Chosen by YOU

-Intimate House Concerts

You can checkout my design work on my social media pages @juleskeown

Risks & Challenges

Last spring, I successfully booked and executed a solo tour. It was a lot of hard work and though it still fell short of what my dreams could see, it was exactly what need to be. I ended up driving from Portland Oregon, down to Austin, Tx, up to Boston and then all the back around. I booked dozens of shows and by the end of my journey I had driven 16,000 miles and played 42 venues. 

I am only human, and all humans face setbacks. I can assure you, for this album, I am prepared. If anything were to come up, you would be the first to know as my backers.

I've been making music and art as a lifestyle for 10 years and I am not planning on stopping anytime soon. Join me on this musical, cultural adventure, its been a great ride so far.

Share, Share, Share

PEASE share, share, share. It goes a long ways to share on social media and by mouth. Follow my pages and pass around this Indiegogo Campaign (Indiegogo has convenient share tools right at the top of this page!) Help me make some noise! 

I'll love you forever,

Jules Keown

story:
New Moon Rising

Hello and Welcome to My Fundraiser Page in Support of My First Full Length Album!

 

About:

My name is Jordy Vaughn and I am a musician based out of Minneapolis, MN. I grew up performing in musical theatre but it wasn't until later in life that I discovered my authentic voice and sound through songwriting.  In November of 2019, I released my debut EP, Bloom. Bloom was a way for me to find healing through song. My latest project, New Moon Rising, is a continuation of that process which echoes the sentiments of growth through expressing unconditional love for self and other. 

You are invited to be a part of the creation of New Moon Rising through your financial support!

During the extremely difficult time that our world is facing, music and art are vital to our ability to connect with one another, despite being apart. Music is the medicine! Your support for this project means the world to me. It's about much more than the opportunity to record my songs (although I am excited and grateful for this too). At the heart of this campaign is the desire to provide creative job opportunities to the musicians and artists who are collaborating on it. Additionally it's about the desire to give the gift of music to our listeners.

What I Need:

  • Production:                                                                            $900
  • Musician's Fee (full band):                                                $900     
  • Mixing & Mastering:                                                            $550
  • Promotional Materials:                                                      $500
    • Marketing, Photos, Videos

                                                                    Goal Total:    $2,650 

Perks of Supporting:

As a thank you for your donation, I am offering the following perks:

  • Digital Download 
  • Homemade Chocolate-chip Cookies
  • Homemade Poetry Cards
  • Songwriting Lesson
  • DIY Cover Song of Your Choice
  • Private 45 Min Yoga Session 
  • Private Livestream Acoustic Performance 

 

Risks & Challenges:

If I am unable to raise all of the funds necessary to create a full length album, I will most likely cut a few songs out and release a shorter version of the project. 

If I raise more money than necessary I will donate the extra funds to another artist in need. 

 

Other Ways to Help: 

Donations of any amount are welcome. If you would like to donate an amount other than requested for a perk, do so by clicking the "BACK IT" button. 

If you are unable to make a financial contribution at this time but still want to help, please share this campaign with friends/family and on your social media channels. You can also like and follow @jordy_vaughn on Instagram and @JordyVaughn on Facebook!

story:
THE PROJECT

Our goal with this album is to bring to light, and continue discussing, many of the different social, political, and economic issues inciting chaos and violence around the world today. The album will also explore how the COVID-19 pandemic has exponentially exacerbated these issues.

We are excited to be collaborating with PARMA Recordings and the Janáček Philharmonic Orchestra to create an album that will feature the masterful and diverse talents of its extraordinary guest artists and orchestra, culminating in the digital premiere of composer Josh Trentadue's ambitious first symphony! Recording will tentatively be taking place during the summer of 2021 in the Czech Republic; the postproduction required following these sessions will culminate in a tentative album release date for sometime in 2022.*

You will experience a wide and eclectic variety of music in this album - from contemporary orchestral and electronic elements (harkening back to the greater traditions of epic film music), to progressive post-bop jazz (featuring extravagant improvisations from its six-player combo), to contemporary flute music (challenging the instrument’s technical, lyrical, and idiomatic capabilities, brilliantly performed by our solo flutist), to therapeutic and spiritual, meditative healing that will soothe and calm the soul. There is something to be found at all corners of this album that everyone can enjoy.

We hope that you will take a moment to donate to this important cause. Your support of this campaign will tremendously help with the expenses required to produce this album, create this music in a live performance setting, and bring this important and necessary art to life during a critically turbulent moment for the greater fine arts community. As we continue to circumvent this pandemic, the fight for systemic change, justice, equality, and peace must continue. With this album, we continue to advocate for these things through this diverse and artistic platform, bridging traditional and contemporary music together with experimental and immersive experiences that can be enjoyed by all audiences for generations to come.

LEARN MORE: www.motifsymphonyone.com

*All dates are tentative due to circumstances regarding the COVID-19 pandemic.
 

THE EXPENSES

Your contributions will cover the following expenses needed for the creation of this album:

  • PARMA: Recording Production Fees (studio/hall costs, recording, audio production team, audio editing/mixing/post-production/mastering)
  • Janáček Philharmonic Orchestra: Musician Fees
  • Travel + Lodging Expenses (7 Guest Artists, Composer)
  • PARMA: Album Production Fees (artwork/design/manufacturing/publicity/distribution)
  • IndieGoGo Platform Fees
  • Additional Emergency Expenses
  • TOTAL ESTIMATED COST: $150,000

Our goal with this crowdfunding campaign is to raise $100,000 of the total cost to help cover these expenses. In addition, our team is actively applying for and accessing additional funding resources to cover all other additional expenses required for this project. All funds raised in this crowdfunding campaign will go towards these expenses, regardless of whether or not this campaign meets its goal.

Click on the perks on the right-hand side to see what you can earn with your contribution!
 

THE ALBUM

"Symphony No. 1" - Music by Josh Trentadue
Additional Jazz Music by Dr. Emily Dierickx, Dr. Jordan VanHemert, Lillie Christie, Kevin Day, Amanda Ruzza, and Kevin Keith

Producers: Josh Trentadue and Jordan VanHemert
Record Label: PARMA Recordings
Recording Personnel: PARMA Recordings, Janáček Philharmonic Orchestra

GUEST ARTIST PERSONNEL
Jazz Combo: Dr. Emily Dierickx (flute), Dr. Jordan VanHemert (tenor saxophone), Lillie Christie (trumpet/flugelhorn), Kevin Day (piano), Amanda Ruzza (bass guitar), Kevin Keith (drums)
Solo Flutist/Sound Healer: Amy Rosendall

Album Production: PARMA Recordings
Recording Date [tentative]: Summer 2021
Album Release Date [tentative]: 2022

PROPOSED TRACK LIST

SYMPHONY NO. 1 (Josh Trentadue)

I. PROLOGUE

  1. The Orchestra
  2. The Soloist
  3. The Combo

II. ALLEGRO

  1. Introduction
  2. These Fierce Machines (Amanda Ruzza)
  3. Anxiety’s Toll (Emily Dierickx)
  4. It Could Be Me (Kevin Day)
  5. Unbalanced

III. ADAGIO (feat. Amy Rosendall, solo flute)

  1. Introduction
  2. Ruminations
  3. Nightmares
  4. Elegy
  5. Discovery

IV. SCHERZO

  1. Introduction
  2. Brash Sexism (Lillie Christie)
  3. Fight The Virus, Not The People (Jordan VanHemert)
  4. Chauvinist Freedoms (Kevin Keith)
  5. The Final Spark

V. FINALE

  1. Balance (feat. Amy Rosendall, singing bowls)
  2. Farewell
  3. Epilogue
     

    THE RISKS & CHALLENGES

    All of us involved in this recording project brings to the table years of professional performance (in both solo and ensemble/group settings), production, and recording experience. We continue to remain active in our individual musical endeavors as much as possible in an increasingly persistent, ever-changing climate. This album represents the first phase of our collective collaboration, in which all of us combines our efforts and passion together to bring to life art that will not only challenge every single one of our beliefs, but also continue important conversations that must continue to be discussed in our greater community. In addition to this recording project, the composer and guest artists are working together to create a version of this symphony for wind ensemble, commissioned by Jeff Herwig and the Three Rivers Wind Symphony as part of a consortium. The world premiere of this version is scheduled to occur on December 9, 2021.

    With that being said, the greatest risk to this recording project is the threat of the COVID-19 pandemic. All of us are coming together from various locations in the United States to record this album in the Czech Republic. We do not know what the global, social, and economic climate will look like by the time recording is scheduled to take place. Please know that we are all taking every single precaution possible throughout every single aspect of the completion of this recording project in order to avoid even the slightest risk of COVID-19.

    We have the tools, focus, caliber, and attention to detail to create the professionally recorded, high quality music required for this album, this symphony, and its overall concepts. Our collaboration with PARMA Recordings and the Janáček Philharmonic Orchestra will continue to ensure the highest standards of excellence, artistry, musicianship, and craft required for this recording project and this symphony.
     

    OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

    If you are unable to donate to our campaign at this time, please share our project with as many people as you can! This will greatly help our team as we continue to secure the funding required to make this album possible. Any support you are able to provide at this time is greatly appreciated.

    www.motifsymphonyone.com
    @motifsymphony1 (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, SoundCloud)

    Josh Trentadue, "Symphony No. 1"
    © 2020-2021 M.O.T.I.F. (ASCAP)
    www.joshtrentadue.com - All Rights Reserved.


     

    DEMOS

    Here are two demos (programmed by composer Josh Trentadue) featuring excerpts of this upcoming symphony:
story_txt:
THE PROJECT
Our goal with this album is to bring to light, and continue discussing, many of the different social, political, and economic issues inciting chaos and violence around the world today. The album will also explore how the COVID-19 pandemic has exponentially exacerbated these issues.
We are excited to be collaborating with PARMA Recordings and the Janáček Philharmonic Orchestra to create an album that will feature the masterful and diverse talents of its extraordinary guest artists and orchestra, culminating in the digital premiere of composer Josh Trentadue's ambitious first symphony! Recording will tentatively be taking place during the summer of 2021 in the Czech Republic; the postproduction required following these sessions will culminate in a tentative album release date for sometime in 2022.*
You will experience a wide and eclectic variety of music in this album - from contemporary orchestral and electronic elements (harkening back to the greater traditions of epic film music), to progressive post-bop jazz (featuring extravagant improvisations from its six-player combo), to contemporary flute music (challenging the instrument’s technical, lyrical, and idiomatic capabilities, brilliantly performed by our solo flutist), to therapeutic and spiritual, meditative healing that will soothe and calm the soul. There is something to be found at all corners of this album that everyone can enjoy.
We hope that you will take a moment to donate to this important cause. Your support of this campaign will tremendously help with the expenses required to produce this album, create this music in a live performance setting, and bring this important and necessary art to life during a critically turbulent moment for the greater fine arts community. As we continue to circumvent this pandemic, the fight for systemic change, justice, equality, and peace must continue. With this album, we continue to advocate for these things through this diverse and artistic platform, bridging traditional and contemporary music together with experimental and immersive experiences that can be enjoyed by all audiences for generations to come.LEARN MORE: www.motifsymphonyone.com
*All dates are tentative due to circumstances regarding the COVID-19 pandemic. 

THE EXPENSES
Your contributions will cover the following expenses needed for the creation of this album:

PARMA: Recording Production Fees (studio/hall costs, recording, audio production team, audio editing/mixing/post-production/mastering)
Janáček Philharmonic Orchestra: Musician Fees
Travel + Lodging Expenses (7 Guest Artists, Composer)
PARMA: Album Production Fees (artwork/design/manufacturing/publicity/distribution)
IndieGoGo Platform Fees
Additional Emergency Expenses
TOTAL ESTIMATED COST: $150,000

Our goal with this crowdfunding campaign is to raise $100,000 of the total cost to help cover these expenses. In addition, our team is actively applying for and accessing additional funding resources to cover all other additional expenses required for this project. All funds raised in this crowdfunding campaign will go towards these expenses, regardless of whether or not this campaign meets its goal.
Click on the perks on the right-hand side to see what you can earn with your contribution! 

THE ALBUM
"Symphony No. 1" - Music by Josh TrentadueAdditional Jazz Music by Dr. Emily Dierickx, Dr. Jordan VanHemert, Lillie Christie, Kevin Day, Amanda Ruzza, and Kevin Keith
Producers: Josh Trentadue and Jordan VanHemertRecord Label: PARMA RecordingsRecording Personnel: PARMA Recordings, Janáček Philharmonic Orchestra
GUEST ARTIST PERSONNELJazz Combo: Dr. Emily Dierickx (flute), Dr. Jordan VanHemert (tenor saxophone), Lillie Christie (trumpet/flugelhorn), Kevin Day (piano), Amanda Ruzza (bass guitar), Kevin Keith (drums)Solo Flutist/Sound Healer: Amy Rosendall

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Hey all!

My name is Maya Wagner and I am a musical artist getting ready to release a new EP for pride month (June 2021). The EP tells the story of my experience getting into a relationship doomed by society's stigmas and prejudice against the LGBTQ community. The story is one of tragedy, but of course, it is of empowerment and hope as well. 

Marketing is Hard

With online distribution and social media, anyone can make music out into the world. However, with so many marketing resources, it can become overwhelming to do it all on your own. My producer HILLOC and I thought it would be a great idea hire music marketing specialists to help get my kick-ass music out into the world. I have a message that I want to be heard, but I can't make it heard all on my own. 

The funds raised in this campaign will be put directly towards marketing my EP. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to donate:

  • I know how it feels to be broke, I am literally raising money right now...
  • Follow me on social media:
    • Insta
    • Facebook
    • TikTok
    • YouTube
  • You can totally share this with your friends and family, or post about it on social media!
  • Stream the EP when it comes out in June!!!

story:
Псой Короленко, куплетист, "молодежный филолог и акын", скоморох, "аванбард" и “бродячий ученый”, номинант Grammy и Минуты Славы, автор песен про Буратино, Чудовище и Остров Где Все Есть, записывает новый альбом - “Хроники Аналоговой Жизни”.  

Любишь Псоя? Поддержи “ХРОНИКИ АНАЛОГОВОЙ ЖИЗНИ”! 

Впервые прозвучат по-русски песни одного из самых удивительных французских поэтов-шансонье - Ги Беара.  

Любишь французский шансон? Поддержи “ХРОНИКИ АНАЛОГОВОЙ ЖИЗНИ”!

Но Псой тут не один. Нас целая команда - или, как теперь говорят, “тим”. JetLAG Music Productions объединяет артистов всех жанров и стилей в уникальных творческих экспериментах. 

Любишь JetЛАГ? Поддержи “ХРОНИКИ АНАЛОГОВОЙ ЖИЗНИ”! 

В 2019 году мы с вашей помощью выпустили альбом песен Ольги Чикиной “Всё не так, как кажется” с её чудесными рисунками. Олю вы встретите и на новом альбоме, как соавтора переводов, исполнителя некоторых песен и, конечно, художника-иллюстратора. 

Любишь Олю Чикину? Поддержи “ХРОНИКИ АНАЛОГОВОЙ ЖИЗНИ”! 

Музыкальным продюсером альбома будет, как и в тот раз, Федор Чистяков, основатель группы “Ноль”, легенда русского рок-н-ролла. В его лихих, забойных, и в то же время замысловатых, мастерских аранжировках французский шансон и Псой Короленко зазвучат совсем по-новому. 

Любишь Федора Чистякова? Поддержи “ХРОНИКИ АНАЛОГОВОЙ ЖИЗНИ”! 

Кто-то помнит советскую грампластинку “Поет Ги Беар” 1972 года, включавшую песню "Эх, дороги" на русском языке. Большинство песен Ги Беара  написаны в 60-70-х, они передают  уникальный дух того времени. Отсюда название. 

Любишь тёплый ламповый бред? Поддержи “ХРОНИКИ АНАЛОГОВОЙ ЖИЗНИ”! 

Мы думали посвятить альбом сравнению былой аналоговой эпохи с цифровой. Но пока мы думали, настала иная, вообще непонятно какая, эпоха. А эти песни, уже родные для нас - о том, что важно в любые времена и делает нас живыми. Это дружба, любовь, надежда, мир, вера.  

Хочешь такие песни? Поддержи “ХРОНИКИ АНАЛОГОВОЙ ЖИЗНИ”! 

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Как поддержать:

Зарегистрируйся на Indigogo.  Выбери свой PERK (приз, лот, вознаграждение) или поддержи нас безвозмездно (без призов) на любую сумму, нажав на кнопку BACK IT (т.е. "поддержать"), расположенную под названием кампании и информации об организаторе, справа от ролика. 

Как оплатить в рублях или другой валюте:

Если ты в России, принимаются карты VISA и Mastercard. В случае трудностей сразу свяжись с нами по адресу  info@jetlagmusicproductions.com

Выбрать лот и кликнуть на него. Появится надпись Get this perk. Нажми на нее.  Внимание! Значок доллара в окошке вовсе не означает, что требуются именно доллары. Можно рубли, евро, шекели и любые деньги, к которым вы привыкли.

2. Заполнить имя, email адрес, почтовый адрес, номер карточки и нажать на кнопку submit payment

 

ОПЦИЯ – ВНЕСТИ ЛЮБУЮ СУММУ

Нажать на кнопку BACK IT

2. Внести сумму и нажать на кнопку continue. Внимание! Значок доллара в окошке вовсе не означает, что требуются именно доллары. Можно рубли, евро, шекели и любые деньги, к которым вы привыкли.

3. Внести данные карточки.

4. Нажать на кнопку Submit payment

Ещё вопросы? Смотри F.A.Q.

Как ещё  помочь?  

Мы живем в цифровую эпоху, информация - ценная валюта. Подпишись на нас в FB и VK. Делись новостями о "Хрониках Аналоговой Жизни" с помощью наших кнопок и значков, следи за нами на  соцсетях, ставь лайки, ссылайся везде и всюду на нашу страницу, шли ссылки друзьям. Тем более, что в нашей кампании будет чем удивить: специальные подкасты, Олины рисунки, а также, как всегда, фирменные псоевские ''онегинки''.

Мы сделаем это вместе! 

Добро пожаловать в наш дружный “тим”! 

Да здравствуют “ХРОНИКИ АНАЛОГОВОЙ ЖИЗНИ”!

3. Внести данные карточки.
4. Нажать на кнопку Submit payment
Ещё вопросы? Смотри F.A.Q.
Как ещё  помочь?  
Мы живем в цифровую эпоху, информация - ценная валюта. Подпишись на нас в FB и VK. Делись новостями о "Хрониках Аналоговой Жизни" с помощью наших кнопок и значков, следи за нами на  соцсетях, ставь лайки, ссылайся везде и всюду на нашу страницу, шли ссылки друзьям. Тем более, что в нашей кампании будет чем удивить: специальные подкасты, Олины рисунки, а также, как всегда, фирменные псоевские ''онегинки''.
Мы сделаем это вместе! 
Добро пожаловать в наш дружный “тим”! 
Да здравствуют “ХРОНИКИ АНАЛОГОВОЙ ЖИЗНИ”!

story:
Short Summary

New Ceremony are;

Drums:                                                              Níall Curran
Bass/Synth:                                                    Sean Connolly-Bracken
Guitar/Bass/Lyrics:                                      Stephen Kearney
Vocals/Lyrics/Harmonica/Synth:            Conor Geoghegan
 

 

New Ceremony compose music and songs initially through improvisation and experimentation. There is a particular focus on establishing atmosphere and character within our pieces as we move through the musical process. The songs are then more finely crafted, distilling the initial idea down until we arrive at the essence of the song.

We are four Galwegians who have been jamming for the last three years. Our songs have been fermenting like a bag of forgotten satsumas left under the sink. Starved of an outlet, ie. no one to tell us to stop, we wrote a boat load of tunes. Most are not for human consumption, but others we think are ready to be digested. These are the songs we’re hoping to record and set free in July.

We want to shake you up and rattle you down. Share our love of the music and the passion we have for making it, even if that means wrecking your head.

Our music stylings are a blend of post-punk, indie rock, synth pop, hip-hop and dance music with a strong visual theatrical element. Our influences include (but are not limited to); Joy Division, Can, Rage Against the Machine, Wire, The Fall and Tom Waits.

 

What your funding will give us

  • Funds to record our first LP in Nuns Island Theatre with producer Kyle Dee of Croghery Studios. 
  • Cover costs for mixing and mastering of the album tracks.
  • Design and manufacturing of album art.
  • Funding costs of documentation of the process including filming and photography. 

 

The beautiful Nuns Island Theatre, Galway, where we will be recording in July.
 



Testimonials

"New Ceremony are a band in transformation, developing a unique sound that blends elements of post punk and alt pop, but with a poetry and swagger. Lead singer Conor is a dynamic spirit who commits to the delivery of each song, shapeshifting and weaving stories. Looking forward to seeing where this goes"
                                                                                             -Patrick Hallinan (John of the Apocalypse)

"A unique and compelling proposition, New Ceremony have all the ingredients to become one of Galway's most exciting bands in the near future"

                                                                                            -David Boland, booker for Eclectics

"New Ceremony , Galway band with new sounds to offer,  deliver something distinctly different . They offer real alternative rock with  a taste of the theatre, boldly bringing improv into live performance's, and doing it right . When the gigs are back , check out New Ceremony, they are one to see . ."                                                                                                   
                                                                                           -Jonathan Coffey (Step3Prophet)

"Sounds like ‘a primal scream from the heart of Galway’'  
                                                                                           
                                                                                            -Gary Landers, (Archmotors)

story:
ENSEMBLE ULTREIA
BEYOND THE STAGE
EIN DOKUMENTARFILM

Wir gründen ein Ensemble - wer kommt mit? Unser Gründungsjahr wird mit der Kamera begleitet. Aus den Filmen entsteht eine Dokumentation. Jeder ist eingeladen unseren Weg rund um die Bühne zu begleiten!

 

ENSEMBLE ULTREIA

Das Kammermusik-Kollektiv steht für die kreative Gestaltung der Zukunft der klassischen und aktuellen Musik. 2021 rund um die Hornistin Melissa Danas und die Trompeterin Damaris Richerts gegründet, stammt das Kernteam aus Europa sowie den USA und spiegelt mit der Mehrheit an Frauen die Diversität einer neuen Generation an ProfimusikerInnen in Österreich wider.

#gobeyond #ensembleultreia

 

EINE DOKUMENTATION ÜBER UNSER GRÜNDUNGSJAHR

Wir haben viel vor! Neben einer eigenen Konzertreihe im MuTh in Wien kommt die ein oder andere Kaffeehaustour #Heimspiel in diversen Grätzel und noch vieles mehr auf uns zu - und immer dabei: Fabian Chaundy mit seiner Kamera. Er begleitet uns und gibt damit einen Blick für jedeN frei: auf alle Höhen und Superla-Tiefen hinter, vor, auf und um der Bühne - auf alles, was so ein Gründungsjahr mit sich bringt.

 

WIR GEHEN NEUE WEGE

...und das machen wir tatsächlich. Wir denken das Konzert neu! Das beginnt schon bei der gemeinsame Entwickelung von neuen Konzertformaten. Die Kombination von verschiedenen Kunstformen mit Musik macht neues Erleben möglich. Zwei Frauen im Leitungsteam, mehrheitlich Frauen im Ensemble - Wo gibt's denn sowas?

 

EIN BLICK IN DIE ZUKUNFT KOSTET

Stars werden nicht geboren - sie arbeiten. Aber was eigentlich? Ja, MusikerIn ist ein Beruf. Ein ziemlich toller sogar. Mit Zukunft. Wir finanzieren mit dieser Crowdfunding Kampagne eine Dokumentation unserer Arbeit im Gründungsjahr des Ensembles und geben den Blick frei auf die Zukunft unseres Berufs: Unternehmerisch tätige MusikerInnen.

 

Vielen Dank für deinen Beitrag zur Verwirklichung der Dokumentation & Herzlich willkommen im Club der Unterstützerinnen und Unterstützer von Ensemble Ultreia!

story:
Who are we, and what do we bring to the table?

  • Rändi Fay (lyricist and vocalist) is a former veterinarian who began her professional songwriting and performing career at age 50, her strongest musical influences being jazz, 60’s & 70’s classic hits, music theater and classical music.
  • Aaron Zinsmeister (composer, producer, synths & orchestration) has a degree in music and recording technology, and has played in bands since his teens with influences from symphonic metal to video game soundtracks to classical orchestration.
  • From this award winning, dynamic pair a dramatic new genre has emerged that blends the best of their creativity: symphonic electronica.

 

"The lead single from her upcoming album Intuition, 'Lone Wolf' is symphonic and haunting, conjuring the electricity of new romance while tackling the fear of vulnerability and the challenge of building trust as the relationship shifts from infatuation to love."​ 

-Music Update Central, 9.30.19

 

Why is this exciting?  The drama, shifts and textures of symphonic electronica cross the boundaries of generations and genre, exploring human emotion with no holds barred. Rändi’s poetic lyrics play, dig and bite, supported by Aaron’s expressive melodies, complex harmonies and rich orchestrations. Popular music does not need to be cookie cutter, and these songs break the mold!

 

Why is this project important? People have become disconnected. Media and technology send confusing, alienating and often de-humanizing messages to all of us. In response we become numb, isolating ourselves from experiencing insecurity and fear, but from each other as well.  The songs of “Intuition” explore facing this fear of connection, exposing who we are at our core, learning to trust ourselves to have the courage to to feel afraid, to be empowered, to take a chance and to love. This message, communicated in vivid, colorful textures and sounds, is what makes "Intuition" an important and timely album.

 

“There is a market for sensuality emboldened in such a veiled classy way, there are so many audiences of women who are going to feel validated, and I really love that. “​   -Laura Anne Henderson, professional photographer & fan

 

What's with the Firefly? A firefly is an almost mythical creature, a blend of poetry, science, mystery and instinct. But fireflies are in danger, as light pollution threatens their ability to communicate- the "noise" of the night sky is affecting their ability to find their mate. What a perfect metaphor for “Intuition.” If we can’t find our own light through all of the noise, how can shine and find others? Finding ourselves is key to finding love…

 

Where are we in the project?

As of October 1, lead single & music video "Lone Wolf" have been released:

 

 

The first taste of “Intuition” is live for you to sample and enjoy! Along with “Lone Wolf,” eight songs of our project are finished, with the remaining three well into production,. Here is a timeline for completion:

  • October and November: complete production of final 3 songs, T-shirts, sweatshirts & necklaces ordered- hoping for possible Christmas delivery!
  • November 26: Release “My Grown Up Christmas List” (this track is finished),
  • December: Another music video shoot in the “dream works,” work on lyric videos, finish album jacket art, wrap up details on the 11 songs, fingers crossed delivery of initial perks!
  • January: CD’s pressed, two single releases scheduled 1.11.20 & 1.31.20
  • February: Deliver CD's and downloads!
  • February 20: Release CD "Intuition!" 

 

Where is financial support needed? The money we raise will be put toward production of the last three songs (each song averaging over 50 hours of writing and studio time!), 3-4 simple lyric videos, final design and manufacture of CD's, manufacture of merchandise and administrative costs of the campaign. We have a stretch goal of $15,000 which would allow for 2 additional high-quality music videos, bringing you more video installments of the captivating story of "Intuition" that began with "Lone Wolf." 

 

What do you get? First and foremost, you get the music, downloads and CD's! And you get to join us in celebrating the excitement of being a huge part of creating completely new- so new we can't find an accurate "sounds like" out there! Also, EVERY BACKER will receive a download of "My Grown Up Christmas List" before it's release! 

We have created a variety of levels of support, add-ons and perks, appreciating that every potential backer is different and we value you equally! Those of you who are new are also potential fans, and we honestly couldn't do any of this without fans! So yes, there is "MERCH” too! Wear it proud!

For those into merch or value-added experiences, check out these extra perks:

  • cool heathered black t-shirts for the entire family- additional t-shirts can be purchased at checkout!
  • the exclusively designed firefly necklace commissioned by Rändi for the "Lone Wolf" video
  • one-on-ones with Rändi over the internet for songwriting or vocal coaching
  • the exclusive opportunity to write and record with Rändi and Aaron- most of this can be done over the internet, so no worries where you are!
  • the exclusive opportunity to executive produce a music video, be present on the set if mutual scheduling allows!
  • for "comfy-lovers," sweatshirts are available at checkout
  • also at checkout is the opportunity to purchase Rändi's catalog of Christmas songs

 

For those more purely patronage driven, check out our "Associate Producer" and "Executive Producer" packages. And with Indiegogo, you can always give at any level if you prefer making a simple donation!

The opportunity to be a part of the birth of "Intuition" is for the adventuresome music lover to support our heartfelt efforts in this powerful, innovative, carefully crafted concept album and the music videos that help bring the songs to life. Appreciation of the arts brings a much needed softness to our world , making us all a little kinder. Thank you so very much!

 

Giving Credit: We are proud to have assembled this team of creative professionals and are grateful for the gifts they bring to the artistic vision of "Intuition:" 

  • Video Production & Direction, Indiegogo Promo & Lone Wolf: Jocelyne Berumen, CyclopsGirl.com
  • Talent, “Lone Wolf”: Troy Therrien
  • Assistant Director/Set Photographer: Megan Johnson
  • Cinematographer: Nate Haben
  • Drone Operator: Rachael Dowling, Photo2Drone.com
  • Set Photographer/Grip/Production Assistant:  Laura Anne Henderson,
  • Grip/Production Assistant: Priscilla Brock
  • Talent Makeup Artist and Hair Stylist: Sara Miller
  • Hair Colorist: Bri Schramm
  • Graphic Design: Katrin Schroeder, k-schroeder.com
  • Campaign Consultant : Nancy Solhaug
  • Location: Garden Gables of Door County- Kayla and James Larsen 
  • Location: The Strom Family 
  • Location: The Gallagher Family

 

Risks & Challenges: We are committed to completing this project. If funding is less than hoped for, the biggest risk would be delaying our release date. Barring personal tragedy, this project will be finished and the products you choose will be delivered to you.

 

Other Ways You Can Help: There are so many ways to be a part of "Intuition." If you aren't able to contribute financially at this time, perhaps you know someone who is? Please be our ambassador! Share our campaign far and wide, using the Indiegogo SHARE tools to the right of the campaign video by the top of the page! Social media, email and WORD OF MOUTH are fantastic forums to get the word out! And don’t forget to follow @RändiFayMusic on social outlets and streaming services! Shares, likes, saves, playlists and comments mean the world to us!

All our love and gratitude! 

Rändi & Aaron

story:
UPDATE

 

We have been overwhelmed by the generosity and support of our community since our campaign launched on Monday. Our initial goal was almost met within the first 24 hours! A heartfelt thank  you to everyone who has contributed towards our debut album - we really can't wait to share it with you in June. 

AND it's not too late to support this project!

Any additional funds above our initial goal will go towards our stretch goal of an additional $4000 to fund an exciting music video we'll be producing later this spring featuring one of the pieces on the album, Matin, by the  French composer Mel Bonis. For this project, we'll be working with the inspiring director Jon Levin (who you can find out more about here: https://www.jon-levin.com) and a team of wonderful collaborators. We can't wait to see what this collaboration produces, and we hope that the video will be an eloquent companion to the album. 

We're deeply grateful for any support you might be able to give in helping us bring this video, or our album, to life! 

 

Short Summary

 

INK

 

Merz Trio's Debut Album

INK is a conversation between music and words. It’s also a story about artists responding to the world around them during a year of immense change and loss: 1914. 

The album began very simply: we sat down to play Ravel Trio and wondered, what was Paris, 1914 like? Who were some of the other voices in the air, on the streets? How do they speak to one another? Do they help us to listen differently, open up other spaces in this music for us?

INK is a glimpse into what we found, who we heard. We’ve made arrangements for piano trio of pieces by Lili Boulanger, Nadia Boulanger, Debussy, even a Vincent Scotto song made famous by Josephine Baker; we’re playing a movement of Mel Bonis’ trio as well. You’ll also hear the familiar movements of Ravel Trio scattered throughout. And we’ve brought all this music into conversation with some of the poetry and prose of 1914 that we love best, spoken aloud by us.

We ask you to consider being a part of the life of this album through your support and contribution.

100% of your contributions will go towards INK's recording, editing, distribution, design, and publicity costs.

We so appreciate your support in whatever way you are able. 

With our warm thanks,

Julia, Lee and Brigid

The Merz Trio

 

Who We Are

From left: Brigid Coleridge, violinist; Julia Yang, cellist; Lee Dionne, pianist

 

Merz Trio, winner of 2019 Concert Artists Guild and Fischoff Competitions, has been lauded for its "stunning virtuosity and ensemble work" and "fresh and surprising interpretations" (Reading Eagle). Composed of pianist Lee Dionne, violinist Brigid Coleridge, and cellist Julia Yang, the Trio is named for the early 20th-century "Merz" style of polymathic artist Kurt Schwitters.

Taking inspiration from Schwitter's work, the Trio is known for bringing music into performative dialogue with other art forms, including literature, dance, theater, and puppetry. Current projects include "Those Secret Eyes," a dramatic portrayal of Lady Macbeth through music, spoken text, and dance, as well as a live concert version of their debut album, "INK" featuring the Ravel Piano Trio interspersed with the sounds of the era in which it was written: spoken text and works of women composers from the 1910s.

Equally at home with both the standard trio repertoire and the music of our time, Merz Trio reaches across genres and time periods through new arrangements of works for piano trio. In doing so, the Trio makes unusual connections and tells new stories within and outside of the art music repertoire that speak to a contemporary, progressive vision of society.

Within the 21-22 season, Merz Trio's upcoming performances include their debut at the Concertgebouw in Amsterdam, New York recitals at the Schneider Series and Merkin Hall, and an appearance at the Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum in Boston. Merz Trio is currently the Professional Trio in Residence at the New England Conservatory (2017-2020).

 

The Process 

The process of creating INK has been intensely collaborative, beginning within the Trio, in conceiving of this program and creating these new arrangements.

We’ve been thrilled to have talented and invaluable partners outside of the Trio as well, in each step of this expensive and lengthy process of creating an album. 

From conception to release, expenses from recording, editing, distribution, design, and publicity will add up to $16,000.  We need to raise $10,000 to make this project come to life, and thanks to the generosity of a number of Merz Trio supporters, we've been able to raise the first $5,000! 

Through Indiegogo, we are looking to raise a final $5000 to bring this album to release in June 2021. 

100% of your contributions will go towards INK's recording, editing, distribution, design, and publicity costs.

 

Recording

Who: Ryan Streber, Recording and Mastering Engineer

Where: Oktaven Audio 

Podding up and renting an airbnb in the Bronx, we recorded this album over 3 days in Oktaven Audio, in Mt. Vernon, NY in October, 2020. We've worked with Ryan, an award-winning producer and engineer, for numerous recording projects in the past. His sharp ears, natural musicianship, and tireless encouragement and energy made him an incredible partner for our album recording. 

 

Label

INK will be released on the Grammy nominated, award winning label Bright Shiny Things.  We’re thrilled to work with Louis Levitt, CEO, who, along with the BST team, will oversee the album’s production, design, distribution, and publicity. 

 

The Album

Revolving around Paris in the 1910s, INK features 7 composers and 8 authors, 4 original Merz Trio arrangements and 1 newly composed work by Merz pianist Lee Dionne.

Movements of Ravel's 1914 Piano Trio are heard at play with the sounds of fellow Parisian composers and counterparts, Mel Bonis, Lili and Nadia Boulanger, and Claude Debussy. The album opens with a transcription of Josephine Baker's performance of a song by Vincent Scotto, a composer whose records Ravel owned in his collection. Woven throughout in conversation with the music are fragments of poetry and prose of the era, spoken aloud by the musicians. The album also features a new Ravel-inspired composition by Lee Dionne.

 

Program

1. "An account of Charles' Peguy's last day in Paris" (reading)

2. "Sous les ponts de Paris" (Under the bridges of Paris), by Josephine Baker/Vincent Scotto arranged by Merz Trio

3. "Summer evening," by Anna de Noailles (reading)

4. "D'un vieux jardin" (In an old garden), by Lili Boulanger, arr. Merz Trio

5. "Kiosks" by Léon Paul Fargue (reading)

6. Piano Trio in A Minor -- I. Modéré, by Maurice Ravel

7. "My ink nicks," by Jean Cocteau (reading)

8. Zortziko - Fandango, by Lee Dionne

9. Piano Trio in A Minor -- II. Pantoum: Assez vif, by Maurice Ravel

10. "Now the Rain" by Alain-Fournier (reading)

11. "Matin" (Morning), by Mel Bonis

12. "Heures ternes" (Stagnant hours), by Nadia Boulanger, arr. Merz Trio

13. Piano Trio in A Minor -- III. Passacaille: Très large, by Maurice Ravel

14. "La petite auto" (The little car), by Guillaume Apollinaire (reading)

15. Piano Trio in A Minor -- IV. Final: Animé, by Maurice Ravel

16. "I write for the day," by Anna de Noailles (reading)

17. "La plus que lente" (Slow waltz), by Claude Debussy, arr. Merz Trio

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand you might not be in a position to contribute, but we'd so appreciate if you took a few minutes to share this campaign by word of mouth, email, text, or social media (Indiegogo share tools make it easy)!

Thank you for reading about this project and sharing it with others in your circle!
story_txt: UPDATE We have been overwhelmed by the generosity and support of our community since our campaign launched on Monday. Our initial goal was almost met within the first 24 hours! A heartfelt thank  you to everyone who has contributed towards our debut album - we really can't wait to share it with you in June. AND it's not too late to support this project! Any additional funds above our initial goal will go towards our stretch goal of an additional $4000 to fund an exciting music video we'll be producing later this spring featuring one of the pieces on the album, Matin, by the  French composer Mel Bonis. For this project, we'll be working with the inspiring director Jon Levin (who you can find out more about here: https://www.jon-levin.com) and a team of wonderful collaborators. We can't wait to see what this collaboration produces, and we hope that the video will be an eloquent companion to the album. We're deeply grateful for any support you might be able to give in helping us bring this video, or our album, to life!  Short Summary INK Merz Trio's Debut AlbumINK is a conversation between music and words.
