story:
One percussion instrument is identified per letter of the alphabet through beautiful illustrations – that’s 26 different percussion instruments.

The accompanying music CD brings the book to life through world beats and rhythms, as it recites the book aloud and plays each instrument.

Growing up, I drove my parents crazy by beating on anything I could find, i.e., dinner table, car seat, soda bottles, etc.  I became intrigued with the different sounds that can be made from basic, everyday items and would line them up (when I could) to create my own household appliance Ensemble.  


When I went to Junior High school, I joined the Concert Band and was exposed to new and different percussion instruments.  I quickly realized that, like me, people around the world created these instruments out of the different materials in their physical environment.  

Having the opportunity to play many of these instruments, I thought it would be great to write a book that will introduce many of them in an easy-to-read children’s book and hopefully inspire the next great generation of percussion players.

There are many great perks to include autographed copies of the book, posters and tee shirts.  However, the most exciting perks involve an exciting Reading Party where children will meet Uncle Devin and get to play the instruments first hand or select an opportunity to have Uncle Devin give a private performance for your little one or another organization of your choice.

The Uncle Devin Show provides a high quality, live musical entertainment experience for children through the drum, both traditional and electronic, to convey universal principles of love. It is a wonderful experience!

We need to raise $14,500 and this is how we will use it:

Printing, Music CD production and Illustrations - $10,000

Fulfillment of packages - $3,000

Indiegogo and Crowd Funding Management Fees - $1,500

Any amount raised beyond this goal will be used for marketing of this book. 

Join me as we inspire the next generation of musicians by supporting our Indiegogo Campaign and sharing this information in your social media networks.  Together, we can take the children’s music industry to a higher level.

story:
• If your desire is to keep the heart of *True Funk Music*  alive.... then help this unique and funky group produce a new Video Album with new unreleased songs that specialize in Funk, Rhythm, and Rock.  
  • "Our goal is to produce 12 new songs that captures the essence of true funk music", says lead vocalist Dawn Silva, and every song will be a funk filled masterpiece - with no commercial fillers.   Yes, Funk Music and all of its melodic melody's are the Rolls Royce of the music industry, and recreating the elements does not come cheap.  "Once you had the best, it's hard to settle for anything less."  
  • The Brides of Funkenstein are campaigning to raise funds to produce a new Video Album, single downloads, and Vinyl, and then traveling to perform live and in living color, at a city or a country near you.
  •  Is this campaign goal impossible in this day and age?  "Not at all!"  Says Dawn.  "We are One Nation Under a Funky Groove, with more than 5 million Funk Fans world wide!  Funk Fans will unite!"  Help the Brides with their NEW video music project, and bring these Sister Soldiers - to a city or country near you!  ONE NATION!    

  • No Credit Card?  Send a certified Money order - or postal money order to ~~> Dawn Silva  C/O The Brides of Funkenstein Fan Club 7485 Rush River Drive Suite #710-374 Sacramento California 95831
  • Email:  Thebridesoffunkenstein@yahoo.com

Who Are THE BRIDES OF FUNKENSTEIN?

Original  members of The Brides of Funkenstein were Dawn Silva & Lynn Mabry.  They toured and recorded with the legendary Sly Stone, and played an integral role during the heyday of the seminal funk group Parliament-Funkadelic, touring and singing on countless hit records as well as providing vocals for Guitarist Eddie Hazel's Album, Game, Dames and Guitar Thangs.  P-Funk leader George Clinton produced the debut album Funk Or Walk, selling more than 300,000 copies in the first week after its release, with the single "Disco To Go" topping the Billboard R&B charts at number #7 and certified gold in the USA.   Dawn & Lynn would receive a Record World Award for Best New Female Group.

The Brides' second album Never Buy Texas From A Cowboy was called one of the top 50 coolest albums of all time by Rolling Stone Magazine.  The group morphing into a trio, with former Bridesmaids, Sheila Horne and Jeanette McGruder, joining Dawn Silva on sell out shows, and together winning  "The Best New Female Group" from (The Cashbox Rhythm & Blues Award).

For 2015, Dawn and Jeanette will be joined by their legendary funky friends in the studio, on the stage, nationwide and worldwide.  

So take a Second Honeymoon Ride with the Brides... 

THE BRIDES ARE:

Dawn Silva:

Dawn Silva's career started as a backup vocalist with Sly And The Family Stone.  She worked and toured with The Gap Band, collaborated with and supported artists that included Ice Cube, Coolio, B.B. King, Roy Ayers, and more. 

Her first solo album, All My Funky Friends (Musisoft, 2000) was hailed as the first authentic funk record to be released in decades, earning this funky diva European license deals in France, Holland, Germany, and Belgium.  Dawn is truly one of the originators of funk.

Jeanette Washington-Perkins:

Jeanette Washington Perkins, was one of the main backing vocalists for Parliament, making her debut performances on the Funkadelic albums; Hard Core Jollies & Cosmic Slop.  She was one of the first females to tour and record with Parliament Funkadelic., and was one of the first female artists to receive a writing credit for a song called, "Funking To The Edge Of Time" featured on the album, "Play Me Or Trade Me"  Jeanette was an original member of the Brides Sister group, Parlet and is now a member, and lead vocalist for The Brides of Funkenstein.

What We Need & What You Get:

The quality of this campaign starts with a remake of the 70's Funkadelic song *I Betcha* produced by Jesse Johnson former musician and guitarist for The Time and Prince.  This remake features the talents of vocalist Dawn Silva & her funky friends. 

This campaign is all about the fans and lovers of true funk music; for there is a difference between recording a project labeled *The Funk* - and a project that is basically called *Funky*.  All true funk soldiers know the difference.  We will be transparent on the donations you give us, as well as how we spend the funds, and what the benefits are to you as fans of Dawn Silva & The Brides of Funkenstein.    We will not skimp on quality.  Everything - from concert dates to the music, to merchandising will be top notch, and we pledge to give you the value you deserve.    We ask you, fans and soldiers of the Funk, to support our efforts, and in return we will give you the best products possible.  Our goals are a new DVD Album of 12 new songs, Concert Dates, Vinyl, T-Shirts, Specialty Ring Tones, single Downloads and more.

All that is offered here as part of this campaign is exclusive to Indie GoGo fans and is not available anywhere else.

Fundraiser Packages:

Donate $5 - if you Love Funk - put five on it!

Donate $10   We will list you on The Brides website with a personal Thank You, and send you a *Free* download of the Funkadelic single remake *I Betcha* featuring Dawn Silva & Funky Friends, Produced, Recorded, Mixed and Arranged by guitarist Jesse Johnson formerly of the Time & Prince camp. (email required)

Donate $25  And we will send you an autographed Poster signed by Dawn Silva which features Dawn Silva & Sly Stone.

Donate $50  We will send you a limited edition Dawn Silva and Sly Stone  autographed poster and a Brides of Funkenstein T-Shirt (TBOF)

Donate $125  We will send you a Poster, Dawn Silva's debut CD ~ All My Funky Friends ~ A Brides of Funkenstein T-Shirt and a *Free* download of the Funkadelic remake I Betcha featuring Dawn Silva & Funky Friends, Produced by guitarist Jesse Johnson Formerly of the Time!

Donate $250 And The Brides of Funkenstein will send you a special surprise party package!!

Donate $500 And we will send you the New Brides of Funkenstein Second Honeymoon Video Album, The Dawn Silva debut CD ~ All My Funky Friends - (5) New Brides Ring Tones a custom autographed Black & White Brides promo photo ~ Poster ~ and a *Free* download of the Funkadelic remake *I Betcha* featuring Dawn Silva & Funky Friends! Produced by guitarist Jesse Johnson formerly of the Time!

Donate $1000 And you will receive two concert tickets to see the Brides of Funkenstein perform in your city, or the city or country of your choice. You will receive (two) New Music Video Albums, plus full back stage access at the concert. You and a guest will be Chauffeured to dinner with The Brides of Funkenstein immediately following the concert. (Flights & transportation to the concert not included)

Donate $5500 And you will receive all that is listed in this campaign, plus spend (2) full days in the recording studio with The Brides, as well as making a cameo appearance with the Brides in their *new* video! Plus your photo and credits will appear on the Brides new Video Album! Plus an exclusive dinner with Dawn Silva of the Brides! (Hotel & Flights included)
The Impact

By taking part in this project you are helping us to change how we support our music and fund our tours.   You are putting faith in us to come through with an outstanding product.  You will have the opportunity to participate in the production, and also the opportunity to experience this extraordinary group during their live concert performances.  The impact is huge!  Together we can reopen the doors to this genre of music; restoring *The Funk*  and taking it back to its rightful place in main stream America and globally.    The level of responsibility is so much higher this time, and we will not settle for “just good enough” - we wont take any shortcuts, and above all – the money we raise in this campaign will be reflected in the final product.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word and no donation amount is too small.  Tell your family and friends and let them know about our campaign project.   By sharing and posting our campaign link through social networks, you are reaching places we would never be able to reach.  Thank you Dawn Silva & The Brides of Funkenstein!!

(email required)

Donate $50  We will send you a limited edition Dawn Silva and Sly Stone  autographed poster and a Brides of Funkenstein T-Shirt (TBOF)
Donate $125  We will send you a Poster, Dawn Silva's debut CD ~ All My Funky Friends ~ A Brides of Funkenstein T-Shirt and a *Free* download of the Funkadelic remake I Betcha featuring Dawn Silva & Funky Friends, Produced by guitarist Jesse Johnson Formerly of the Time!
Donate $250 And The Brides of Funkenstein will send you a special surprise party package!!
Donate $500 And we will send you the New Brides of Funkenstein Second Honeymoon Video Album, The Dawn Silva debut CD ~ All My Funky Friends - (5) New Brides Ring Tones a custom autographed Black & White Brides promo photo ~ Poster ~ and a *Free* download of the Funkadelic remake *I Betcha* featuring Dawn Silva & Funky Friends! Produced by guitarist Jesse Johnson formerly of the Time!
Donate $1000 And you will receive two concert tickets to see the Brides of Funkenstein perform in your city, or the city or country of your choice. You will receive (two) New Music Video Albums, plus full back stage access at the concert. You and a guest will be Chauffeured to dinner with The Brides of Funkenstein immediately following the concert. (Flights & transportation to the concert not included)
Donate $5500 And you will receive all that is listed in this campaign, plus spend (2) full days in the recording studio with The Brides, as well as making a cameo appearance with the Brides in their *new* video! Plus your photo and credits will appear on the Brides new Video Album! Plus an exclusive dinner with Dawn Silva of the Brides! (Hotel & Flights included)The Impact 
By taking part in this project you are helping us to change how we support our music and fund our tours.   You are putting faith
in us to come through with an outstanding product.  You will have the opportunity to participate in the production, and also the opportunity to experience this extraordinary group during their live concert performances.  The impact is huge!  Together we can reopen the doors to this genre of music; restoring *The Funk*  and taking it back to its rightful place in main stream America and globally.    The level of
responsibility is so much higher this time, and we will not settle for “just good
enough” - we wont take any shortcuts, and above all – the money we raise in
this campaign will be reflected in the final product.

   
Other Ways You Can Help

 



Spread the word and no donation amount is too small.  Tell your
family and friends and let them know about our campaign project.   By sharing and posting our campaign link through social networks, you are reaching places we would
never be able to reach.  Thank you Dawn Silva & The Brides of Funkenstein!!

story:
Students of Music City Strings have been given a fantastic, rare opportunity that could literally change their lives forever. However, in order to do this they need your support right now! Time is running out, and these students are working so hard to make this dream a reality. 

WHAT IS MUSIC CITY STRINGS?


Music City Strings is a community of students, teachers, and parents who believe in the importance of an enriched and thorough music education. In 2005, Dana Meyer, International concert violinist and violist, established Music City Strings in Franklin, Tennessee. Her dream was to create a program that would provide children the means to become confident, sensitive and beautiful artists. As her studio demands grew she invited Frank Auer, a violinist and teacher from Franklin, to be a co-director of the program. Today, that program consists of 45 young students in violin and viola, ranging from beginner to advanced levels. Ages range from four to eighteen years old, with many siblings, parents, and grandparents participating in everyday scheduled events. 

MUSIC CITY STRINGS PERFORMS

Students of Music City Strings have performed all over Tennessee, and many have traveled across the United States to study at Suzuki Institutes and workshops. Since the year of its inception, students from Music City Strings have been Young Artist Achievement Award winners through the National Association of Music Teachers competitions, winners of the Nashville Symphony Thor Scholarship,
Middle Tennessee Suzuki Association scholarship recipients, and first place State winners in the Tennessee Music Teachers’ Association program.

The benchmark performance of Music City Strings was their appearance in the International Ensembles concert at the Suzuki Association of the Americas Conference in Minneapolis, Minnesota, in May of 2012. They were one of only three studios chosen in North and South America and the first studio ever invited from the South! They astounded an audience of 2,000.  

MUSIC CITY STRINGS GETS DISCOVERED

Because of their amazing performance at the International Ensembles Concert in Minneapolis, Minnesota, in May of 2012, Music City Strings was discovered by The League of Astonishing Strings and has been invited on a performing tour of Europe on July 15th of this year.

The League of Astonishing Strings is a group that seeks to partner with only the most outstanding student groups in North America. Music City Strings is one of only three youth string ensembles in the nation invited to be a part of this tour and has been asked to represent the culture and music of Tennessee on the stages of Spain, France, England and Scotland.


WHY A TOUR?

The best way to help students gain new perspectives and build skills for the future is through experiential learning. Obviously, there are benefits to educational travel. Students who travel are immersed in foreign languages, become inspired by new and exciting experiences abroad, and encounter historical landmarks and world geography firsthand.

For the students of Music City Strings, the opportunity to connect with people of another culture through the universal language of music is truly a unique educational experience. These students will be engaging audiences all over Europe, and will be collaborating with other young and talented ensembles as well. The process of preparing a musical tour program of this magnitude requires discipline, dedication, and hard work. The experience of performing on tour broadens the student musician in a way that nothing else can and gives that student an opportunity to share their passion and joy for music in a different cultural context.


HOW CAN I HELP?

Our heart’s desire for every one of these precious students is that they will be able to take part in this life changing opportunity! To make that happen, we need your financial support so that every child can go on this tour. Please partner with us and make Music City Strings the pride of Nashville and of the great state of Tennessee! 


THANK YOU!!!

story:
NUOVE ARMONIE 


Nuove Armonie (lit. 'New Harmonies') is an ambitious project that aims at bringing to light the talent of young musicians and composers.

Contemporary music has the ability to continually feed creative appetites, producing original and exciting art, and reaching a wide audience. Nuove Armonie champions the talents of emerging composers, and gives them the opportunity to have their work performed by the Janus Ensemble, an outstanding ensemble of young musicians. 

What we do

In September 2014, we started an orchestra - the Janus Ensemble - made of young and enthusiastic performers to provide them with an opportunity to gain valuable orchestral experience at a very high standard. We wanted to offer them a professional experience - we wanted our musicians to be paid for their hard work, for which they have studied intensively for years. 

Nuove Armonie is a project run by the ensemble : there are hundreds of talented composers, working hard for a chance to have their pieces performed. It’s very likely that thousands of extraordinary inventive pieces have never been performed - and probably never will. This is why Nuove Armonie was born: we want to be a Diaghilev, we want to perform unheard music and find the new Stravinsky, and we want to commission new pieces to emerging composers to rejuvenate the musical panorama in the UK and beyond. 

After the success of our first concert  (http://www.nuovearmonie.co.uk/concerts/4586801844 ) and of our international 'call for scores', which has attracted hundreds of submissions by emerging composer, we are now in the process of programming our first 'season', starting in September 2015.


What we need

The artistic ambition of this project can only be realised through donations from individuals at this present moment whilst arts funding applications are being processed. 

We are planning 6 concerts for the upcoming 2015/16 season; if we manage to reach the goal of the campaign, we will be able to hire a venue for all 6 concerts and cover fees like instrument hire, commissions of new compositions, printing and marketing costs. Basically, all the necessary to make the concerts happen!

Every small donation will help us achieve our goal, and if you're not able to donate you can help us...by spreading the word about Nuove Armonie!


For more information about us, visit www.nuovearmonie.co.uk or follow us on Twitter @JanusEnsemble

story:
To be a songwriter is to be courageous, vulnerable, transparent, honest and uncensored. Much of this year involved these elements but they also involved surrender. Surrender to who I thought I was, what I thought I knew and who I actually am.

Following a full year of writing here in Toronto and Nashville, my producer [Stew Crookes], guitarist [Tom Juhas] and I have sculpted 60 demo songs - 12 of which will be recorded / completed this coming summer. Scheduled for a fall 2015 release we have also sculpted a dedicated, viral publicity and promotion plan. Now, with YOUR help this album will most definitely see the light of day. Perhaps through my stained glass lamps and many other perks !

With thanks to the Ontario Arts Council, Canada Council and our February 2015 album fundraiser auction we have raised enough money to cover our studio, session musician and mixing costs but still require a sizeable amount of money to master, duplicate and publicize the record. This includes stellar music videos, live videos, hired publicity firms, grassroots poster campaigns, radio Ads and serviced radio tracking in domestic and international markets.


Additional expenses include:

Producer

Session musicians

Studio costs

Mixing

Mastering

Studio catering

CD / Vinyl duplication

Publicity Campaign

Radio tracking & Radio ADs

Grassroots postering campaign

Official Music Video

12 Live videos


REGENT PARK Initiative : As part of this fundraiser, we have also partnered with the Regent Park School of Music. Regent Park offers affordable / highly subsidized music lessons for Toronto youth. Not only do they foster healthy musical expression but they provide a wonderful social outlet for Toronto youth. With that, $5 from every donation will go towards Regent Park to ensure their longevity in our community. If you would like to learn more about Regent Park please visit http://rpmusic.org

I would like to thank EVERYONE for their constant support these past few years. I would cease to exist without your constant encouragement :) - JADEA


WWW.DARTHJADEA.COM

story:
My Transformation

Over the years I have a grown a lot. Actually, a lot is an understatement. Looking at who I am now compared to who I used to be, I'm an entirely different person. The transformations I've gone through over the years have been personal, professional, and spiritual  - ranging from a change in my musical direction, to run-ins with the law and police raids, giving up meat and dairy completely to embrace a plant based diet, swearing that I would never get married... and then getting married, to most important of all, my spiritual transformation: getting baptized in the Atlantic Ocean and becoming a follower of Christ. For the first time in my life, I have absolute confidence in the path I'm on and the direction I'm headed. What I ask for is your involvement to get me to my destination.


Why I'm Doing This

Although I’ve landed some pretty awesome placements on TV and film, (check out those images above, I've had my music in all that stuff) I’ve never really been able to reach an audience and make a difference - my ultimate goal. Having my songs in TV shows and commercials is really cool and I’m grateful for each opportunity, it has however been a catch 22: looks great on my resume, but no one knows it’s my music!

And that’s why I’m redirecting my focus and getting you involved. I’ve got to get the word out. My old strategy ("I can do everything by myself and don't need help from anyone") doesn’t work. It’s also not fun doing everything by myself! 


My Impact 

Music is a powerful tool and I don’t want to squander the gifts I’ve been given on selfish achievements. No longer separating my faith from my career, I can fill an area of the EDM market I don’t see at the mainstream level. With your support, I’ll be able to reach a large audience who are on the fringe of a relationship with God. This is a great opportunity for me to be light to others and actually make a big difference. I get excited about excelling with a higher purpose in mind. 

That being said, I'm fully aware of a majority who find this a meaningless afterthought... it’s strictly about the music. And with respect to the latter, I completely agree - the music has to be excellent. I don't expect anyone to listen to something that isn’t good. And if that sounds like you, don't worry! I've got you covered. The tracks I've made for this EP blow everything else I’ve done out of the water. I don't have it in my bones to put out a mediocre product! 


What it Takes to Make this Happen

I've assembled an incredible team who can make this EP a real success. All the key people are in place, I just need to pay them so they can to do their jobs. In order to do that, I need to raise $25,000. Below is a detailed breakdown of my budget and how your contributions will be spent:

$9,000 - Marketing, Promotion & PR.
$5,500 - Music video
$3000 - Mixing & Mastering
$3000 - Merchandise Manufacturing 
$1000 - Legal fees
$500 - Artwork/graphic design
$500 - Photos 
$500 - Shipping expenses & Postage
$2000 - IndieGoGo's cut + 3rd party CC processing


What Do You Get in Return? AWESOME STUFF!

In exchange for your generosity, I’ve put together twenty awesome perks for you. Some include merchandise and others are fun experiences relating to things I love to do. 

***Every perk includes a high-quality digital download of the Transform EP.***


My Challenges & Your Impact

Asking for help has never been something I've been comfortable with, let alone good at. But, I know that I can't do this on my own. One thing I am good  at however, is achieving goals that I set for myself. I don't quit when I set my mind to something and I certainly won't give this project anything less than 100% of my effort. 

When you contribute to my campaign, your impact is profound. Not only does it mean the world to me, but it gives me the fuel I need to get the ball rolling - often the biggest hurdle in crowd funding. People’s confidence builds when they see others getting involved and follow their lead. Your contribution makes a BIG difference in reaching my goal, so I encourage you to jump in and swim… the water is warm!


STRETCH GOALS!!!!

If I over-fund my campaign, here's what I'll use the extra dough for:

If I raise $100,000, I will hand-write the entire Bible and document the experience. If someone bought the $15K perk I will be writing the Bible for them, however If no one buys that perk and I still raise $100K, I will handwrite the bible anyway, film the experience and make a documentary about it. When the Bible is complete I will auction it off and give all the money to charity. I would really love to do this!


3 More Ways You Can Get Involved!


Before you do anything, please leave a comment in the 'comments' tab! It helps bump up my campaign rank on the IndieGoGo so more people can see it.

Also, please SHARE, SHARE, SHARE this with all your family and friends.

  1. Post my campaign on your Facebook, Twitter, Instagram or whatever social media you use. IndieGoGo has lots of share tools on here that make it super easy for you to post on your socials.
  2. Tell your ALL friends and family, they listen to you!
  3. follow me on twitter and instagram, like my facebok page, and subscribe to my youtube channel. (links below)

facebook.com/ozwaldbozwald

twitter.com/ozwaldbozwald
instagram.com/ozwaldbozwald
youtube.com/user/ozwaldbozwald
soundcloud.com/ozwaldbozwald

Thank you!
-Ozwald Bozwald

story:
What Is 'Give Voice'? ~

'Give Voice' is my 2nd record and a very special project for charity.  I want to provide support and inspiration for those struggling with a major life challenge.  The songs I've written are inspired by different people that have something to voice but can't for one reason or another; a mute and deaf boy in a wheel chair, an Afghanistan girl who committed suicide as a protest for her freedom and a 9-year old boy with Autism. My mission is to create music to make a positive difference in the world.  

With this project, I plan on connecting each song with a respective charity such as Autism Speaks, The American Foundation for Disabled Children and Suicide Awareness Voices of Education and donate all the record sales proceeds to them.  I look to be involved with and create benefit performances and events for these charities and have these songs represent their cause.  I will reach out as far as I can so this record can have the impact it is intended to have.  I have also created a Give Voice Outreach Program which includes a music program for Autistic and special needs kids.   Either through lyric writing, melody creation or singing their own composition with the help of a trained team of music therapist and professional composer/vocalist, students will get to express their inner voice and personal story. We are working on implementing this program in various Autism Centers in the US.  If you give to this project, you will be involved from the ground level with something very special.  You will help others feel a connection through the power of music where they can hear their struggle and emotional life resonating in a song. Together, we can make a difference and give back with give voice.

Who Is the Artist~

Hi everyone!  I’m Carla Bianco and music is something I've been doing my whole life. I was born in a small town outside of Pittsburgh to immigrant Italian parents who understandably feared the hardships that come with a musician's life.  I had to be a disciplined motivating force for myself and take great leaps of faith toward a dream. My first gig was at 4 years old singing at a neighbor's graduation party where guests filled a Styrofoam cup with money.  I ran all the way home and thought 'this is pretty cool. maybe I could do this for the rest of my life'.  After hearing the sound of a piano in a Tom and Jerry cartoon, I felt a calling to play the instrument.  I taught myself how to play with my brother's accordian book & started writing songs at age 10.   I moved to NYC at age 20 on a wing and a prayer & landed a publishing deal with Jellybean Benitez, Madonna’s producer after waiting outside his office for 3 days.  It started an intense journey of ups and downs that have led me to this point in my career and life.  This ranged from working with the best people in the music business one moment to not being able to pay my rent the next.  Leaving NY for LA because there were no jobs after 9/11  to writing a Billboard #1 song.  From starring on Broadway to coming home and giving back to my community by helping to start a performing arts center.  Realizing after everything I had been through, I had never written and released a record which was what I always wanted to do.  So in 2012, I self-released my first album, ‘All This Time’ and released the record in 2014 distributed by BFD/Sony Red.  The record has created quite the buzz in the indie music scene with numerous reviews in international entertainment blogs, shows opening for artists like Kenny Loggins and achieving many chart placements and recognitions.  

With my first record out there and a dream fulfilled, I got deeper into my spirituality and stronger in my beliefs of what I think really matters during this short time here on this planet. And it all came down to Love; giving Love, healing, spreading light to others in whatever way possible. I got more involved with different charities like Cystic Fibrosis Foundation, Camp Southern Ground, Playing for Change Foundation, The American Lung Association and Toys for Tots performing and donating proceeds in an effort to help in any way I could.  I am inspired to continue my charitable efforts with you through the 'Give Voice' project.


What You Get ~

You will definitely get a bunch of great, unique perks!  Things like signed copies of pre-released CDs, T-shirts, autographed special RENT cast photos that no one else has, special songs and concerts written or performed just for you and your friends, a special invite to a private rehearsal, private coaching sessions with me at my studio, and credit in the CD liner notes, all the way up to ultimate VIP experience at the CD release show. But most of all, you will get the feeling of fulfillment that you have done something really good for someone who needs it.  And that is priceless.

 

What is Needed for the Project ~

$9,000 for recording, engineering, production, mixing and mastering

  • This includes compensation for amazing studio musicians

  • Renting studio space

  • Hiring a top notch recording engineer and producer

$1500 for manufacturing, duplication & distribution

$3500 for promotion

  • This is a very important element.  Once you get the record made, you want to be sure it gets out there so people hear it.  This will include anything from publicity, marketing, advertisements and charitable events to get the word out.

$1000 for making a professional music video for the 1st release from the EP

  • A strong visual element to the music will help spread the message!


The Impact ~
 
Your contribution is going to make all the difference!  With your generous contribution, Give Voice will finally become a reality and people across the world will be affected in an uplifting and positive way.  I think helping people means everything and is much needed in this life.  There are so many things at every turn of our existence that can bring us down.  I think it's the plight of being human.  We need to lift each other up so that we can all see the light at the end of the tunnel.  No matter how tough things get, I always come back to the same thing;   Love is the answer.   And in the words of The Beatles, 'All We Need is Love. Love is All We Need'.  By contributing to this project, you are spreading love & light to other human beings that may need it.  That is everything.  You can say you are creating good karma or doing what is right and good.  Whatever you call it,  it's a beautiful thing.  And it will spread far and wide.  

Risks & Challenges ~

I understand there is a chance we will not reach our goal.  If we don't raise all the money we need at this moment in time, I know we will find a way.  I may be an idealist but I have seen proof in my own life that all things are possible.  What I know is if you throw a rock in the water,  there will be a ripple.  This campaign and this project are the rock.  There will be ripples.  The bigger the rock, the bigger the ripple.  You can help make the rock a big one and the ripple effect monumental.   


Can't Contribute? ~

Help by promoting the campaign!

Ask your friends to follow on Facebook and Tweet about it!
story_txt:
What Is 'Give Voice'? ~
'Give Voice' is my 2nd record and a very special project for charity.  I want to provide support and inspiration for those struggling with a major life challenge.  The songs I've written are inspired by different people that have something to voice but can't for one reason or another; a mute and deaf boy in a wheel chair, an Afghanistan girl who committed suicide as a protest for her freedom and a 9-year old boy with Autism. My mission is to create music to make a positive difference in the world.  
With this project, I plan on connecting each song with a respective charity such as Autism Speaks, The American Foundation for Disabled Children and Suicide Awareness Voices of Education and donate all the record sales proceeds to them.  I look to be involved with and create benefit performances and events for these charities and have these songs represent their cause.  I will reach out as far as I can so this record can have the impact it is intended to have.  I have also created a Give Voice Outreach Program which includes a music program for Autistic and special needs kids.   Either through lyric writing, melody creation or singing their own composition with the help of a trained team of music therapist and professional composer/vocalist, students will get to express their inner voice and personal story. We are working on implementing this program in various Autism Centers in the US.  If you give to this project, you will be involved from the ground level with something very special.  You will help others feel a connection through the power of music where they can hear their struggle and emotional life resonating in a song. Together, we can make a difference and give back with give voice.
Who Is the Artist~
Hi everyone!  I’m Carla Bianco and music is something I've been doing my whole life. I was born in a small town outside of Pittsburgh to immigrant Italian parents who understandably feared the hardships that come with a musician's life.  I had to be a disciplined motivating
force for myself and take great leaps of faith toward a dream. story:
I came to the US with something in mind: I wanted to build a company to support artists and musicians from all around the world. With a fellow student from Berklee we have built the basis for a music discovery app. We have come this far with resources we have raised ourselves for almost 2 years, we even won a startup contest that gave us access to funds for the company! We now have the great opportunity to be working  with great co-workers from Berklee, MIT, and Emerson, and now we need your support for the next step to come.

In order to accomplish our next goal, I will be traveling for more than 7,000 miles during 110 days, to recruit the early artists and users we need in order to launch the app.

I'll be visiting New York, Chicago, Nashville, New Orleans, Austin, LA, Portland, Seattle, Miami, and of course, Boston, and if you know anybody that can help out with a a place to stay or anything please shoot me an email!

Your support is really important for us, and it will make our next dream possible.

Be sure to stay in tune on my blog, where I will be posting pictures and updates of all the adventures to come! www.songroove.com/blog/ 

And by supporting us you can become an early user yourself starting today at www.songroove.com

I greatly appreciate your support, and I'm looking forward to hear from you too!

story:
Who we are

Hello. My name is Joseph Gimbel. During the past 25 year, my wife Judy and my avocation has been to pass on the legacy of great classical music to our young people. For the past 8 years, I have served as a competition director focusing my efforts on conservatory bound young artists. Judy and I have gotten to work closely with a number of these talented and committed young people and seen first-hand the support they need during this stressful times in their lives; entering competitions, preparing for conservatory auditions and transitioning to the role of student at a top performance school.

We created Young Artist Performances, Inc., a 501(c)(3) public charity, to help these young people achieve their dreams of becoming  professional classical artists.  This year we have selected 4 nationally recognized musicians and invited them for  performance weekends on Hilton Head Island, where they will perform a program of great classical works for a knowledgeable and supportive audience.  We provide, meals, housing a professional accompanist, video and audio recordings and a post-concert reception in their honor.  We find them at least one additional performance venue during their stay, where they may perform their program a second time.  The weekend affords them a glimpse of the demands and rewards that a professional performance career brings.

Local donations for these concerts cover only a portion of our expenses.  The goal of our campaign is to provide each of these young artists with a full professional fee which they may use toward career development. If you wish, you may direct your donation to a particular artist by posting a private comment (button near top of the page), or emailing us at: YAP@gimbelassociates.com

Meet Our 4 Outstanding Young Artists

16 year old violinist, Katherine Woo, has won numerous competitions and has been the featured soloist with both the Hilton Head and Greenville Symphony Orchestras. She studies with Masao Kawasaki at the Juilliard School Preparatory Division in New York City. Katherine has appeared on a National Public Radio broadcast, From the Top. Katherine will use funds raised from this campaign to pay for travel expenses.

Learn more about Katherine.

18 year old, Cameron Lugo, has been the featured soloist with several professional orchestras and won many competitions, including the Music Teachers' National Association Southern Division on two separate occasions,  Cameron will use funds raised from this campaign, to help pay for a new instrument.
Learn more about Cameron.

16 year old Sterling Elliott was the winner of the 2014 Sphinx Competition (a major national competition) and has performed as a soloist with a number of orchestras, including the Cleveland Symphony Orchestra. Sterling has appeared on a National Public Radio broadcast, From the Top. Sterling will use raised funds to help pay for private study. Learn more about Sterling


15 year old Kaili Wang is a full scholarship student at Vanderbilt University’s Blair School of Music. She is the winner of the Tennessee Music Teachers Association competition and was the featured soloist in May with the Nashville Symphony.  Kaili will use raised funds for summer study and to help purchase a new bow.

Learn more about Kaili.


What We Need and What You Get

We are seeking funding beyond local donations and ticket sales to provide financial support for our young artists as they prepare for performance careers.  100% of the net proceeds of this campaign will go directly to Cameron, Kaili, Katherine and Sterling.  Preparing to be accepted into a major music conservatory is expensive!  Private instruction can cost upwards of $100/hour not including travel expenses (Katherine Woo, for example pays for round trip bus tickets from Greenville SC to New York City EACH WEEKEND to study at Juilliard.)  Summer residential study at top music festivals such as Aspen, where young artists meet and collaborate with top professional artists, usually cost in excess of $5000.  Instrument maintenance may run $1000 a year or more.  And travel expenses to audition for conservatories costs thousands more.  Young artists incur all of those costs BEFORE having to pay for tuition, room and board to attend a top school.  So while our goal is to raise $4000, and divide it between our four musicians, funding beyond that goal would be of immediate use to them



The Impact

2015 - 2016 will be Young Artist Performances 2nd season. During our first year, we were able to provide six young artists performance opportunities, which supported them with more than $3000 in artistic fees.

Shannon Fitzhenry, a freshman violin major at Peabody had this to say about her experiences here “Performing in the welcoming environment of the Gimbel’s has to be one of my favorite concert experiences to date.” 

Eric Tsai, winner of the 2014 MTNA national competition commented, ” During my several visits to Hilton Head Island for different competitions and concerts, Mr. and Mrs. Gimbel’s support, encouragement, and advice have been a positive influence on my growth as a musician. Creating performance opportunities for talented young people is really worthwhile and deserves the support of people in the community.”

Keeping classical music alive in the USA requires that our best young musicians, be encouraged to follow their dream of becoming a professional artist, whether an orchestra member, chamber musician or soloist.  This is your chance to help.

Other Ways You Can Help

We will appreciate donation no matter how large or small. However we are aware that some people are unable to support us financially.  You can still help.  Email a link to your friends who might be able to help us and organizations that might be interested in assisting us while promoting their operation at the same time.  Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

Hello, my name is Ian Collins.  AKA Polarus.  I've been playing around with music as a hobby for a long time now.  This point in time in my life I'm taking a more serious approach with music production and song writing.  My campaign is an attempt to help get my first serious project off and going!  This is very important to me because this is a means for me to show my talent and passion off to you, the public.  I have a lot of things to say and feelings, and emotions to project to you.  Your contributions to this project can be an enormous stepping stone for me to give you exactly what you all have probably been waiting for in music. My musical influences are: Outkast, Nas, Pac, Jay Z, DJ Quik, Snoop, Pharrel, Dre, Erykah Badu, Jannelle Monae, Prince, MJ, Parliament,   Genres like: New Age, Rock, alternative, Reggae, Jazz, Jazz fusion.

  My Project will be a fusion of all these, hence the title COLD FUSION!

My goal is to raise $2000.  The majority of the funds will go toward studio time.  The average cost of studio time ranges anywhere between $30 to $50 an hour.  Depending on the complexity, a song's production could take up to 3 hours.  So you can see how the money could add up.  There will be a total of 11 Songs in this project. Also there's Photos and CD duplication and CD art.  The CDs will be given as a gift to all those who choose to contribute.  The albums will also be available on Itunes for purchase for those who do not contribute.  Even If I don't reach my entire goal, whatever is contributed will be used for as much of the recording, mixing and mastering as possible, as this is the most important part of the project.

If you cant contribute you can still help by sharing this campaign and getting the word out using Indiegogo share tools!  Any way you can help will be gratefully appreciated. Thanks for your time and have a wonderful day.

story:
Thanks for taking the time to watch our video. We had fun putting it together, Normally we are not a fan of these campaigns or crowd sourcing. However, this time around we need a little help. 

This summer we are hitting the road and recording our first full length album in a decade! 

For years we have been asked by the fans, some of which have become great friends, for more music and another tour. It is your guys' undying support and interest, combined with our passion for music, that sparked this reunion. We have always been known for our live shows, and that has not changed. 

What Your contributions will go towards.

 

  • Reliable tour van
  • Equipment Trailer 
  • Recording a new full length album. 


As a band we have never been 100% happy with any recording we have put out. We feel that if we are going to do this, it is only fair to you guys that we do it right. You guys deserve a full length album recorded at today's standards. Which is exactly what you will get from John Haddad (trench studios), the producer selected for our next album. 

Perks  


We want to give you guys the record we've always felt you deserved. We want to bring you a live show that will make you lose your mind and forget about life's stresses for a night. We are all sacrificing a lot for the sake of this band, because you guys have shown us that it is worth it. Unfortunately, we are falling a bit short financially to do it alone. 

Other ways you can help. 

If you cannot contribute, we totally understand. But if you share this campaign on your social media and inform your friends who may also be fans... That's just as good in our eyes and we thank you all ahead of time. We hope to see you guys real soon.

-- Summer's End

story:
New Album of Inspiring Music :: Illumination


Creating music that inspires, uplifts, and heals is my passion. My name is Cora Flora, and I am a musician from Canada with a new album that I'm super excited to share - it's called Illumination. 

After years of songwriting, development, and exploration this new album (my 5th) is  finally ready to be completed with evolved soundscapes, deep inspiration, and an amazing recording opportunity. 

I'm creating this Indiegogo campaign with the intention that it aligns with more people who this music can inspire while also fundraising for the completion and printing of this new album.

  • The funding is for the recording, mixing, mastering, and printing of this album. approximate costs: studio $500, mixing & mastering $1000, printing $900. 
  • All pledges for my previous campaign for this album will be honoured, and I'm offering new perks in case you feel inspired to help this one come to full fruition, including house concerts, intuitive coaching sessions via Skype and a song written just for you (or someone you love)! :)
  • If I exceed my goal I'll be able to focus on promoting this new album with advertising, radio promotion, and new exciting merchandise. If I don't reach it I will still do this but explore other ways to do what I feel so deeply called to do. 



The Impact


This album is my leap out of singer-songwriter playing personal songs, expanding into free flowing inspired channeling that transcends my self to share messages that bless, heal, and inspire. The songs harmonize with my life experience and soul awakening - supporting listeners (co-creators, really) in blooming expansion.
I've already made 4 full length albums and truly feel his is my best one yet, and it is going to feel so good to finally have it out there! My goal is to have this album complete by early June so that I have the new album in hand for my upcoming touring in Canada and Europe. (http://www.corafloramusic.com/events.html)


Other Ways You Can Help


If you feel interested in this album but arenas in a place to contribute financially, you can also help by sharing this campaign with you friends, joining my YouTube channel (http://www.youtube.com/coraflora888), and checking out my music (http://www.corafloramusic.com/music.html)! 


Thank you for your amazing support and love!


Cora
story_txt:

Creating music that inspires, uplifts, and heals is my passion. My name is Cora Flora, and I am a musician from Canada with a new album that I'm super excited to share - it's called Illumination. 
After years of songwriting, development, and exploration this new album (my 5th) is  finally ready to be completed with evolved soundscapes, deep inspiration, and an amazing recording opportunity. 
I'm creating this Indiegogo campaign with the intention that it aligns with more people who this music can inspire while also fundraising for the completion and printing of this new album.

story:
Short Summary

Inspired by bigger cities, Gloucester had its first paint jam event.

  • The Brunswick is one of the most iconic venues in Gloucester
  • We are trying raise the money to keep the Brunswick alive and open.
  • Every penny we raise will ensure the Brunswick can stay open and available to the public, tourists and the close community.

Gloucester is a city rich in culture and now is embracing the art and music of the less mainstream. 

What We Need & What You Get

In shorn

  • At the end of the day, it is a pub and business with a fantastic food element being developed
  • In our city, you will not find another venue with the art, outlook and atmosphere. This is truly a venue for the people.
  • As before, every penny put forward is just as important in keeping the Brunswick open and alive, its not about the end figure
  • And just so you know, the more money raised the more perks will become available

The Impact

We are developing a unique product with the Brunswick, a place for all. No expectations

  • The world of the street artist is one that is under appreciated, We have one of the best around, who was responsible for the complete outside of the venue.
    •  
  • We were much the focus of the recent Gloucester paint jam event, showcasing artists from all around the country. The event was supported by many musical artists who you will not have come across but will regret missing out on.

Risks & Challenges

 The Brunswick, as i have said, is a business at the end of the day and has all the risks involved with it.

  • Myself, I have a ream with many many years of experience in street art and music promotion.
  • Working hard together we intend to to put together all year round art and music events to move the soul..

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Money is not the be all and end all, just visiting the Brunswick on facebook and liking the page has an enormous effect on our place within th town.

and please dont forget the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
HI I my name is Fred Kellogg. I am a musician, writer, and community radio programmer at KAOS 89.3 FM. I have been doing my show 'Free Jazz with Fred' since May 1999. I am also a beat boxer and have performed on several occasions at the Olympia Experimental Music Festival and have performed as well with my improv/rock band 'The Giant Worm' (we will be performing this year).

This is my second year as curator for the Experimental Music Festival, now in it's 21st year. It is important to me because one of the main functions of art is to present different visions of the world. In this case, through experimental music. There is no such thing as any one way to create or perform music. Each artist has their own distinct expression of order. It is not and should not be the market or (necessarily) traditional academic channels as a source or force. Thus the experimental music festival is one opportunity for artists with different visions and expressions of order to perform. And the prime purpose of this campaign is to raise funds so that the artists can receive reasonable compensation for performing.

 I have a funding goal of $2000. I have 17 acts-some bands, some individuals. I have a number of rising stars on the Seattle alternative jazz scene, including the Samantha Boshnack Quintet and Bad Luck. While most performers have not received a guaranteed amount for performing, I would like to have everyone go home with at least $25.  The Indiegogo campaign is the primary source of funding, although I will also have local business's advertising on the festival program and, of course, there will be revenue received from ticket purchases. I have not yet determined what I will be charging for tickets. I should also note that while I certainly plan to have 'perks', I have not determined exactly what they will be and for what amount. I will determine that in the next few weeks. I would like the performers to donate CD's and/or videos for this purpose and I also plan to have some of our local business's provide a perk: Example: A Burger, Fries and Shake at Big Toms Family owned hamburgers stand here in Olympia. They have been a regular advertiser in our program for years 

 The festival will be held at two different venues here in Olympia. On Friday, June 26th, it will be held at The Grand Ballroom of the Olympia Eagles Club. I am renting this facility for $315 for the night. (the show starts at 7pm). I have someone providing a PA system, but I will probably need to rent lights. On Saturday, June 27th and Sunday June28th, the event will be held at Le Voyeur, a restaurant and performance space here in Olympia. (Saturdays show begins at 7pm and Sunday's show begins at 4pm). The performance space at Le Voyeur is being donated for the festival. I also plan to advertise in at least one NW music publication. I may also have to provide some accommodations to performers.

I realize there are any number of risks foreseeable and unforeseeable. How ever i do have a responsible team working with me and I have my previous experience as festival curator. I am familiar with both venues and have taken a number of concerns into consideration. I do want the legacy of the festival to continue, as it has become an institution in Olympia.

If you are unable to contrubte to the campaign, please spread the word on social media. We will be doing the same. And I do hope we do get a substantial live audience for our performer's.

Thanks in advance for what ever you can do to help me into continuing the legacy of the Olympia Experimental Music Festival!

Fred.

story:
We Are Dear Joe

In 2012 we released our full debut album, In Every Eye, and last year we gave you our latest single Call My Name. You find us on Spotify and iTunes and frequently on tour in mainly Germany, Netherlands and Belgium.

We are Dear Joe - Joel, Harald, Josefin and Johan. We now have another ten new songs to record so we can give you our second full album and we need your help. Mastering, printing and releasing is expensive and we don't have a big label behind us but we have you, our truly dearest fans.

Together with you we will be able to make a whole new album, a series of entertaining music videos and an even bigger tour. 

Our touring adventure started in June 2014 when we did a weekend tour in Germany. In August the same year we returned for a week long tour and again in October for a 10 day tour including the Netherlands. As of the February Tour we have been in Germany and the Netherlands five times during a nine-month period and August 15 through 29 we're back for the sixth time within a year. Look the August Tour up on Facebook or our website, www.dearjoe.se.

What Costs and How Can You Support

Recording music today costs almost nothing, as long as you have the gear, the equipment and the knowledge. We have all that. And you need to give yourself the time. We do that.

However, what do cost is mixing, mastering, printing and promotion and all this is very expensive for a small independent band. We will like to invite you to take part of every step of this journey and will document and post frequently on our website, Facebook page and here on Indiegogo.

These are our estimated budget:

Mixing 10 songs: €1500

Mastering full album: €1000

Printing 1000 albums: €1000

Promotion by agent: €3500

We are looking forward to this project that we have decided to dedicate to you, our fans. Through pre-ordering the next album, buy our mercy or old album, you will be part of funding that very next album and we promise we will do everything in our power to come to your hometown, your local stage, to play and entertain and sign albums.

And there's even more to it!! We promise to have an extra treat for you guys as we go down the road. Take a look at our perks and see if there's a package that fits your wishes. Or come with your own suggestion, we are all ears.

Why We Need You

This is new to us so we have no idea how this will end. Our experience is solely from our former releases of "In Every Eye" in 2012 and the single "Call My Name" from 2014. These we financed ourselves and it is a very big burden for only four people in today's hard environment with an almost non-exsisting record market.

It takes years for us to save up finances for all the different steps in the process, and we don't ask for help to pay our rent, our instruments nor our recordings. But we do think that with your assistance, we can produce this specific project together and steer it to land.

This is how our reality works nowadays, very few people buy any albums, instead you rent or subscribe for streaming music such as Spotify, LastFM or Apple Music. This means we have to work even harder to make our living and though some think this is unfair, we have rather realized that it makes us better as musicians and as a band. It makes us do even more frequently what we actually love doing: to go on tour and play our music live!!!

Other Ways You Can Help

We invite you to take part of this journey not only as financiers but also as viewers and fans. So go listen to our music and watch our videos, follow us on Facebook and Instagram and book us for your local stage.

You can also help us spread the word and this project via Facebook and other social media. Contribution is not only about money, it's just as much about telling your friends and the rest of the world about our music and how much you enjoy it. Link our singles and videos and link your personal favourites. We are forever in gratitude to you our beloved fans!!!
